loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy S. is a married woman who lives in Purok Orchids, Barangay Talagacay, Hinoba-an, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: she runs a general store; she also buys un-milled rice from farmers and after drying the grains, sends it to the rice mill for processing and sells the polished rice; and she raises and fattens pigs in her backyard. 

Her husband Ignacio S., who is 36 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have five children who are between the ages of 2 and 11 years old. One of the children has work, three are in school and the youngest is still at home.

Mercy joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 18 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Mercy has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 17,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of about $140, raising the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 19th cycle loan, she is borrowing 17,000 PHP, which she intends to add to her own working capital to fund her business operations so that she can continue to save up for her children's future education and for business expansion. Mercy S. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Ndula

texts.en:
Ndula R. is married and has one child whom he supports. Ndula was introduced to KADET by world vision staff. He is applying for his first loan and has never borrowed from any other Micro-Finance Institution. 

He has been in the livestock trade for ten years. He plans to use this loan to purchase more livestock to raise and sell later at a profit. His business is located in a busy open-air market with a high population. Hence he has many customers.
 
Ndula wants to grow his business. With the extra profits, he plans to open a butchery in the future and very much hopes to become a great businessman. He describes himself as innovative.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane N. lives in the Kawempe neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school.  
Jane has run a tailoring business for eight years. She works seven days a week selling her products in a retail shop. Jane has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from Kiva partner, MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more materials for making clothes. 
Jane's main business challenges are defaulters and the rainy season. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start a tailoring school and buy a plot of land. Jane lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but no access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more materials for making clothes

loans.name: Philemon

texts.en:
Philemon, a 38 year old, runs an auto spare parts and hardware shop. He mainly sells car spare parts and paints. He started running the business in 2005 and he has experienced a good flow of customers.  

He says that through Faulu Kenya, he has been able to invest in shares and has developed a saving culture. He hopes to grow his business into a wholesale one in the future. He has requested a loan of 65,000 Kenyan shillings to buy spare parts and paints.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and paint

loans.name: Grace Adjoa Nkrumah

texts.en: Grace Adjoa Nkrumah O. is married and has six dependants. She produces locally made soap and palm kernel oil at Abura for sale. Her husband is a pastor. Grace assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She will use the loan to purchase more palm kernels to produce oil for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Grace plans to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more palm kernels to produce oil for sale.

loans.name: Mrs. Ker Saroeun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The 18 people who make up this village bank loan live in Sman Pream village, Takeo province. Mrs. Ker S. is the village bank president. She has been selected by the other members who will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. 

She is a farmer and owns a small piece of land, which she uses to grow rice to sell to support her family. She is also a chicken breeder. Her husband, Mr. Ren Chan, is a soldier who gets a low salary. He uses his salary to support his family, too. They work hard, but still they can earn only a little income. So to improve her family's her income, Mrs. Ker S. is requesting a loan to purchase a cow for breeding to start a new business. She is a mother of three children, two of whom are employed at a garment factory, while the other is attending a local public school.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for breeding

loans.name: Para Siempre Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama: "Para Siempre", esta ubicado en el municipio de Tecoanapa guerrero, los integrantes del grupo decidieron ponerle este nombre puesto que eso es lo que ellos quieren que este grupo dure: para siempre.
Esta historia es acerca de la señora Emma G. H., ya que es la representante de este grupo, cuenta con 50 años de edad, ella es viuda, tiene 2 hijos, Maria del carmen de 22 y Genaro de 21 años de edad de los cuales los 2 estudian, la mayor esta cursando el segundo año de la licenciatura en ciencias políticas y el otro esta cursando el primer año de la carrera de maestro, Emma se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan.
Doña Emma se decidió por este negocio, ya que dice tiene mucha demanda y deja muy buenas ganancias, aparte de que quería buscar la forma de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, también para darles una buena educación de sus hijos, ella invirtirá su crédito en la compra de mas insumos como son: azúcar, manteca, harina, levadura y huevos y así tener una mejor producción y mas variedad de productos, para incrementar un poco mas sus ventas.
Ella dice que le está yendo súper bien con su negocio, tanto que esta empezando a ahorrar parte de las ganancias obtenidas de su negocio, para terminar de construir la cocina de su casa y para seguir apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios para que terminen su carrera profesional, también sigue invirtiendo en su negocio. 
Comenta que su negocio ésta beneficiando mucho a los vecinos de su colonia, ya que no hay muchas personas que se dediquen a esta actividad ahí cerca, así que como es la única que vende ahí y esta mas cerca, todos le compran a ella, aparte de la excelente atención y servicio que les brinda a sus clientes, además de sus buenos precios.
El sueño que tiene doña Emma es el de construir un local mas grande ahí mismo en su casa para ampliar un poco mas su negocio, ya que quiere poner una panificadora, para así tenerla mucho más surtida, para obtener mas y mejores ingresos y así poder continuar apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios superiores, para que tengan una muy buena profesión.
Nos dice que los integrantes de su grupo, son personas muy responsables y pagadoras ya que tienen tiempo de conocerse y se llevan muy bien, aparte de que son de la misma comunidad, es por eso que en ninguna ocasión se han atrasado o dejado de pagar su crédito, ya que no quieren defraudar la confianza que la empresa ha depositado en ellos.
Ella esta muy agradecida con fundación realidad y kiva por el apoyo del préstamo que le otorgaron ya que gracias a esto su negocio esta mejorando mucho y su vida y la de su familia también esta cambiando.
Los integrantes de para siempre y las actividades a las que se dedican son las siguientes: 
Emma G. H.-venta de pan
Jorgina H. G.-venta de pan
Ernesto L. R.-venta de ropa
Ricardo R. R.-venta de dulces
Quintina G. V.-venta de pan
Maria del Rocío L. M.-venta de chilate (bebida refrescante típica de la región echa de cacao, arroz y azucar)
Eridia G. L.-venta de cosméticos
Fredy S. H.-venta de pollos
Celsa G. V.-venta de ropa típica
Aurora M. M.-venta de antojitos
Josefina M. G.-venta de refrescos
texts.en:
This group is called “Forever”, and is located in the Tecoanapa Guerrero municipality.  The members came up with the name because that is how long they want the group to last:  forever.  This story is about Emma G. H., given she is the representative of this group.  She is 50 years old, and a widow with two children:  Maria del Carmen, 22, and Genaro, who is 21.  Both are in school; the oldest is in her second year of a Political Science degree, and the other is in his first year of studying for a teaching degree.  

Emma dedicates herself to making and selling bread.  She decided on this business because she says there is a lot of demand, and it generates a good income.  In addition, she wanted to find a way to improve her and her family’s standard of living and to provide her children with an education.

She will invest the loan into purchasing more ingredients such as: sugar, lard, flour, yeast and eggs, so she can increase production, offer a greater variety of products and to increase her sales.  She says that things are going very well with the business, so much so that she is putting aside some of her income to finish building the kitchen in her house and to continue supporting her children with their educations so they can embark on professional careers.  She also continues to invest in her business.

She comments that her business is benefiting her neighbors a great deal, since there are not many people who do what she does nearby.  Since she is close, they all buy from her.  In addition, she provides excellent attention and services to her customers and offers her products at a good price.

Emma’s dream is to build a larger locale in her own house, so she can expand her business.  She would like to open a bakery that she would have much better stocked so she could increase her earnings and pay for her children’s advanced degrees.  She tells us that the members of the group are very responsible and punctual with their loan payments, since they have gotten to know each other, get along well, and are from the same community.  For these reasons, they have never fallen behind or defaulted on their payments, as they don’t want to risk the trust that has been placed in them.  She is very thankful to the Foundation and to Kiva for the support of the loan granted to her since, thanks to this, her business is improving a great deal and it has changed their lives.  

The members of “Forever”, and the activities they carry out, are as follows:

Emma G. H. - Bread Sales 
Jorgina H. G. - Bread Sales 
Ernesto L. R.-  Sale of Clothing 
Ricardo R. R. - Candy Sales 
Quintina G. V. - Bread Sales 
Maria del Rocío L. M. - Sale of Chilate (a refreshing beverage of the region made from cacao, rice and sugar) 
Eridia G. L. - Cosmetics Sales 
Fredy S. H. - Poultry Sales 
Celsa G. V. - Clothing Sales 
Aurora M. M. - Sales of Sales 
Josefina M. G. - Beverage Sales

loans.use: To purchase lard, sugar, eggs, flour and yeast.

loans.name: Chhoeung

texts.en: Chhoeung S. is a 34-year-old married woman who lives in Siem Reap province. Before she was married, she began a business catching fish from the river. Now, her husband works with her in her fishing business. This is a great season; almost all of the fishermen are very happy that they can catch a lot of fish. But Chhoeung S. doesn't have all the essential machines and nets with which to fish, which is why she is requesting a loan via Kiva’s partner HKL to buy the required equipment.

loans.use: To buy machines, nets, and other fishing equipment

loans.name: Luz

texts.en: Luz M. owns and operates a store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in her community. She is 57 years old, widowed and has four school-aged children. They are from the village of Camul, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. Luz has been in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Luz joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Luz has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC which was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Luz is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be her third loan from PMPC. She plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Sattar

texts.en:
Sattar A. is from Imishli. He is 37 years old. Sattar is married and the father of one son aged 13. All his life Sattar was engaged in tilling the land. But when his family grew, expenses grew, too. That is why Sattar decided to start up a cattle-breeding business ten years ago. Nowadays to make a living, Sattar raises cows for breeding and there are eight cows in his farm now. He sells dairy products in the local bazaar. 

In January 2011, Sattar joined AqroInvest and requested a loan of 1800 AZN which was used to purchase livestock feed and three more cows. This is his first loan taken out through AqroInvest and Kiva. Sattar dreams of buying land and building his own farm in the future. He is very thankful to all for their support.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and three cows

loans.name: Luz Marleni

texts.es:
Luz  tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su esposo y su hija en el sector Urrunaga del distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz. Uno de los distritos más poblados de la región Lambayeque, caracterizado principalmente por tener altos índices de pobreza, ya que las personas viven generalmente en zona urbana marginal que carecen de servicios básicos.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa para niños en general, esta actividad la realiza hace dos años. Ella ofrece estos productos tanto al crédito como al contado y los ofrece en el exterior del mercado Atusparias de este distrito. Esta actividad es de mucha ayuda para la economía de su familia y se vale de ella para ayudar a su esposo con el mantenimiento de la economía diaria.

Luz desea adquirir más mercadería para ampliar su negocio ya que durante esta temporada la demanda por su negocio aumenta asimismo desea adquirir productos para la temporada escolar. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a realizar su objetivo.

Luz es una madre bastante trabajadora y empeñosa, las personas que le conocen admiran sus ganas de salir adelante y progresar.
texts.en:
Luz is 42 years old, married and lives with her husband and their daughter in the Urrunaga area of the José Leonardo Ortiz district. This is one of the most populated districts of the Lambayeque region and is characterized primarily by its high poverty index. Most of the people live in urban, marginalized zones that lack basic services. 

She sells clothing for children and she has been doing this for two years. Her clients can pay for the products on credit or with cash and she sells the products on the outside of the Atusparias market in this district. This business is very helpful to her family's financial situation and it's very important that she can help her husband support their family.

Luz wants to add more merchandise in order to expand her business because the demand has risen. Additionally, she wants to add more products for the school year. Because of this, she has decided to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 500 nuevos soles that will help her accomplish her goals. 

Luz is a hard-working mother and businesswoman. The people who know her admire her for her desires to progress and move ahead in life. 


.

loans.use: To acquire more merchandise in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Serwah

texts.en:
Serwah K. is a fish seller at the fishing village of Abee near Elmina. Before selling the fish she smokes it in a specially built oven. She has been doing this job for the past six years now. Her husband left her and she lives alone.

Serwah uses her income to take care of herself and pay for basic household expenses. Serwah wishes to use this loan to to buy more fish, and to buy more materials to smoke the fish, and hopes to reinvest any additional capital gained into her business. Her hope is to increase her profit by selling more fish, and to be able to save some money for the time when she won’t be capable to work anymore.

loans.use: to buy more fish to resell, and to buy more materials to smoke the fish

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel K. is 28 years old, married and blessed with two children. He is a wheat farmer in the Narok area and he has been in this business for the last seven years. 

Joel learned about KADET from one of our credit officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the money to buy farm inputs (fertilizers, etc.). He anticipates some profits which he will use to add a number of acres for planting and to start a livestock business.

His dream is to buy and build rental houses on many plots and to provide a better standard of living for his children. He is a conscientious man who aspires to achieve more if funded.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs (fertilizers, etc.)

loans.name: Handsuren

texts.en: Handsuren is 46 years old and lives with her husband and two children in their own apartment in the Narantuul area of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her older daughter, who is 23, attends college, while her youngest, who is 18, goes to a secondary school. Handsuren and her husband own a public-transportation service business in Ulaanbaatar. They started their business in 1998 with one minibus. Now they have several minibuses and employ several conductors. Their monthly earning is 65,000 MNT, and they pay 325,000 MNT of salary for one conductor. They are very diligent people who worked hard to stabilize their business for 13 years. Handsuren says that she would like to have their apartment certificate as soon as possible. She is requesting a 1,000,000-MNT loan to make repairs on her minibuses in order to transport people comfortably.

loans.use: to make repairs on minibuses

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Heng V., 36, is married and resides in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for its pre-Angkorean temples. V. is a farmer, earning an income of about $3 USD per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of $3 USD per day. Each month, the family has to spend $11 USD on food and $30 USD on other necessary expenses. V. is requesting a loan of $1,000 USD to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband to commute to work.

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
Juana tiene 27 años de edad y vive con su esposo e hijo en el Caserío Guaraguaos Alto en el Distrito Tambogrande – Piura. Clienta vive en la parte rural de este distrito.

El esposo de Juana es obrero de construcción y con su sueldo cubre los gastos familiares. Juana contribuye a los gastos familiares con el dinero ganado por la venta de productos de farmacia y también de gaseosas, jugos, bodoques, entre otros. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 2 años en  su propio domicilio en el cual atiende permanentemente.

Juana solicita un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería, como alcohol, algodón, gasas, vendas, etc. Que le permitirá seguir ampliando su negocio y los niveles de sus ventas aumentarán.

Juana en un futuro desea ampliar su tienda ofreciendo productos de mejor calidad y más variados. Juana goza de muy buenas referencias personales, por sacar de apuros, con sus productos,  a los clientes de su zona.
texts.en:
Juana is 27 years old and lives with her husband and son in the rural settlement Guaraguaos Alto in the Tambogrande-Piura district.  

Juana's husband is a construction worker and his income covers the family expenses.  Juana contributes to the family expenses with the money she earns selling pharmacy products as well as sodas, juices, bodoques [frozen treats served in plastic bags] among other things.  She has been constantly attending to this business for 2 years from her own house.  
 
Juana is requesting a loan through Edpyme Alternativa for 500 nuevos soles to purchase merchandise such as alcohol, cotton, gauze, bandages, etc.  This will allow her to continue expanding her business and increase her sales.  

In the future, Juana would like to expand her store and offer better quality products and a wider variety.  Juana has good personal references because she helps her customers during hard times with her products.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store such as alcohol, cotton, gauze and bandages.

loans.name: Kambeng Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité KAMBENG a été créé le 04 Mai 2010. Les membres habitent le même village. L'activité principale est la vente de bétail. 

Méta debout derrière à l'extrême droite de la photo et levant la main, est responsable du groupe de solidarité. Elle est âgée de 55 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. 

Elle achète des moutons qu'elle revend après embouche sur une période de 04 à 05 mois. 

Ce crédit lui permettra à acheter 03 moutons à emboucher.

Avec les recettes, elle va soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge familiale (nourriture et santé)
texts.en:
The solidarity group KAMBENG was created on May 4, 2010. The members live in the same village. The principal business is selling livestock. 

Méta (in the back on the far right, raising her hand) is the leader of the group. She is 55 years old, married, and the mother of five children. She buys sheep then resells them after fattening them for four to five months. 

This loan will allow her to buy three sheep for fattening. With her revenue, she will help her husband with famiL. expenses (food and health).

loans.use: to buy sheep to fatten for 4 to 5 months.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella works hard to support her family. She is married and has an electronics repair business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years.

She requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy tools and equipment for her shop. In the future, Bella would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for her electronics repair shop.

loans.name: Rabab

texts.en:
Rabab is a 34-year-old wife from Gaza city in Gaza Strip. She is married to Sami and a mother of two daughters and two sons. Rabab's husband used to work in a barber shop and that he has the skill and wants to improve his income, as his children are growing and their expenses are as well, he wants to start his own business in order not to share the income with others.

Rabab's husband saved money and needed $1,500 to start the barber shop as he is paying for rent, decoration, equipment, kits and other products such as creams, shampoo, shaving creams, etc.

Rabab is a conservative woman as are most Gaza Strip citizens therefore her husband is photographed here.

loans.use: To help her husband start a barber shop.

loans.name: Hazell Yaoska

texts.es: Hazell Yaoska tiene su negocio que es la venta de mercadería en general. Tiene más de 7 años en su negocio, inicio con fondos propios y con la ayuda de sus hermanos. La mayoría de sus clientes son vecinos, amigos, familiares y compañeros ya que algunos saben que Hazell vende productos en su vivienda pero usualmente ella sale a vender de manera ambulante. Todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana se prepara para salir a ofrecer cada uno de sus productos. El crédito es para la compra de bolsos, calzado, cosméticos, cremas y ropa en general.
texts.en:
Hazell Yaoska has a business selling general merchandise. She has been in business for more than seven years. Hazell started out with her own funds and the help of her siblings. Most of her customers are neighbors, friends, relatives, and colleagues. Some of them know that she sells products from her home, but Hazell usually generates her sales as a traveling merchant. Every day at 7am, she prepares herself to go out and start offering every one of her products.

This loan will be used to purchase bags, shoes, cosmetics, crèmes, and clothing.

loans.use: to purchase bags, shoes, cosmetics, crèmes, and clothing.

loans.name: Fedelina

texts.en:
This is Fedelina, 49, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Pedro, a foreman, and mother of five children. One of her children is married, two are working and the other two are students. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Fedelina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Fedelina earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from the variety store business, Fedelina also earns by selling RTW products. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 18,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and RTW products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Fedelina dreams of giving all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and RTW products to sell

loans.name: Bosco

texts.en:
Basco is a 36-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur who is married with three children between the ages of 6 and 10.  

For the past nine years, he has run a butchery. The profits from this successful enterprise have helped him improve the standards of living for his family. 

He requires this loan to buy more meat for his shop that he will sell for a profit. 

He plans to save future profits so that he can continue to provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy meat to sell

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.fr:
Adjoa est une femme  âgée de 32 ans. Elle est mariée å un contrôleur. Elle n’a pas d’enfants 
Adjoa travaille comme revendeuse de yaourts, de jus et du cake qu’elle fait elle même depuis 2006. 
Elle sert ses clients à domicile. Elle achète (citron, bissap, sucre arome, lait  à Lomé plus précisément au Grand Marché. Elle travaille seule.
 Adjoa a requis son troisième cycle de  crédit à WAGES afin d’acheter du citron, du bissap, du yaourt, du sucre.
texts.en: Adjoa is a 32-year-old woman who is married to a comptroller. She has no children. She works as a retailer of yoghurt, juices, and cake which she has been making herself since 2006. She serves her customers out of her home. She purchases lemons, hibiscus flowers, sugar, flavorings, and milk in Lomé, at the Grand Market, to be exact. She works alone. Adjoa has requested her third loan cycle from WAGES to buy some lemons, hibiscus flowers, yoghurt, and sugar.

loans.use: to buy sugar, lemons, and flavoring

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 36 years old and married with 2 children.

Margie works hard to provide for her family. She runs ambulant (mobile) vending of grocery items in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

Margie has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the ambulant vending of grocery items for 9 years.

Margie aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of groceries to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph has been selling timber in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last two years. He is 27 years old, married to Joyce and they have one child.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers. This will be his second loan. He paid his previous loan of Kshs 20,000 in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more timber to sell in his yard.

In future, Joseph hopes to grow and also open a big carpentry shop.

loans.use: To buy timber for sale

loans.name: Abdumanon

texts.ru: Абдуманон женат и у них 4 детей. Он целеустремленный и честный человек. Он занимается купля продажей муки в центральном рынке города. Он любит свой бизнес и у него очень хороший опыт. Более 13 лет он занимается этим бизнесом. Абдуманон любит свою семью и старается всегда обеспечит их и содержит в хороших условиях жизни. Он хотел бы получит займ в размере 9000 Сомони для покупки муки с целью расширения бизнеса и пополнения оборотного капитала.
texts.en: Abdumanon is married and has four children.  He is a goal-oriented and honest person.  He is involved in buying and selling flour at the central city market.  He loves his business and has a very good experience.  He has been in this business for over 13 years.  Abdumanon loves his family and always tries to support them and provide a good quality of life for them.  He wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 9000 Somoni for the purchase for flour in order to expand his business and refill his revolving capital.

loans.use: to buy flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase products (rice, flour, sugar, oil and others) for resale

loans.name: Assylyn

texts.en:
Assylyn is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.
 
Assylyn has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for 13,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.
 
Assylyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Assylyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Les Phares De Ouanaminthe Group

texts.fr:
Terlius est le coordonateur de son groupe LES PHARES DE OUANAMINTHE. Il n’est pas marié il na pas d’enfant

Terlius habite dans la ville de OUANAMINTHE d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée.

Terlius a dirigé son business pendant les 6 dernières années.

Il voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans l’achat du tennis.

Terlius espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business. Les autres membres Les Phares ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre du charbon, du riz et des vetements uses.

Terlius dit que son défi principal est manque d’acheteur constant .

Terlius dit que ses buts principaux sont l’augmantation du bussiness. Son rêve est l’achat d’un camion pour transporter les marchandises.

Terlius dit que ses buts principaux sont l’augmantation du bussiness. Son rêve est l’achat d’un camion pour transporter les marchandises.
texts.en:
Terlius is the coordinator of the 'Les Phares de Ouanaminthe' group.  He is not married and doesn't have any children.

Terlius lives in the town of Ouanaminthe, in Haiti, where electricity is rare and water is very limited.

Terlius has run his business for the past six years.  He would like to use this loan to invest in buying tennis shoes.

Terlius hopes that this loan will help him to increase the size of his business.  The other members of 'Les Phares' need a loan for businesses such as selling charcoal, rice and used clothes.

Terlius says that his main challenge is a lack of regular customers.  He says that his main goal is to increase his business.  His dream is to buy a truck for transporting his merchandise.

loans.use: to buy tennis shoes

loans.name: Martha Esther

texts.es:
Martha es una joven de 22 años de edad, de oficio operaria de cocina, pues este trabajo le impulso para poner en su casa de sus padres una pequeña venta de tacos, enchiladas,repochetas, hamburguesa, gaseosa, quien comenzo con dinero propio, y ayuda de sus papa. El horario que tiene en su trabajo es variado, es por tal razon le dedica tiempo  a la venta.
Lo que ella desea es poder mejorar la casa donde vive, en el cambio del zinc, cambiar porton de verja y hacer las ventanas con verjas, ya que estan bastante desgatadas por la lluvia y sol. Y tener una mejor imagen para su ventas, tambien en mejores condiciones de seguridad  a sus padres ante la delicuencia.
texts.en:
Martha is a young woman who is 22 years of age. She works as a kitchen operator. Since she has experience in this type of work, Martha decided to open a small food stand in her parents’ home where she sells tacos, enchiladas, “repochetas” (pan fried tortillas with cheese), hamburgers, and sodas. She started this business with her own money and the help of her father. Her work schedule varies, but she makes time to sell.

What she wants is to improve the home in which she lives. Martha plans to replace the zinc roofing sheets, the wrought iron gate, and to make new security bars for the windows since the existing ones have deteriorated in the rain and sun. This will give her home a better image for making sales. She will also have better conditions that will protect her parents against crime.

loans.use: to replace the zinc sheeting on the roof and install a wrought iron gate and new security bars on the windows.

loans.name: Goya

texts.es: La socia actualmente se dedica  ala agricultura y a la crianza de aniameles menroes, la socia cria pollos y cuyes y luego los vende ella requiere el prestamo para invertir en la compra de semillas de maíz para sembrar y compra de fertilizantes, la socia también desea el prestamo para invertir en la compra de pollos y cuyes para criar y venderlos. Ella desearía a futuro poder crecer economicamnete y dar a sus hijos apoyo en cuanto a sus estudios superiores, la socia desearía tener un terreno de cultivo mas para sembrar maíz. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir enla compra de maíz, fertilizantes, compra de pollos y cuyes para la venta.
texts.en: The member currently works farming and raising small farm animals.  She raises chicks and guinea pigs to then sell.  She needs the loan to buy corn seeds to plant and to buy fertilizer.  She also wants the loan to buy chicks and guinea pigs to raise and then sell.  She’d like to grow economically in the future to provide her children with higher education.  She’d like to have a field to grow more corn.  She’s asking for the loan to buy corn, fertilizers and chicks and guinea pigs to sell.

loans.use: to buy corn, fertilizers, chicks and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 29 years old and lives in the town of Kamuli in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past 11 years, Rebecca has been working hard to manage her small shop, which sells spare parts. 

To help expand her business, Rebecca has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy new spare parts for resale, and will help Rebecca to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Rebecca hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house of her own. 

Rebecca is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rebecca who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy new spare parts for resale

loans.name: Oscar Antonio

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua, el señor Oscar Antonio se caracteriza por ser un buen trabajador debido a que ha sabido llevar el bienestar de su hogar y ha logrado darle una mejor condición de vida a su familia. El es  una persona que se desempeña como conductor de transporte, es casado y con tres persona a su cargo.

En esta oficina de Ceprodel se presentó el señor Oscar Antonio a solicitar crédito para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, el objetivo de este crédito lo necesita para la compra de materiales de construcción como bloques, arena, cemento, piedrín, hierro esto será utilizado para hacer un garaje y así darle una mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
In the city of Managua, Oscar Antonio is known for being a good worker because it is known that he has managed the wellbeing of his house and has given a better quality of life to his family. He is a person that works as a transport driver. He is married and has three people in his care.

Oscar Antonio came to this office of Ceprodel to ask for a loan in order to improve his living conditions. The reason for this loan is to buy construction materials such as blocks, sand, cement, gravel, and iron to be used to make a garage and thus to improve the living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to improve living conditions

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong and her family live in Ho Chi Minh City. She is 41 years old and has a daughter. Her husband earns an income working in interior decoration.

Phuong has been earning a living by operating a general store from the door of their house for the past seven years. She sells a variety of basic goods, such as sugar, confectioneries, and basic household necessities. 

Phuong would like to borrow money to expand her business by increasing the quantity and variety of basic goods, such as snack foods and beverages, that she sells from her store. She hopes that this will enable her to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a variety of basic goods and household necessities to stock her store.

loans.name: Daniela Del Socorro

texts.es: Daniela del Socorro es una emprendedora que inicio su propio negocio con muchos esfuerzos y que ha tenido mucho éxito. La actividad a  económica es un taller textil donde le realiza trabajo a muchas de la empresas que la visitan por la calidad que les ofrece. Daniela aprendió desde muy joven este negocio y le gusto mucho, ya que  les enseño a sus  hijos  también este negocio que trabajan junto con ella en el taller para sacar los encargos que las empresas le solicitan como la elaboración de pantalones, gorras, mochilas, bolsos entre otros encargos. Daniela del Socorro está solicitando financiamiento a Fundación León 2000, para poder comprar materia prima como telas para la elaboración de los diferentes pendidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Daniela del Socorro is an entrepreneur who, with lots of hard work, started her own business and has had a lot of success.  She has a textile shop where she does her work and there are many businesses that visit for the quality she offers. 
 
Daniela learned this business at a young age and she really likes it.  She also taught her children this business and they work with her in the shop to fill the orders that businesses place.  They make pants, hats, backpacks, bags, and other orders.  

Daniela del Socorro is requesting a loan through Fundación León 2000 to buy raw materials such as fabric so she can fill her customer's different orders.

loans.use: purchase raw materials such as fabric to fill her orders.

loans.name: Sunyande

texts.en:
This is 48-year-old Sunyande.  She is married, and has five children a woman aged 30 (a trader), a 21-year-old male who is in form 5, an 18-year-old male and a 16-year-old male both in form 3, and a 7-year-old girl. She has no additional dependents living with her. 

In 1999, Sunyande established her fence posts and wood business. She began her business as a means of assisting her husband with domestic needs. Working 7 days a week and 6 to 7 hours a day, she makes about SLL 600,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of SLL 3,000,000. Sunyande requires a loan in order to improve her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits to approximately SLL 900,000. In the future, Sunyande plans to educate her children and also she hopes to be a great business woman.   

She is thanking you for your support.

loans.use: To buy fence sticks and Wood for her business

loans.name: Faustin

texts.en:
Faustin is 38 years old. HIs wife is a farmer and they have five children. 

This new loan will be used to help in the construction of the warehouse or store for their maize crop while they are waiting for their harvest to be bought by the buyers. This constructed infrastructure will help the entire farmers to have a secure store of their crop in the future. UOB’s farmers clients are benefiting from the production financing which is increasing significantly their yield or production. However, during the post-harvest process many are suffering financially as they have to wait for the buyers to pay them. The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a warehouse/store for maize produce.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline, age 32, farms maize and beans to earn her living. She and her husband are blessed with three children.

She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the trainings they offer on enterprise development and financial management. This has helped her improve her knowledge in business management. 

Jackline requested a Kiva loan in order to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer, certified seeds, and storage sacks. She hopes this will enable her to get a higher yield, thus increasing her income. Her goal is to improve her family's standard of living by providing them with good food, education, modern housing, and quality health care. 
 
Jackline is grateful to her Kiva lenders for their help and support, and she promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer, certified seeds, and storage sacks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase capital

loans.name: Fuad

texts.en: Fuad is the resident of Beylagan region. He decided to establish his own business and in 2005 he applied to Normicro Beylagan branch. He borrowed his first loan in amount of $700,  and opened an internet cafe. First he put billiard tables and now he is in need of another loan to buy two computers and run Internet.

loans.use: To buy two new computers

loans.name: Vaituutuus

texts.en: Vaituutuus runs a small shop in the small Samoan village where she was born and raised.  Vaituutuus is married and has two children.  Her husband moved to New Zealand to try to work and support his family in Samoa.  However, the intermittent income he sends home is not enough to support the family.  The sales in Vaituutuus' shop are necessary to provide for the family's basic necessities.  Vaituutuus is passionate about ensuring her children have a future full of opportunities.  She joined SPBD in order to gain access to capital to help her grow her shop and expand her product line.  She expects that being able to offer a larger variety of products will help enlarge her customer base and boost her sales.

loans.use: Expand product line

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia O. D. O. has a sewing machine in her house that she uses to make children’s clothing and lingerie. Once she has sewn a certain amount of clothing and lingerie, she and daughter go house-to-house selling them. She always sells all of her merchandise.

With the cold season approaching, Mrs. O. wants to begin making warm clothes, however, the sewing machine she has can’t sew heavy fabrics, which is why she would like to buy a new and more modern machine that will allow her to increase her variety of products. Mrs. O. has already researched different sewing machines and has decided on a Juki brand model that costs $500.00. In order to finance this machine, Mrs. O. needs a loan for $500.00, and she has committed to paying it back in 12 months.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Virginia O. D. O. tiene una máquina D. coser en su casa que utiliza para confeccionar ropas para niños y lencería. Una vez que confecciona una cierta cantidad D. ropa y lencería ella sale con su hija a venderlas casa por casa. Siempre venD. al contado sus mercaderías. Ahora que se acerca la época D. frío la Señora O. quiere empezar a confeccionar ropa D. abrigo, sin embargo, la máquina que ella posee no cose tejidos gruesos, por lo que desea adquirir una maquina nueva y moderna que le permita ampliar su variedad D. mercaderás. La señora O. ya ha estado mirando precios D. distintas máquinas D. coser y se ha decidido por un modelo D. la marca Juki cuyo costo es D. US$500. Para financiar está máquina la señora O. necesita un préstamo por la cantidad del costo D. la misma y se compromete a devolverlo en 12 meses.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Dora is 31 years old and married to Ramón Ferrerira, an automechanic. They have one son, who is currently studying in a neighborhood primary school.

Dora sells silver and gold jewelry such as rings, hoop earrings, chains, necklaces and other kinds of jewelry. She sells door-to-door for cash and on credit. She also makes clothing for children in "Ao poi ", a handcrafted fabric with needlework typical of Paraguay, to order. Her clients are teachers, neighbors, business people and on occasion, clients who live in the cities of Luque, Areguá Limpio and San Lorenzo, some 20 km from Dora's home.

Dora has been selling jewelry for 3 years; she started her business with the financial help of the Fundación Paraguay. She and her husband are poor and self-made people with a strong sense of responsibility when it comes to paying their bills and loans. With their earnings from the jewelry and the auto repair businesses, they have been able to grow and educate their family. The loan will be used to buy jewelry to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Dora tiene 31 años, está casada con Ramón Ferreira quien es mecánico de autos. Tienen 1 hijo que actualmente realiza sus estudios primarios en una escuela del barrio.

Ella se dedica a la venta ambulante de joyas de plata y oro como anillos, aros, cadenas, collares, diges y otros. Sus ventas las realiza al contado y a crédito, también confecciona ropas para niños en Ao poi (tejido artesanal típico del Paraguay) sobre pedido. Sus clientes son docentes, vecinos, comerciantes y ocasionales clientes que viven en las ciudades de Luque, Areguá, Limpio y San Lorenzo distantes a unos 20 km de su casa.

A esta actividad se dedica desde hace 3 años. Obteniendo desde el principio la ayuda financiera de la Fundación Paraguaya. Son personas muy humildes pero con mucha moral de pago que con lo obtenido por la venta de las joyas y por las reparaciones de vehículos que hace su marido han podido criar y educar a su familia. El préstamo lo solicita para la compra de joyas para la venta.

loans.use: Buy jewelry to sell

loans.name: Leandro

texts.es:
Leandro has two daughters who are still in school. He and his wife separated years ago and since then he has been taking care of his daughters and a niece who also works with him in the small store they recently constructed near their home. Before owning the store, Leandro sold spare motorcycle parts, and due to the large number of clients who had not paid their bills, he had to liquidate the business and save the little money left in order to begin a new business. He is doing quite well in this new endeavor since he is located on a very busy street corner. He therefore needs to expand his building and stock his shelves with more goods. His goal is to install a drink vending machine in the near future. He promises to repay the loan in six months. He places all his hope in your hands so that he can help his family succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Leandro es padre de dos hijas, que aún están en el colegio, se separó de su esposa hace años y desde entonces viene haciéndose cargo y velando por el bienestar de las mismas y de una sobrina que colabora con él en la pequeña bodega que instaló hace poco en las inmediaciones de su hogar.Antes de tener la bodega contaba con el negocio de venta de repuestos de motocicletas y debido a la fuerte cartera de clientes morosos tuvo que liquidar el negocio e invirtió el poco dinero que tenía ahorrado para implementar el nuevo centro de ventas.Ahora esta avocado de lleno a esta ocupación ya que por estar ubicado en una esquina es muy concurrida y por ende necesita ampliar sus espacios y stock de artículos para beneficio de sus clientes.Leandro solicita la suma de 700 dólares , préstamo que le permitirá comprar y poder seguir invirtiendo en su bodega ya que tiene como meta en un futuro cercano poner una distribuidora de bebidas, el compromiso que asume para devolver la deuda es de seis meses, depositando todas su esperanzas en vosotros para seguir sacando adelante a su familia.

loans.use: To buy products to stock his store and increase sales.

loans.name: San Juana

texts.es:
San Juana is a woman who likes food and has made use of her talents to produce foods and sell these products. She prepares her chorizo sausage with much passion and experience, since she started her business 8 years ago, because her children were small and her husband wasn't doing so well; he was laid off of work for long periods of time and had to stay in the house with unpaid expenses.

However, now that her daughters are grown her expenses are growing. Since San Juana is convinced that education is the way to get ahead, she is struggling so that her kids will study and be productive people in society. For that reason San Juana is asking for a loan of $475.00 to be repaid in 6 months. With this money San Juana will be able to buy the materials to make the cheese that she just learned how to make. With the cheese she will have yet another product to sell. With your help San Juana and her children will be able to get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Margaux, Micah, Marvae, and Dennis of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteers

San Juana es una mujer que le gusta la comida y a sabido aprovechar los dones que tiene para elaborar sus comidas, vendiendo productos que ella elabora, tal es el caso del chorizo que lo prepara con muchas ganas y ya experiencia puesto que este negocio lo comenzó hace 8 años, desde que sus hijas estaban pequeñas y a su esposo no le iba tan bien, puesto que en el trabajo que tenía lo desempleaban por largas temporadas y su casa se quedaba con los gastos detenidos.

Sin embargo actualmente que sus hijas ya son mayores, los gastos van incrementando, puesto que San Juana está convencida que el estudio es la base para salir adelante y por eso está luchando para que sus hijos estudien y sean unas personas de provecho. Por lo tanto San Juana está solicitando un crédito de US $475 para poder pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero San Juana podrá comprar material para elaborar quesos que acaba de aprender a elaborar, y así tendrá otro producto que vender. Con tu ayuda San Juana y sus hijos podrán salir adelante.

loans.use: Buy materials to make cheeses

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
18 years ago Patricia decided to start selling beauty products to complement her husbands´ meager earnings as a cab driver. She has two children, and an additional salary was necessary to help cover the costs of running her home and to pay for her children´s education. Initially she sold her beauty products to family members, until her neighbors began to discover her excellent merchandise. She acquired a fine reputation as she made it a point to deliver her products quickly.

Currently she does not have enough inventory to meet demand. To be able to purchase stock, Patricia is requesting a $950 loan which will be returned within six months. With your help, Patricia will be able to continue with her business venture and will make enough money to pay for her children´s education.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Ana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ana Del Carmen Perez R. is married and has two sons attending college. Her business is a little convenience store in Chichigalpa, which she has owned for 13 years. As she told us, when she completed sixth grade she had to leave school for economic reasons and started working.

Since the opening of her store she has been an excellent businesswomen. She has successfully managed her business and produced enough income to maintain her family and put her kids through college.

Doña Anita has been working with CEPRODEL for four years, she is very happy with the loans she got, they came in times of need. The loans helped her keep her business running and keep her clients happy. She has completed 20 loans to date.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Jimenez, Kiva Volunteer.

Ana del Carmen P. R. es casada y con 2 hijos en la universidad, el negocio de ella es una pequeña pulpería ubicada en Chichigalpa. Actualmente tiene 13 años de tener este negocio. Según cuenta, estudió hasta el sexto grado pero por las dificultades económicas no continuó con sus estudios por lo que tuvo que abandonarlos y dedicarse al trabajo.

Desde que inicio con la pulpería se ha caracterizado por ser una muy buena comerciante debido a que siempre esta constante en el negocio y además ha sabido mantener su hogar y el estudio de sus dos pequeños hijos.

Doña Anita trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 4 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues les han sido brindados en el momento oportuno, ayudando a sí a suplir las necesidades del negocio y satisfacer a diario a su clientela. Ella tiene un record de 20 créditos.

loans.use:
Purchase Inventory

Compra de mercaderia

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris is 47 and is a single mother. She has always been a good cook, so when she decided to start her own business, selling food in her neighborhood was the clear choice. Thanks to her business, she has been able to get ahead and send her two children to school. She lives in La Primavera, where her business is based. In her dining hall, she offers a wide variety of homemade foods to her customers every day, waiting on them herself. The majority of the people who come to enjoy her dishes are local workers.

Thanks to her business, Doris has been able to earn enough so that her family can have a decent home. However, she would like to be able to expand the business, in order to offer her clients a pleasant atmosphere. Doing this will enable her to educate her children so that they can find jobs, and to make more improvements to their home. Doris is seeking this loan so that she can purchase the perishable food items, meat and grains that she needs to prepare the foods that she makes every day.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Doris es madre soltera, tiene 47 años de edad, siempre fue una buena cocinera así que cuando pensó en un negocio que pudiera manejar decidió vender comida en su localidad, con su negocio es como ha salido adelante y educado a sus 2 hijos, habita en el barrio La Primavera, cuenta con un Comedor en el cual ofrece comida casera variada todos los días de la semana, posee un buen numero de clientes a quienes atiende, muchos trabajan en los alrededores de la zona y son quienes mayormente degustan de los platillos de la señora.

El negocio le ha generado suficientes ingresos para vivir dignamente con su familia. El deseo de la señora es de expandir su negocio, ofreciendo un ambiente agradable y tranquilo para todos sus clientes, ya que de esta forma podrá formar a sus hijos como profesionales y mejorar la condición habitacional de su vivienda. La señora solicita un préstamo para la compra de perecederos, carnes y granos básicos que necesita para elaborar los alimentos que día a día ofrece.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: Rosa Gloria

texts.es:
Señora Rosa Gloria Rodríguez C. is 43 years of age and has completed higher education in the technical career of nursing. She has two children in all who both depend on her for support. She lives in the El Cortijo sector of the province of Trujillo in the La Libertad department – Peru.

She has a small position in the zonal market of El Cortijo in which she sells slaughtered and feathered birds such as: chickens, ducks, hens, roosters, turkeys and other miscellaneous types. Her business was started when she bought her small position and began selling a small quantity of birds. Subsequently she has increased the quantity of animals. Aside from this, she has another business renting cars. She has five taxis which she rents daily. In that way she has another income for her home.

She is an associate founder of the “New Peru” Communal Bank, where she obtained her first loan of 300 soles which she used to buy several birds.

With the loan of 1500 soles that will be repaid in six months, she will buy 7 hens, 25 chickens, 5 kg of gizzards and 7 large ducks.

Her greater dream is to buy five cars in addition to the ones that she already has to build a taxi service business.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosa Gloria Rodríguez C. tiene 43 años de edad, tiene estudios superiores en la carrera técnica de enfermería. Tiene dos hijos en total que aun dependen de ella. Vive en el sector El Cortijo en la provincia de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad – Perú.

Tiene un pequeño puesto en el mercado zonal de El Cortijo en el que vende aves muertas y peladas tales como: pollos, patos, gallinas, gallos, pavos y menudencia. Su negocio se inicia cuando compro su pequeño puesto, empezó vendiendo muy poco posteriormente ha ido incrementando la cantidad de animales. Aparte de eso tiene otro negocio que es el alquiler de carros, tiene cinco taxis los cuales alquila diariamente, de esa manera tiene otro ingreso en su hogar.

Ella es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal “Nuevo Perú” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 dinero con el que compro diversas aves.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1500.00 que los cancelara en seis meses comprará 7 gallinas, 25 pollos, 5 kg de molleja y 7 patos grandes.

Su mayor sueño es comprar cinco carros mas de los que ya tiene para constituir una empresa de servicio de taxi.

loans.use: To buy hens, chickens, ducks and other animals for sale.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Felipa lives with her husband (who is a police officer) and her three children in the street " CH " of the Progreso zone located in the city of El Alto. Felipa produces along with her eldest daughter alpaca wool gloves, which are sold to intermediaries. Felipa is requesting the loan to buy production supplies for her business. This is her third loan IMPRO, due to her history record she is qualified to receive another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Felipa vive junto a su esposo (cuyo trabajo es ser policía) y sus tres hijos en la calle “CH” de la zona Progreso ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto. Junto a su hija mayor, Felipa se dedica a la confección de guantes de lana de alpaca, los cuales son vendidos a intermediarios. La beneficiaria solicita crédito para la compra de mercadería para su negocio. Este es el tercer crédito de la clienta con Impro, debido a sus antecedentes ella esta calificada para recibir otro préstamo.

loans.use: Buy production supplies.

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Zoila belongs to the Communal Bank “Luis Pardo II,” where she sells food. Her business is located on the corner of the market in Chiquian district, Bolognesi province, Ancash state.

With the S/.500 nuevos soles loan, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy 5 sacks of tarwi (a bean native to the Andes).

She is 30 years old, married, and has 5 children. Her husband repairs shoes, and together they both work to support and provide an education to their children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Zoila pertenece al Banco Comunal Luis Pardo II, se dedica a la venta de Alimentos. Su negocio esta ubicado en la esquina del mercado del distrito de Chiquian, provincia de Bolognesi, departamento de Ancash.

Con el préstamo de S/.500.00, nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará 5 sacos de tarwi.

Ella tienen 30 años de edad, es casada tiene 5 hijos, su esposo es zapatero juntos mantienen y educan a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to prepare food.

loans.name: Chao

texts.en: Chao T., 43, lives in the Kampong Cham province with her husband and four children. She cares for her family as a housewife and she cooks food for the household, while her husband sells and buys rubber in Kampong Cham. He typically makes US$3 of net income each day,  but the family is also supported by two of the children who work to collect rubber as well. High inflation in Cambodia has forced many Cambodians to find new means of income to make ends meet. Chao T. would like to purchase a cow to raise and sell for a profit and she is asking for a loan of US$650 to accomplish this goal. She believes that the profit she can turn over on such a high priced animal will be enough to meet some of the family’s needs.

loans.use: Purchase of a cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in a large stock of goods for her small grocery store

loans.name: Layli

texts.en:
Layli M. is 40 years old, married and the mother of four children. Layli's lack of a stable job and the slow productivity of her husband's business as an independent taxi driver doesn't leave enough money to pay the expenses of the home and of her little daughter. This was the reason that Layli decided to start her own business 10 years ago selling fabric for the national dresses. Little by little she has made her business grow, and by offering her clients the ability to pay in installments her orders are getting bigger. Now her business is running normally.

However, she would like to continue bettering herself (and her business) so her situation will be stable in the future, if something should happen. She is asking for a loan of 2500 Somoni (750 USD) that she will pay back in 4 months. With this money, Layli will be able to buy seasonal fabrics for the national dresses. The power to help her business grow is in your hands.

loans.use: Purchasing new fabrics to increase the range of goods.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Maria, pertenece al Banco Comunal. “Sarita Colonia”, vive en la  Región San Martín,  Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui. se dedica a la venta de comida y su puesto de venta está cerca al paradero de Transporte Huallaga Central. Los clientes en su mayoría son los chóferes y pasajeros que a diario visitan dicho Terminal. 

Con este crédito de S/ 1,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará arroz, azúcar en saco, aceite en galón, condimentos, servilletas, y otros insumos como carnes de pollo, pescado, cerdo, verduras, etc., los cuales necesita para la preparación de sus platos que a diario oferta a sus clientes.

Rosa Maria tiene 22 años, es una mujer decidida y alegre. Vive con su esposo y su pequeño hijo. Tiene como meta mejorar su local y abrir un negocio de repostería.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa Maria, member of the community bank "Sarita Colonia," lives in the region San Martín, province of Mariscal Cáceres, district of Juanjui. She is dedicated to the sales of food and her sales location is near the bus stop Transporte Huallaga Central. The majority of her clients are drivers and passengers that visit this terminal daily. With this loan for 1000 Soles, which will be repaid in six months, she will buy rice, oil, condiments, napkins, and other ingredients like chicken, fish, pork, vegetables, etc., which she needs for the preparation of her plates that she offers daily to her clients. Rosa Maria is 22 years old. She is a purposeful and happy woman. She lives with her husband and little son. Her goal is to improve her store and open a confectionery business.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, sugar, oil, napkins, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in various goods to operate a small business.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Châm năm nay 40 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1995. Trong suốt thời gian tham gia tại Quỹ chị Châm không chỉ hoàn trả vốn đúng quy định mà chị còn luôn chấp hành  tốt mọi quy định của Quỹ. Hiện tại ngoài làm ruộng gia đình chị còn chăn nuôi thêm cá thả tại ao nhà cho thu nhập 3,5 triệu đồng/ tháng . Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay  15 triẹu đồng để đầu tư cho công việc nuôi cá của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. C. Thi Nguyen, 40 years old, has been participating in the Fund since 1995. In the whole time in which she has been participating in the Fund, Mrs. Nguyen not only repaid the loan according to the terms, but she also satisfied all other conditions which the Fund established. Currently, besides farming, her family also runs a fish farm in a pond at their home with an income of 3.5 million VND per month. In this round of funding she is requesting 15 million VND to invest in the fish farming business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in fish farming business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is currently in the brewing business and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Mary is 30 years old and is married. Her husband is a soldier. She has four children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a big bar.


BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services. These programs and services are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open a bar

loans.name: Shola Amudat

texts.en: Shola is a hardworking woman. She sells palm and groundnut oil. She also sells eggs. She has been in this business for a long time. She needs the loan amount of 100,000 NGN ($725 US) to purchase more palm and groundnut oil to sell. She hopes to meet the demands of her customers in this festive season. She is 42 years old and married with five children. She says, "Thank you to all that made this loan possible."

loans.use: To purchase more palm and vegetable oil to sell.

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es: La señora Cristina Isabel S. tiene la edad  de 27 años habita en el barrio San José Los Ríos ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, ella es madre soltera, tiene a su cargo dos hijas que estudian la primaria, los planes hacia su familia mejorar las condiciones de vida; por lo tanto la señora se desempeña como comerciante y agricultora para poder cubrir los gastos de sus hijas, desde hace quince años se dedica a la agricultura ha podido mejorar su cultivo. El cual necesita mantenimiento y aplicaciones de fertilizantes, con esta solicitud de crédito va invertir en insumos agrícolas para obtener una mejor producción y ofertar mejor los productos al mercado.
texts.en:
Mrs. Cristina Isabel S. is 27 years old and lives in San José Los Ríos in the municipality of Ticuantepe. As a single mother, she is responsible for two daughters that go to elementary school. Mrs. S. is a merchant and works in agriculture to cover her daughters' living expenses and to further her goal of improving her family's living conditions. Since she started in agriculture fifteen years ago, Mrs. S. has improved her crops, which nonetheless need fertilizers and upkeep. With this loan she will invest in agricultural supplies in order to improve her production and offer better products on the market.

Translated from Spanish by Jonathan Bradshaw, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies and fertilizer to improve agricultural production

loans.name: Secondary School, Makeni Group

texts.en:
These people are teachers of a Secondary School in Makeni.  This Secondary School was established in 1962. It is one of the oldest schools in the city, and it is the only secondary school for girls in the whole city of Makeni. The school is made up of a junior secondary school and a senior secondary school. The junior school has about 800 pupils and the senior secondary school has about 500 pupils. Both the junior and senior secondary schools have 44 dedicated staff members.

This secondary school remains the first school of choice for girls in Makeni city and even beyond. The students of this school continue to make good grades in both the Basic Education Examination’s Certificate (BECE) for the Junior Secondary School and the West Africa Senior Secondary Schools Examination (WASSE). The school has contributed immensely towards the education of girls in Makeni and beyond. Many of the city’s educated women came from this school. This Secondary School also continues to triumph over other schools in terms of sports (such as volleyball and other athletics).

Augustine I. T. (second from left) is the leader of this group of teachers. Augustine is the school’s bursar and had been serving in this capacity for over ten years. Mr. Augustine was born in Makeni. He is 65 years old, married, and has 12 children, seven of whom are still attending school. Mr. Augustine will invest the loan into business. He has been in business for many years now. This loan will therefore boost his business and financial status. Consequently, he will be able to solve most of his domestic problems.

loans.use: Invest In business

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 41-year-old man who lives in Saida, Southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Mahmoud owns a bean shop. He cooks all kind of beans. He requested a loan of $1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase beans for his restaurant. This is the first time that Mahmoud has requested a loan. Mahmoud is speciA. in his work because his restaurant is clean and he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, he didn’t have the startup capitA. and he couldn’t find a strategic place to open his restaurant. He decided on this business because he always wanted to open a restaurant and he likes the contact with clients. In the future, he plans on expanding his business and starting a second business.

loans.use: To purchase beans for his restaurant.

loans.name: Ana Mirian

texts.es: Ana Mirian L. D. A.. vive en San Salvador, su grupo familiar está compuesto por su esposo y dos hijos uno D. ellos aun es menor D. edad, tan solo tiene 10 años y estudia tercer grado, Ana se dedica a su negocio que lo tiene ubicado en el mercado D. San Jacinto, donD. venD. pollo. Ana es una mujer muy responsable ya ha obtenido anteriormente dos créditos con Integral con los cuales ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y ahora solicita un nuevo crédito para compra D. mas pollo para su negocio para aumentará su margen D. ganancia.
texts.en:
Ana Mirian L. D. A. lives in San Salvador. Her family consists of her husband and two children, one of whom is a minor age 10 and in third graD.. Ana has a business located in the San Jacinto market where she sells chicken. Ana is a very responsible woman as she has had 2 previous loans with Integral which were repaid very punctually and now she seeks a new loan to buy more chickens for her business to increase her profit margin.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Tarciana

texts.en:
Tarciana S., a 44-year-old resident of Neopoda, Tambo, Hinaplanon, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte in Southern Philippines. She is widow with four children. She engages in food and snack -making. One of her children is married and the three others are in school.

Being a single mom, Tarciana works hard to provide the needs of her children. Every day, she peddles her snacks in their neighborhood and nearby villages. Income is not sufficient to supply the family's daily needs that's why she wants to increase her stocks to generate higher income. To be able to fulfill her plan, she wants to apply a loan from HSPFI (a Kiva partner) amounting to Php 4,000. If granted, this will be a big help for the family. This will be Tarciana's 1st loan with HSPFI.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for snack and food preparation

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana E. is a 50-year-old mother of three children – two sons and one daughter. Her daughter is at nurse training college while her sons are in senior high and junior high schools. Juana lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in the busy fishing/commercial town of Mankessim, near Cape Coast, in the central region of Ghana.

Juana's husband is an auto mechanic, and Juana works as a trader to support him in providing for the family. Juana deals in second-hand clothes, which she procures from Accra and hawks to sell in her community. She also treks to sell in other towns as well. Juana has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy bales of textiles in bulk. She hopes to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy bales of clothes

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua S. is 35 years old and married. She takes care of her little sister’s daughter. Akua has managed to send the child to one the best schools in the community where she lives with her husband, who is a photographer. She lives in Dorma Ahenkro in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. To support her household, she hawks and sells cosmetics in her neighborhood to her loyal clients. She says selling cosmetics is very lucrative and therefore she wants to expand her inventory to enable her to make a good income for the family’s needs. She is therefore appealing for your assistance to make good sales and take care of her home. She also belongs to the village bank called "Asomdwe," which means Peace.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of cosmetics

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
La señora Florencia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Niño Jesús D. Praga” que esta ubicado en el distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno, tiene 45 años D. edad, es casada y madre D. 04 hijos, y tiene estudios D. secundaria completa y habita en el Barrio 15 D. Agosto.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 5 años, con un préstamo inicial D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, ella  tiene su negocio D. compra y venta D. ropa. 

Actualmente solicita un préstamo D. S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir en su negocio, la compra y venta D. ropa, Florencia comprará medias por docena, pantalones, camisas, blusas y chompas, los cuales venD. en su puesto del mercado D. Yunguyo.

Su deseo es poder capitalizar su negocio y vender su mercadería al por mayor. A ella le gustan las reuniones y los encuentros que Manuela Ramos realiza.
texts.en:
Florencia is a member of the Communal Bank "Niño Jesús D. Praga”, which is located in the Yunguyo district, Chucuito Province, Puno Department. She is 45 years old, married and the mother of 4 children. She finished secondary studies and lives in Barrio 15 D. Agosto.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement since 5 years ago. Her initial loan was 300 nuevo soles. She runs a business buying and selling clothes.

Now she is requesting a loan of 2000 nuevo soles to invest in her business. She will buy stockings by the dozen, pants, shirts, blouses and sweaters, all of which she sells at her stand in the Yunguyo market.

Her desire is to be able to capitalize her business and sell her merchandise wholesale. She enjoys the meetings run by Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To by stockings, pants, shirts, blouses and sweaters

loans.name: Night

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 31-year-old Night M. from Mwanza. She is married with three children between the ages of 2 and 11 years old. Night has been running a shop since 2001. She sells soda, breads, soap and cooking oil. She works at the business 16 hours per day, 7 days per week, and is assisted by two employees. Night currently earns about 180USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase cooking oil, soda and breads. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Night thanks you for her support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro credit in Tanzania through micro leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.
