One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil, soda and breads.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Bancomunal  las empresarias.
Julia  es casada tiene 57 años, tiene 8 hijos, el menor tiene 17 años y esta  estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Julia vendía en los mercados y en las puertas de colegio  golosinas, dejo de vender por que se descapitalizo, nuevamente empezó a vender y a juntar su dinero  iba comprando poco  apoco sus cosas vitrinas hasta que puso una bodega en su casa, ella atiende con la ayuda de su hija     
Desde que Julia esta en Finca tiene mas capital y puede comprar mas productos.
Julia necesita un préstamo de  1000 soles para  surtir su bodega, con arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideos, huevos.
El sueño de Julia es crecer más en su negocio.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the female entrepreneurs' village bank. Julia is 57 years old, married, and has eight children, the youngest of whom is seventeen and attends public school.

Julia used to sell sweets in the markets and at the entrance to the schools. She stopped for a while when profits decreased, but then started selling them again. With the money she is little by little buying things to display in a store in her home, which she and her daughter attend to.

Since joining Finca, Julia has had more capital and been able to buy more products. Julia needs a loan of 1000 soles to stock her store with rice, sugar, oil, noodles, and eggs.

Julia's dream is to increase the size of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her store with rice, sugar, oil, pasta, and eggs.

loans.name: Señor De Santiago Group

texts.es: Un Banco D. Emprendimiento que esta en su 6º Ciclo y su nombre es "SEÑOR D. SANTIAGO"  esta formado por señoras que viven en un mismo Barrio, ademas que se conocen D. muchos años. Este grupo nunca entro en mora por lo tanto se les dio este tipo D. credito. Como presidenta L. señora Olga Hilda  L. G., quien es una D. las fundadoras, se dedica a L. venta D. edredones (ropa D. cama) a credito y algunas otras mercaderias D. temporada, tiene 3 hijos y su esposo es taxista. Como tesorera esta L. socia Ruth G., quien tiene L. venta D. comida en su domicilio, es una mujer soL. y tiene dos hijas las cuales ya tienen su familia propia,  pero D. igual manera elL. les ayuda. Bertha B.,socia antigua, secretaria del Banco, se dedica a L. costura y venD. al por mayor, es muy trabajadora y responsable en sus pagos.
texts.en:
The "SEÑOR D. SANTIAGO" group is maD. up of women who live in the same neighborhood who have known each other for many years. They are in their sixth loan cycle with the Entrepreneurship Bank. This group has never been late in its payments which is why it can receive this type of loan. Olga Hilda L. G. is the President and one of the founders of the group. She sells comforters (bedding) on credit and other seasonal merchandise. She has three children and her husband is a taxi driver. Ruth G. is Treasurer, and she sells meals from her home. She lives alone and has two children who already have their own families, but whom she still helps out. Bertha B., a longtime member, is Secretary of the Bank. She is a seamstress and sells to wholesalers. She is a hard worker and very responsible with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Capital

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en: Cristina A. raises hogs and at the same time engaged in mushroom production as their sources of income.  They are living in the rural place of Isidro Paredes, Diffun, Quirino. She is already 57 years old and is enjoying her hog raising and mushroom businesses. She earns income and at the same time enjoys her business thus she is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP5, 000 that will be utilize in the maintenance of her mushroom production and hog raising business. Cristina hopes to develop her business while she is still strong and determined. Cristina said that by working harder and she will become successful in every business endeavor.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her capital

loans.name: Katerine

texts.es:
Katerine es una joven de 19 años que vive en la casa de sus padres. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a realizar diversos oficios en aras de su independencia económica. Principalmente brinda el servicio de transporte de pasajeros en la camioneta que le cedieran sus padres. De lunes a viernes administra los ingresos económicos de este negocio, ella misma es quien cobra los pasajes y contrató a un chofer para conducir la camioneta. Por otro lado; los fines de semana, viaja a otra ciudad, donde viven sus padres para dictar clases particulares de matemática, ya que es estudiante universitaria de pedagogía en matemática. Estas actividades le han permitido a Katerine mejorar su economía y lo que más desea es seguir trabajando con el fin de mejorar su calidad de vida.
Esta es la segunda oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es un ejemplo de perseverancia para sus compañeros de banco comunal, pues a pesar de su juventud trabaja para forjarse un futuro mejor, sin depender de otras personas. El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en el pago del mantenimiento de su camioneta y en la compra de repuestos para ésta.

loans.use: Reparación y mantenimiento de su camioneta

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en: Thelma C. is from the village of Capucao, Ozamiz City. She is 38 years old, is married, and has one adult child. Thelma owns and operates a business planting and harvesting corn for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Thelma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Felipe Israel

texts.es:
El señor Felipe Israel F. tiene ya más de quince años dedicándose al oficio de soldador. Este negocio y sus trabaja son los ingresos que tiene para dar lo mejor a su familia ya que tiene dos hijos pequeños de edad.
Al negocio le está haciendo falta materia prima como es acero y otra soldadura más potente ya que tiene varios pedidos que entregar pero por falta de material no los ha tenido listo. 
Es por eso que nos está solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el material que necesita y así entregar los pedidos a tiempo antes de que sus clientes busquen otra persona
que les elabore los figuras, que desean para adornar sus casas está navidad. 
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias del negocio, ya que los gastos familiares los cubre con el sueldo de su empleo en una maquiladora.
texts.en:
For the last 15 years Felipe Israel F. has been a welder. His shop and his assignments produce income with which he attempts to provide a better life for his family; he has two small children. His shop lacks raw material like steel and a more poweful welding machine so he has several pending orders that he has not been able to fill due to the lack of materials. For this reason, he is requesting funds to buy the needed materials so that he can have orders ready on time thus avoiding losing his customers to others, who may produce their Christmas figures to decorate their homes. He plans to repay his loan with profits from the shop since he is able to cover household expenses with the salary he earns as an employee at an assembly plant.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials and a welding machine.

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es: Don José Carlos R.,  hace dieciocho años  formo su propio negocio de venta de ropa electrodomésticos, utensilios de plásticos, todo esto logro hacerlo con dinero de su liquidación de su trabajo anterior en donde laboraba en una distribuidora de empaque de carne en los Estado Unidos en donde por mucho años estuvo para poder mantener  a su familia al mandarles las remesas. Logro mejorar también hacer su casa aunque le falto cerrarla completa de concreto, pero esta en lo propio. Lleva once ciclos en Afodenic el cual ha invertido al comercio para elevar las ventas y seguir trabajando. Tiene 55 años de edad, y vive junta a su esposa e hijos seis de los cuales  tres están estudiando para un porvenir mejor en  un trabajo. Vive en villa reconciliación, su esposa trabaja como supervisora de calidad en un supermercado para poder dar los estudios a sus tres hijos y que no le falta nada en sus necesidades, don José con este préstamo invertirá en la compra de ropa, utensilios de trastes y electrodoméstico para mejorar las ventas y así poder obtener mejores ganancias. Agrádese a la institución por hacer posible las mejoras  en su negocio.
texts.en:
Eighteen years ago, José Carlos R., 55, set up his own business, which is the sale of clothing, electrical appliances and plastic utensils with money he got from his settlement from his previous job, which was working for a meat packing company in the United States. For many years he was able to support his family with the funds he'd send back home. He managed, as well, to build his home though he wasn't able to completely finish sealing it with concrete; but it is adequate. He has been involved in eleven lending cycles with Afodenic which he has invested in his business to raise sales and continue working. He lives with his wife and six children, three of whom are studying in order to have better jobs in the future. They live in Villa Reconciliación and his wife works as a quality control supervisor at a supermarket in order to provide their three children with an education and so that they will lack nothing. José will use these funds to buy clothing, kitchen utensils and electric appliances to improve his sales and, thereby, earn better profits. He is grateful to the institution for making possible his business' improvement.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing, kitchen utensiles and electric appliances to increase sales.

loans.name: Rashidatu

texts.en: Rashidatu, 55, is married and has six children. Her husband is a mechanic. Rashidatu sells groceries at the front of her house in Ibadan, Oyo state. She is happy because she does not have to pay for stall rent. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 NGN to purchase more groceries to sell. She says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase groceries

loans.name: Gualberta

texts.en:
Gualberta A. is from the village of Poblacion 1, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old. Gualberta is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Gualberta owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling her own caught fish in the local community. Gualberta has been engaged in her business for more than a year and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Gualberta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gualberta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Gualberta is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to repair the pump boat used in the business. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Gualberta from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair the pump boat used in the business

loans.name: San

texts.en:
Mr. San S. and his wife live in Pursat province, Cambodia with their one young child who is enrolled in school and dependent on them. This couple has been earning their living by growing a variety crops on their own farmland. 

In addition, San always leaves home to go to the markets where he supplies a taxi service. At the market, he is hired by market sellers to deliver their merchandise and to drive their valued retail customers around the community. He earns approximately $6 each day for this work. 

Recently, San's taxi has often broken during the times in which he operates his service, and that affects his income. Thus, San would like to request a loan to replace his old existing taxi.

loans.use: To replace his old existing taxi.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Climate plays a big role in a farmer’s life. In Vilma’s experience, her last harvest was not that good because of the weather. A 37-year-old married woman, she is determined to give her best again to achieve an abundant harvest. Her six children are what motivate her to work hard.

Vilma also sought the help of CEVI, a micro-finance institution in the Philippines, to support her business financially. She applied for a loan of Php 8,000. This loan will go far in buying seeds, fertilizers and other farm necessities.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm necessities

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To strengthen her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital

loans.name: Bayoh

texts.en:
Bayoh M. lives in Freetown, Sierra Leone. He sells drinks and mobile phone top-up cards in a store he rents along a busy road called Kissy Bye Pass road.  Before getting into business, Bayoh worked for the Customs and Excise Department. He is married with three children. His wife is a student in one of the universities in Freetown.

Bayoh intends to buy a generator  for his business and get more stock. He hope to use the proceeds from his loan to pay his wife's university fees and his children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy a generator  and inventory

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna O. is 30 years old and married with 4 children. Her husband also works to support their home. Edna has a good relationship with LAPO. She sells kerosene at retail prices and she also has a poultry farm where she rears poultry birds to sell. With these combined businesses, she hopes to support her husband to meet the basic family needs. Edna has requested a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more kerosene to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Loida's Group

texts.en:
Loida M. is from the village of Mabini, Baggao, Cagayan. She is 29 years old. Loida is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Loida is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Loida owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Loida has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Loida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Loida is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Loida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Tatiana  Asunción

texts.es:
El  banco comunal Lomas del Viento se reúne en un sector a las afueras de la capital manabita en la costa ecuatoriana, en este banco se puede notar que hay bastante compañerismo y todas las socias son muy responsables con su pagos. 

La señora Tatiana esta casada tiene 3 hijos pero su esposo la abandonó y para ayudarse económicamente se dedica a la venta de varios productos en lo que se denominado venta por catálogo  desde hace tres años,  vende  electrodomésticos, utensilios del hogar y todo lo que es menaje de cocina, compra y deja a credito dando facilidades de pago a sus clientes  de hasta  ocho semanas pagando de 2 a 3 dólares semanal según lo que el cliente acuerde,  para la señora Tatiana  es  algo cansado éste negocio y le gustaría  poder tener una tienda en  el sector donde ella vive  ya que no hay tiendas y no lo ha podido hacer porque su casa no es segura, esta ahorrando para poder construir no sin antes arreglar los documentos de su terreno para hacer un crédito.

Nuestra socia se moviliza a pie para poder entregar sus pedidos,  no se le dificulta mucho  porque sus clientes  están por el mismo sector donde vive, nos comenta que  este negocio es muy rentable porque les incentivan a trabajar dándoles   premios.
 
Con el dinero que reciba comprará juego ollas, sartenes, coladeras,  vajillas, cubiertos, etc. para abastecerse para cumplir con  los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Lomas del Viento (Windy Hills) Communal Bank meets in an area on the outskirts of the capitol Manabita on the coast of Ecuador. In this bank you will can see that there is a lot of cooperation and that all the members are very responsible with their payments. Ms. Tatiana is married, and has three children, but her husband abandoned her. To help herself economically, she has worked for the last three years selling various products by means of catalog sales. She sells household electric appliances, home utensils, and all that is required in the kitchen. She provides credit to her clients, up to eight weeks, and requests payment of two or three dollars weekly according to what suits the client. For Tatiana the work is somewhat tiring so she would like to have a store in the area where she lives since there are no stores there. She has not been able to set up a store in her house since the house is not secure. She is saving to be able to be able to build a store, as soon as she can arrange the documents of her property so she can get a loan. Our member goes on foot to be able to deliver her orders. This is not too difficult because her clients are from the same area where she lives. She tells us that this business is very worthwhile because prizes are available, encouraging her to work hard. With the money she receives she will buy sets of pots, frying pans, strainers, dishes, eating utensils, etc, to supply herself and be able to meet the orders of her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sets of pots, frying pans, strainers, dishes, eating utensils, etc.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a mother of 2 and she is 35 years of age. She sells groceries and foodstuffs in her shop to make a living in Lagos and she has been in the business for over 10 years. Her husband is doing well in his personal business. They work hard in order to meet up with their family responsibility. 

Juliet wants to rent a big shop so that she can expand the size of her business by buying more groceries and foodstuffs to sell and increase her profit. She hopes for the loan of NGN100, 000 to purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell to her costumers. She appreciates all lenders for their good work.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Binèfou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Binèfou D.   est un homme marié de 50 ans et monogame qui vit à Kalakan,  avec ses  dix enfants, dans l’un des villages de la Préfecture de  Kolondièba dans la  troisième région (Sikasso) de la République Mali.
Monsieur Binèfou  D. a dix huit ans d’expérience dans les activités d’achat et de vente de bétails.
Pour augmenter son capital il adhère au programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance   Soro Yiriwaso, avec qui, il est à son troisième  cycle de prêt individuel, après avoir correctement remboursés les deux précédents. 
Il  compte acheter des bœufs dans la Préfecture de Kolondièba et effectuer sa vente au comptant, souvent à crédit à Nièna et parfois dans son village.   
Il espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel  de 50000 FCFA par mois.  Le bénéfice  sera investi dans l’entreprise.
Dans l’avenir Monsieur D. compte aller vendre ses animaux dans les pays voisins pour avoir beaucoup de bénéfice.
texts.en:
Mr. Binèfou D., 50, married and monogamous, lives in Kalakan, with his 10 children, in one of the villages of the prefecture of Kolondièba in the third administrative region (Sikasso) of the Republic of Mali. Mr. Binèfou D. has 18 years' experience in buying and selling livestock. To increase his capital, he joined the credit program of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom he is on his third individual loan, after having correctly reimbursed the two preceding ones. He intends to buy cattle in the prefecture of Kolondièba paying cash, or often on credit in Nièna, and sometimes in his own village. He hopes to make a monthly profit of 50,000 F CFA. The profit will be reinvested in his business. In the future, Mr. D. intends to go and sell animals in neighboring countries so as to have a lot of profit.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of livestock for resale

loans.name: Vei

texts.en:
Mrs. Vei V. is a 45-year-old farmer who lives in a rural area of Siem Reap Province. She is married to Sim Song, age 45. This couple, who work together in their farming business, has five children: one of the children is married and four are single.

The family plants its crops twice a year, and they were taught how to grow mushrooms by their grandparent.

Due to the coming farming season, Vei V. wants to have a cultivating machine to provide a plowing service for other farmers. As she lacks the money to buy one, she has decided to request a loan from Kiva. She will use these funds to buy a machine to begin providing her service. As well as that. she will use the machine to plow her own farmland.

loans.use: To buy a cultivating machine

loans.name: Hermogenes

texts.es:
El señor Hermogenes A. es de Bº Navidad, es soltero con casa propia, tiene 51 años de edad, y tiene una hija.  

 Se dedica a la venta de articulos de mercerias en general y tambien articulos farmaceuticos, cuenta con una motocicleta en el cual se desplaza para realizar las ventas por todas las zonas aledañas.

  

  Solicita el credito para la compra de articulos de merceria como medias, guantes, maquillajes en general, accesorios para criaturas, juguetes, y ademas vende remedios naturales.
texts.en:
Sr. Hermogenes A. is from Bº Navidad. He is 51 years old, single, lives in his own home, and has a daughter.

Hermogenes sells haberdashery items as well as pharmaceutical products. He has a motorcycle which he uses to travel to all of the neighboring areas to make his sales. Hermogenes is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as socks, gloves, make-up, baby accessories, toys, and natural remedies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise & natural remedies to sell

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Bancomunal Amaquella, tiene 50 años es casada y madre de 6 hijos todos mayores de edad. 
Juana se dedica a la venta de materiales de construcción como: ladrillos, arena, hormigón, piedra, arena de asentar, arena de zanja y piedra chancada ella compra los materiales del proyecto cachi todos estos materiales los transporta en 2 volquetes uno es de 5 cubos (propio) el otro es de 10 cubos (alquilado a 5,000 nuevos soles).
Sus clientes hacen estos pedidos vía telefónica, le indican el lugar donde debe llevar y ella manda al encargado del carro a los diversos lugares donde le hacen pedidos. Hasta la fecha no tuvo ninguna dificultad en su negocio, la meta de ella es poder comprar dos carros (de 10 y 15 cubos) y que su hija sea profesional.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Amaquella Communal Bank. She is 50 years old, married, and the mother of six adult children.

Juana sells construction materials such as bricks, sand, concrete, stone, mortar, filtration sand, and gravel. She buys the materials in Cachi and transports them using two dump trucks. She owns one truck with five compartments and rents another one with ten compartments for 5000 PEN.

Her customers place their orders by telephone and indicate where the goods should be delivered. Juana sends the drivers to different places to make deliveries. So far she has not encountered any difficulties with her business. Her goals include buying two more trucks (one with 10 compartments and another with 15) and seeing her daughter become a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fuel & bricks

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo gracias a las Señora Calixta Zoraida  quien invito a  sus vecinas para formar parte del comite D. mujeres emprendedoras y todas encantadas aceptaron conformar el comite Nombrandolo Comité Santa Librada.

El comité cuenta con veinte miembros en donD. la mayoria se dedica a realizar bordados en Ao-po´i, confeccionando ya sea camisas, manteles y muchas otras creaciones que son heredadas D. sus madres, abuelas, pasando estos conocimientos D. generación en generación. 

Calixta Zoraida  G. que vive en Mbocayaty se dedican a la artesania o pequeños comercios D. ropas y productos artesanales en Ao Po-í; vestimentas, manteles, mantas, adornos, etc.

Por la calidad D. sus productos, le resulta bastante productiva la venta D. los mismos y desea incrementar sus ingresos ampliando el negocio mediante la adquisición D. más materiales para su elaboración así como muebles utilizados para la exposición.
texts.en:
This group was formed thanks to Calixto Zoraida. She invited her neighbors to become part of a group of enterprising women. All of them were delighted to accept, and they formed the communal bank. They named it the Santa Librada Communal Bank. The group has twenty members. Most of them make “Ao-po´i” (traditional Paraguayan needlework). They make shirts, blankets, and other creations that they inherited from their mothers and grandmothers. This knowledge was passed on from generation to generation. Calixta Zoraida G. lives in Mbocayaty. She devotes herself to handicrafts and small businesses, which deal with clothing and products that are crafted in Ao Po-í. Some of those items are garments, table cloths, blankets, and decorations, etc. Her sales are good because of the quality of her products. She wishes to increase her income by expanding the business. She will do this by getting more materials to work on like furniture, which will be used for display.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy Ao Po-í fabric to make their embroidersed tableclothes and shirts, etc.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry M. is a hardworking man who runs a music and photo studio in Bushenyi town, dealing in taking photos and selling music tapes, video discs and seasonal cards like for Christmas, Easter and friendship wishes. He is also hired by customers to play music at parties. He began this business eight years ago after dropping out of school due to tuition-fee problems.

He envisions expanding his business with more stock of goods with the loan coming his way, which will help him capture the customers’ attention and further improve daily sales. His major dream is to live a self-sustaining life in the near future.

He is the father of a 5-year-old child and a bright future is what he wishes for this child.

loans.use: Increasing business stock

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Ramona O. de D. es una emprendedora que trabaja en la venta diaria de Empanadas, ella trabaja en este rubro hace mas de 10 años tiene 2 hijos y esta casada hace 15años, ella tubo conocimiento del programa de comité de Mujeres y le encanto la idea de formar un grupo de señoras que tengan una misma visión de progreso personal y familiar, asi mismo el grupo se formo en el Bº Empalado Ari de la Ciudad de Caaguazú, son 12 señoras que integra el comité cada una tiene un trabajo, las mismas poseen la responsabilidad, la voluntad y las ganas de salir adelante gracias a la Fundación Paraguaya.
Solicita el prestamo para la compra de carne, condementos harina y otros.
texts.en:
Señora Ramona O. de D. is an entrepreneur that sells empanadas everyday. She has been working in this profession for more than 10 years. She has 2 children and has been married for 15 years. She learned about the women's group program and loved the idea of forming a group of women that have the same vision of progress for themselves personally and for their families. This is how the group was formed in the Empalado Ari neighborhood in the city of Caaguazú. There are 12 women that belong to the group and all of them are employed. They are all responsible women and possess the will and ambition to succeed thanks to Fundación Paraguaya. She is requesting a loan to buy meat, condiments, flour and other things.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meat, condiments, flour

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita M. is a married woman who lives in Tutay, Pinamungajan, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  hog raising and  kitchenware businesses. Her husband, Fabiano M., who is 48 years old, works as a kitchenware salesman to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's other business activities.  They have six children who are 11  to  23 years old. Teresita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past six loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Teresita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 16,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 20,000,  uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 7th loan, she is borrowing PHP 18,000, which she intends to use as additional working capital for her hog raising and kitchenware businesses so that she can continue to save up for the future for family and education. Teresita M. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Working capital for her hog raising and kitchenware businesses

loans.name: Constancio

texts.es: El señor Constancio  tiene un taller de muelleria y trabaja hace mucho tiempo en esta actividad, con mucho esfuerzo logro equipar su taller y ahora es uno de los mas requeridos por los choferes de la zona El Tejar. El señor vive en alquiler y su deseo es tener su propia vivienda por eso trabaja desde la mañana hasta la noche para poder ahorrar dinero. El señor se esfuerza al máximo para tener un mejor futuro cuando logre formar una familia. Don Constancio aprendió esta actividad trabajando primero como ayudante desde muy niño. Con la institución comenzó a trabajar en el grupo solidario Unión La Portada por motivo de viaje se independizo para sacar un credito individual y esta séptima renovación con cero días de atraso con los años se nota el progreso puesto que esta a punto de comprarse una movilidad para tener mas ingresos, con el dinero del credito comprara paquetes de muelles por cantidad y variedad, esta muy agradecido con la institucion por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Constancio has an auto repair shop and has made a living from this activity for a long time.  Through his hard work he has managed to equip his shop, which is now one of the most popular shops among drivers in the El Tejar neighborhood.  Constancio lives in a rented apartment, but wants to have his own house—that is why he works from morning until night so that he can save money.  He puts in his maximum effort in order to have a better future, which will include starting a family.  Constancio first learned his trade while working as an assistant when he was very young.  He began working with the Unión La Portada solidarity group and the Emprender organization because he could take out an individual loan, and this is the seventh loan cycle in which he has not fallen behind in his payments; over time he has made sufficient progress so that he can now purchase a vehicle in order to increase his income.  He will use the money from the loan to purchase packages of various springs in bulk.  Constancio is very grateful to the organization for the help it has provided.

loans.use: Purchasing packages of springs and supplies

loans.name: Henry Nyabuto

texts.en:
Henry has practiced farming in Naivasha town for the last 10 years.  He is 46 years old, married to Loyce Njambi and they have eight children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to rent a piece of land for farming.  This will increase his yield.

In the future, Henry hopes to open a retail shop to supplement his farm income.

loans.use: To rent a piece of land for farming.

loans.name: Perla Yuliet

texts.es: La sra. perla usara su credito para el mejoramiento de su vivienda pondra piso de concreto en su patio y vitropiso en sus cuartos y para que sus hijos tengan un hogar mas hijienico y asi tendra una mejor imajen su casa ya que ella es una madre soltera y vio en el credito una buena oportunidad de superacion y la mejor manera de tener a sus hijos en un hogar mas comodo.
texts.en: Sra. Perla will use her loan to make improvements to her house. She wants to add a concrete floor to the patio and tile the floors of the other rooms so that her children have a cleaner home. It will also make the place look better. Perla is a single mother. She felt that this loan was a good opportunity to get ahead and the best way to make a more comfortable home for her children.

loans.use: to install new flooring

loans.name: Abrewa

texts.en: Abrewa M. is married and has six dependants. She sells used clothing in Elmina. Her husband is a mason. Abrewa uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Abrewa will use the loan to purchase more used clothing for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abrewa plans to build a shop.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothing for sale

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rosemary M. is 41 years old from Ngiya area in Siaya. She is married to Bethwel and they have four children; two girls above 18 years of age and two boys who are below the age of 18 years. 

Rosemary has a timber business that she operates and she has been doing this for the past 6 years. She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD after successfully completing her first loan. She will use the money to buy more timber stock for resale. The profits made from this business will be used to pay school fees for her children and also cater for the family’s need. 

Her desire is to be able to open up a furniture workshop in the future.

loans.use: Buy more timber and add to her stock

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
N. Milly is an individual client from Mubende. She is 30 years old and married with 3 children, 2 of them in school. Milly has a retail shop in Kyenda that has been in existence for 3 years. She is also involved in phone charging from her shop. 

Before her current businesses, Milly was a market vendor dealing in the sale of old shoes. She is able to make 400,000/= in weekly sales and her hard work and friendly nature have enabled her to succeed. Milly needs a loan to be able to complete her house since it has always been her dream to build her own house and educate her children.

loans.use: buying building materials to complete her house

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Huancheñas”  del distrito Huancané,  provincia de Huancané y departamento de Puno, tiene 55 años, de estado civil conviviente tiene 02 hijos dependientes, realizó estudios de educación secundaria.

Trabaja más de 02 años con el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos, su préstamo inicial  fue de  S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio venta de abarrotes.

Solicitará un nuevo crédito de S/. 1700.00 nuevos soles, con este dinero comprará gaseosas, una vaca, oveja, arroz fideos, tres kilos de lana.  La señora también vende ganados y confecciona frazadas.  Su esposo le ayuda y trabaja en el magisterio de la ciudad.

Su sueño es mejorar el negocio y generar mayores ingresos.

Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
Nilda is a member of the “Las Huancheñas” community bank which is located in Huancané district, in Huancané province, in Puno department.  She is 55 years old and lives with her partner.  She has two dependent children and studied to high school level.

Nilda has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for more than two years.  Her first loan was for 500 Peruvian soles and she invested that money in her business selling groceries.

Nilda is requesting a new loan for 1,700 Peruvian soles which she will use to buy soda, a cow, a sheep, rice, noodles and three kilos of wool.  She also sells livestock and makes blankets.  Her husband helps her and works as a teacher in the town.

Nilda's dream is to improve her business and make more profits.  What she likes about her community bank is the savings.

loans.use: She is requesting a new loan for 1,700 Peruvian soles to buy soda, a cow, a sheep, rice, noodles and three kilos of wool

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia J. is 21 years old and married to Richard Sum who is a driver. They have 3 children whose ages are six, three, and two years old. Slyvia runs a shop in Ndurio trading centre where she sells industrial goods.  She gets a monthly profit of Kshs 10,000 from her shop. She has been in this business for a period of three years and she is doing well as she has good potential customers buying from her shop.

She has borrowed a loan of Kshs 50,000 from KADET this being her first loan. She intends to use this money to purchase stock for her shop with items like flour, sugar and rice.  

Sylvia anticipates saving the profits she gets so that she can be able to educate her children as well as expanding her business in future.

loans.use: To purchase stock for her shop

loans.name: Som

texts.en:
Som D., 23, is married and resides with his wife and child in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. 

D. is a construction worker, earning an income of US $3 per day. His wife sells fried frog, earning an income of US $3 per day to help cover the family expenses. 

Each month, the family has to spend US $70 on food and US $18 on the other necessary expenses. D. is requesting a loan of US $500 to repair his house. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To repair his house

loans.name: Ilkin

texts.en:
Ilkin Q. is a 28-year-old man. He is married and has two school-aged sons. Ilkin has owned and managed a grocery store for the last four years. His store is located at the front of his house and his wife actively helps him in his business.  They are very hard-working people who dream of giving a good education to their children. By expanding the business, he will be able to improve his family's quality of life.

 Ilkin feels happy because this is the first loan he has taken out from AqroInvest and Kiva. He requested the loan amount of 1500 AZN to renovate his store and expand his inventory. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to educate his sons.

loans.use: to renovate the grocery store and expand his inventory

loans.name: Sukiasyan

texts.en: A. has been managing a clothing business since 2005.  He trades clothes with other countries and has limited access, so he needs a loan to cover the cost of some spring shirts, trousers and jeans for the upcoming high season. He also works as an engineer, and he supports his two retired parents with his business.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn B. is from the village of Salinas Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 33 years old. Marilyn is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Marilyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Marilyn has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 35,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2011, Marilyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Marilyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for services to increase crop yield.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace works hard to support two children. Mary Grace is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Mary Grace requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Mary Grace has been in this business for three years. 

In the future, Mary Grace would like to send her kids to school, spend money for house repairs and buy appliances.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 40 years old. She is single and supports three children who are dependent relatives. She owns and operates a small business selling various styles of African clothes. Agnes has been running her well-organized business for the past year. 

Agnes is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders through the Vision Finance Company to expand her business by purchasing additional women’s clothing. This loan will allow her to attract more customers to help earn more profit and save for her future.

loans.use: to purchase African-style women's clothing to sell

loans.name: John Mutue

texts.en:
John Mutue O. is 27 years old. He is married and blessed with two children. He is a mixed farmer and he has been doing this for the last nine years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for mixed farming.

He repaid his previous loan without delay. This will be his fourth  loan from KADET LTD  which he is planning to use to buy potatoes for planting, fertilizers, and buy some sheep for fattening. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his potato production and educate his children.


His hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land for farming. He is a scrupulous man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy potatoes for planting, fertilizers, and sheep for fattening

loans.name: Mabondeli Plus Group

texts.en:
Annie is the chairwoman of a community bank named “Mabondeli Plus” which means prayer in English. The group is composed of 18 micro-entrepreneurs united to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their individual businesses.

Annie is 43 years old and married with three children between the ages of 12 and 18. All of her children go to school. Annie started her business in 1988 selling beans and rice and today she operates a restaurant located in the heart of Kinshasa. Her restaurant has prospered thanks to Hope’s loans and Annie is able to increase her working capital with her daily profit of about 30 USD. 

Annie is happy to be part of one of MFI Hope’s groups. She joined the group in 2010 and her business has been strengthened through the seven loans she has received and repaid from MFI Hope DRC. In the future, Annie’s dream is to diversify her business by opening a beverage facility.

loans.use: to increase her restaurant inventory and strengthen her business

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
La señora Carolina tiene 31 años de edad, es soltera, y tiene un hijo.
Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de verduras, dicha actividad viene realizando hace más de 13 años y tiene clientela formada. Ella sale a vender sus productos a tempranas horas y esporádicamente deja a crédito a sus clientes y en esos casos le falta capital para comprar mercaderías por lo que concurre para acceder a los créditos.
Carolina  es muy activa, cumple cabalmente con sus compromisos y su máximo sueño es mejorar su nivel de vida. Justamente es por eso que solicita un crédito, a fin de aumentar su stock de mercaderías y así obtener mayores ingresos que le ayuden a crecer económicamente.
texts.en:
Mrs. Carolina is 31 years old, single and has a child.

She buys and sells vegetables a job that she has been doing for over 13 years and has a steady customer base. Carolina goes to sell her products early in the mornings and sporadically throughout the day to her customers who pay her on credit and sometimes she lacks the money to buy merchandize.

Carolina is very active and always meets her obligations; her biggest dream is to improve her quality of life. This is why she needs the loan to have her merchandize in stock to have greater earnings that will help her grow financially.

loans.use: buy vegetables, tomatoes, peppers, cassavas, etc.

loans.name: Lucille

texts.en:
Lucille is married and has three children. She is 58 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental.

To earn a living, she sells a "kangkong," a Filipino vegetable used to feed pigs. She has had this business for a year. Each month, She earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional kangkong for sale. Lucille has been a member of GDMPC for this year only. This is her first loan. In the future, She hope to increase her savings.

loans.use: To purchase additional "KANGKONG" for sale

loans.name: Lazarus

texts.en:
Lazarus is 35 years old and married with two children.  He has been selling secondhand clothes for three years.  He runs his business in a crowded area so he attracts many customers.  

Since Lazarus joined Faulu Kenya, he has grown his business and improved his standard of living.  He has requested 70,000 KES to buy more clothes to sell.  He hopes to expand his business into wholesale in the future.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines. She is borrowing 20,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Marissa has been in this business for 11 years. Marissa also earns additional income from photocopying services. Marissa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a married man with five children, all of whom attend school. He lives at a house that they own; it has electricity but does not have piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the family.

For the past 10 years, Samuel has operated a retail shop business, selling to his neighbours and passersby. He faces the major challenge of seasonality in his business. During the months from January to August, demand for goods is higher hence he is able to make more profits in his business. 

With the Kshs 40,000 loan, Samuel wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour and sugar for sale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, maize flour and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Saliou

texts.fr: Sliou est un jeune marié agé de 28 ans.Il est chauffeur de transport en commun depuis 2 ans aprés avoir aché la voiture où il travaillait comme apprenti chauffeur. Il souhaitait un prêt de 150 000 FCFA dans son IMF pour acheter un moteur afin de passer des pannes qui relentissaient son activité.  Ainsi avec cet investissement il espére bien améliorer son rendement et réduire les frais de dépannage.
texts.en: Sliou is 28 years old and married. He has been a transport driver for two years after having bought the car he used while working as an apprentice driver. He would like to take out a loan of 150,000 FCFA in his IMF to buy a new motor because breakdowns are slowing down his business.  With this loan, he hopes to increase the number of customers and to lower his repair costs.

loans.use: to buy a new motor for his car

loans.name: Teo

texts.en:
Teo lives in Uganda. She is widowed with five children and three of her children go to school. She has no additional family members to support. She has a business of selling local gin and brew. She sells her products on a wholesale basis. She has been in business for the last seven years. 

Teo works seven days a week. Teo's goal and aspirations are to educate her children and build her own bar. She has requested a loan of 800,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more jerrycans of local gin and brew. Her major business challenges are defaulters and thieves. She lives in  a rented   house and her family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses are rent, food, medication and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of local gin.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 57 years old. She is married and has eight children.

Judith works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Judith has borrowed and paid fifteen loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 8 years, and she also earns income from farming sugarcane.

Judith aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Nkuito

texts.en:
Nkuito is aged 31 years, married and has two children. He has been in farming for the past four years.  He is a humble client. 

He knew KADET LTD through other clients registered in his neighborhood. This will be his first loan with KADET LTD and he intends to spend it by preparing the land for farming and by purchasing maize seeds.

He intends to plow back the profits that will be generated into the farm and dreams to becoming a big farmer.  He believes he can do more if provided with resources.

loans.use: to prepare the land for farming and purchase maize seeds.

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en:
At the age of 23, Minerva got married. She did not finish her college because she married early. Minerva does not feel regret at her early marriage and at not finishing her education because she is married to a loving and responsible man. They strive to give the opportunity to their children by sending them to school.

Minerva has been in different businesses like selling fruit and vegetables but she much prefers to sell home products like plates, glasses, bowls and table cloths. Minerva dreams of putting up a mini-bakery but she has insufficient capital to make it happen. She continues to work hard and earn a higher income to prepare for putting up what she dreams of.

Minerva is seeking a loan of P10,000 to buy additional plates, glasses, bowls, ladles, spoons and forks to sell. Minerva hopes to see her children finish their education and became professionals someday, through the income she earns from the business.

loans.use: to buy additional plates, glasses, bowls, ladles, spoons and forks to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 30 years old and has three children who are between the ages of 6 months and 7 years old.  Her husband builds houses.  Beatrice sells vegetables, which she has been doing for the last four years. This business has enabled her to build a family house. 

Beatrice needs a loan to buy more vegetables and fruit to increase her business profits.  She will use the additional profits to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fruit to sell.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Nancy has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. 

Nancy has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Nancy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es:
Genoveva de 49 años de edad, vive en su casa propia con su esposo e hijo, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

La actividad que desarrolla Genoveva es la agricultura, cuenta con sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra limón y mango, una vez que realiza su cosecha sus productos los ofrece a los diferentes mercados de Piura y así puede obtener ingresos para cubrir sus gastos de su casa.  También cuenta con algunos animales de corral los cuales cría y luego comercializa.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 800 nuevos soles para comprar fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras como su producto y alimento balanceado para sus animales, con la finalidad que con su cosecha obtenga mejoras económicas para su familia.  Genoveva a pesar de las dificultades  que se presentan en la vida sigue trabajando con mucho esfuerzo para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Genoveva, 49, lives with her husband and son in their own house, one that has electricity but no running water.  It is located in the rural zone of Tambogrande district, Piura department, an area that is characterized by agriculture, cattle raising and handicrafts.

Genoveva is a farmer and she has her own fields where she grows limes and mangos.  Once she harvests them she sells the fruit to different merchants in Piura and that is how she makes enough money to cover the household expenses.  She also has some large animals that she raises and then sells.

She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 800 new sols to buy fertilizer to improve her fields for her crops and balanced feed for her animals so that her harvest gets the best prices for her family.  Despite the difficulties that present themselves to Genoveva in her life, she continues working with a lot of effort to get her family ahead.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to improve her fields for her crops and to purchase balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: Nazer Anthony

texts.en:
Nazer Anthony lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Phillippines. He is 27 years old, married, and has three children. 

Nazer Anthony owns a shop, where he sells goods such as noodles, biscuits, and canned goods. He has operated this business for a year. He requested a loan of PHP 40000 to purchase additional stock. 

Nazer Anthony has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future, he hopes to send his children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock, such as noodles, biscuits, and canned goods

loans.name: Carmen Eusebia

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra: Carmen; La socia tiene 65 años de edad, es casada, y tiene 2 hijos, la socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de lubricentro,pero ahora ha abierto una pequeña tienda de abarrotes donde vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche y aceites,por medio de sus negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y mejorar el negocio de lubricentro.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos como arroz,azucar,leche y aceite al por mayor y tambien para comprar materiales para su lubricentro.

La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Carmen is 65 years old, married, and has two children.  She still has her business in automotive services, but now she has opened a small grocery store where she sells essential goods like rice, sugar, milk, and oil. Through her businesses, Carmen has given her children a good start in life, and she would like to expand and improve the grocery store business and to improve the automotive business. 

Carmen is asking for a loan for the wholesale buying of goods like rice, sugar, milk, and oil and also to buy supplies for her automotive business. 

She is pleased with the loan she has received and promises to make her payments by the given deadline.

loans.use: to buy wholesale goods like rice, sugar, milk, and oil and also to buy supplies for her automotive business.

loans.name: Padre Rolando Escobar Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Padre Rolando Escobar” está conformado por 17 emprendedoras, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran principalmente el comercio. Todas ellas pertenecientes a la ciudad de Linares.
María integrante del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en la última fila y su cabello es color rubio. Se dedica al rubro del comercio desde hace 10 años. Específicamente ofrece y vende abarrotes, bebidas, carnes, artículos de aseo, lácteos y confites en un almacén que tiene ubicado en el terreno de su casa.
Su mercadería la compra todas las semanas y sus proveedores le ofrecen los artículos directamente en su domicilio.
Ella trabaja de lunes a domingo en un horario de 8ºº de la mañana  a 11ºº de la noche.
Con el crédito comprará mercadería para abastecer su negocio.
Las metas para su negocio, principalmente son ampliar el espacio físico que ocupa, comenta que le va muy bien, por lo que necesita comprar en mayores cantidades de mercadería.
María vive junto a su marido y sus dos hijas de 13 y 8 años de edad. Comenta que su hija mayor es quien la ayuda en el negocio, cuando tiene tiempo libre, ya que debe ocuparse la mayor parte del tiempo a estudiar. 
María está muy contenta y agradecida del apoyo que le ha brindado Fondo esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además disfruta de las reuniones impartidas y del grupo del cual forma parte.
Linares es un importante centro urbano de la región del Maule, ubicado en la zona centro del país. En esta zona se desarrolla de manera importante la producción agrícola y también vitivinícola sobresaliendo en el ámbito de las exportaciones. Destacan los cultivos de cereales (arroz, trigo, maíz y avena), hortalizas (remolacha, repollo, lechuga y acelga y legumbres) y frutas. Linares es la principal provincia productora de arroz, en Chile; de hecho, el 78% de la producción nacional de este cereal se da en esta provincia, especialmente en la comuna de Parral.
texts.en:
This community bank is called 'Padre Rolando Escobar' and it is made up of 17 entrepreneurial women who work in different business activities, mainly  commerce.  They all live in the city of Linares.

María is a member of this community bank.  She is in the back row of the photograph and has red hair.  She has been working in commerce for 10 years.  She sells groceries, drinks, meat, toiletries, dairy products and sweet treats in a grocery store that she has on her property.

María buys her merchandise every week and her suppliers sell her products directly in her home.  She works from Monday to Sunday, from 8.00am to 11.00pm.  She will use this loan to buy merchandise with which to stock her business.

María's goals for her business are mainly to expand the physical space in which it is located.  She says that her business is doing very well and so she needs to buy merchandise in larger quantities.

María lives together with her husband and her two daughters who are 13 and 8 years old.  She says that her older daughter helps her in the business when she has free time but most of the time she is studying.

María is very happy and grateful for the support that Fondo Esperanza have given her as it has enabled her to invest in her business.  She also enjoys the meetings and likes the group that she belongs to.

Linares is an important urban center which is located in Maule region, in the central area of the country.  Farming and wine growing are important businesses in this area.  They are very big exports.  Cereal growing (rice, wheat, corn and oats) is very important, as is vegetable growing (beets, cabbage, lettuce and chard), and fruit growing.  Linares is Chile's main rice-growing province.  In fact, 78% of the national rice production comes from this province, especially from Parral district.

loans.use: to buy merchandise with which to stock her store

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Мухаббат занимается растениеводством. При доме у нее имеется участок земли, где она выращивает бахчевые культуры и овощи. Ей 46 лет. Она замужем. У нее пятеро детей. Она берет кредит для закупа минеральных удобрений и семян.
texts.en: Muhabbat is involved in agriculture.  She has a plot of land by her house, where she grows melons crops and vegetables.  Muhabbat is 46 years old, married and has five children.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers and seeds.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Maria Delia

texts.es: Maria Delia se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pasteles, ademas tiene otro negocio que es la de costura que tambien se ayuda con este negocio generando mas ingreso para la familia. Desde hace mas de 16 años que tiene este medio de vida. Fue por iniciativa propia que decide comenzar con esta actividad ya que necesitaba ingresos para el sustento de sus hijos que son 2 y sacarlos adelante. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de huevos, harina, piña, harina, pollo, queso, leche, entre otros productos necesarios para su elaboración. Ella sueña con mejorar su vivienda y poder proporcionarle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria Delia makes and sells pastries. She also has a second business which is sewing, enabling her to generate additional income for her family.

She has had this livelihood for more than 16 years. It was through her own initiative that she decided to start this activity, as she needed income for supporting her two children, and for helping them get ahead in life.

The purpose of the loan is to buy eggs, flour, pineapple, chicken, cheese, milk, and other ingredients needed for her baking.

She dreams about improving her house, and providing her children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy eggs, flour, pineapple, chicken, cheese, milk, and other necessary products.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
El socio Raul pertenece al banco comunal "MAMACHA ASUNTA DE CALCA"; El banco se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Calca perteneciente al departamento de Cusco, a una hora de la ciudad del Cusco.

El socio tiene 34 años de edad y es soltero, El socio tiene una panadería y se dedica  ala atención, elaboración, y venta de los panes, pasteles y todo en cuanto salga de su panadería. El socio en esta ocasión desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de insumos, el socio comprara harina al por mayor, manteca, levadura, leña todo esto para el horno y continuar con el incremento de sus ganancias. El socio desea el prestamo para invertir en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de panes y pasteles.


El socio agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Raul belongs to the communal bank "MAMACHA ASUNTA DE CALCA"; The bank is located in the province of Calca, in the department of Cusco, an hour away from the city of Cusco. 

This member is 34 years old and single. He has a bakery and he dedicates himself to the making and sale of breads, cakes and everything that comes out of his bakery. On this occasion Raul hopes to invest his loan to purchase ingredients, and he will buy wholesale flour, butter, yeast, and firewood for the oven, and will continue with the increase in his earnings. He wishes for this loan to invest in the purchase of ingredients to make breads and cakes. 

He appreciates this loan and promises to comply with debt repayments in the timeframe established.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of ingredients to make breads and cakes

loans.name: Ramzo

texts.ru: Рамзо добрая и трудолюбия женщина. Она вдова и имеет троих детей. Более 20 лет она занимается скотоводством. Она также работает на молочной ферме. Сын тоже работает на ферме. Имеет 10 голов крупного рогатого скота. В бизнесе помогают дети. Рамзо хочет расширить свой бизнес и улучшить свои жилищные условия. С этой целью она запрашивает займ для покупки крупного рогатого скота. Рамзо надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en: Ramzo is a kind and hardworking woman.  She is a widow and has three children.  She has been involved in animal husbandry for over 20 years.  Ramzo also works at a milk farm.  Her son also works there.  She owns 10 heads of cattle.  Her children help her with the business.  Ramzo wants to expand her business and improve her living conditions.  To achieve this goal, she is requesting a loan to purchase cattle.  Ramzo relies on your help and mercy.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Keyla Maylee

texts.es:
Keyla es una mujer emprendedora, tiene 31 años de edad y vive en la Ciudad de Cañete con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Desde hace varios años trabaja como jornalera en los campos agrícolas de toda la zona de Cañete. 
Tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante por lo cual se levanta todos los días muy temprano para ir a trabajar y en las tardes enseña a sus hijos las tareas que les dejan en el colegio y comparte con ellos buenos momentos.
Keyla está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella realizará la instalación para poder tener luz eléctrica en su vivienda y de esta manera puedan sentir mayor comodidad y mejorar su calidad de vida; y poco a poco con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación podrán cumplir su más grande sueño: "Construir su casa de material noble".
texts.en:
Keyla is an enterprising woman. She is 31 years old and lives in the city of Cañete with her husband and their 2 children. She has been working for several years as a day labourer in agricultural fields in all areas of Cañete. 

She has a drive to get ahead which is why she gets up very early each day to go to work. In the afternoons she helps her children with their homework and shares good times with them.

Keyla is very grateful to Kiva lenders because with their help she is able to install electricity in her house so she can feel more comfortable and have a better quality of life. Slowly, with much effort and dedication, she will fulfill her biggest dream: “To build her house with solid material.”

loans.use: to install a meter for electricity.

loans.name: Yustina

texts.en:
Yustina is a 24-year-old entrepreneur living with her parents in Iringa District, Tanzania. She is a Camfed Learner Guide who volunteers two and half hours per week to teach life skills in her nearby secondary school. 

Yustina requests a Kiva loan to start a business selling second hand clothes in her community. 

Yustina plans to use the profits from the loan to expand her business and pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: To start a business of selling second hand clothes (used clothes) in her community

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase on Capital

loans.name: Vagif

texts.en:
Vagif was born in  1951 in Yenikand village,Salyan region. He is married and has 3 children.
Vagif has run this business for 6 years.
He supplies milk in the village and nearby markets.With this business he meets he needs of his family.
Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy 3 calves.

loans.use: To buy 3 calves

loans.name: Lilly

texts.en: Cracking open a coconut and sticking a straw in it is a traditional Samoan refreshment. Lilly has a small plot of land with coconut trees. She harvests the coconuts and takes them to the main market and will crack them open for you to drink right away.  In a good week, she can earn up to ST 400 (about USD 150) by selling these coconuts. Lilly says that one of the main benefits of having joined SPBD and using the micro-loan facilities to start up her coconut business is that she has been able to use her profit to fix up her home.

loans.use: Machetes and other tools for harvesting coconuts

loans.name: Maria Ignacia

texts.es:
Maria Ignacia is a very hard-working woman; she is married and has two children. Her husband was left without employment for two years and debts were accumulating; in order to get out of economic troubles, Maria and two of her friends decided to create their own business, they dedicated themselves to the fashioning and sale of tamales, which is a typical Mexican food. The strength and good work that they realized has been the basis of this business's success.

In order to cover the demand for their products, Maria Ignacia asks for a loan of $925 that she will use in the purchase of "insumos" that she needs; she commits herself to pay back this amount in six months. Contribute to the growth of this business; form part of Maria's success; deciD. to help her.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Ignacia es una mujer muy trabajadora, elL. es casada y tiene dos hijos. Su esposo se quedó sin empleo hace dos años y las deudas se fueron acumulando, para poder salir D. los problemas económicos Maria y dos D. sus amigas decidieron iniciar su propio negocio, se dedican a L. elaboración y venta D. tamales, que es un alimento típico D. México. El esfuerzo y el buen trabajo que realizan han sido L. base del éxito D. este negocio.

Para poder cubrir L. demanda que tienen sus productos, Maria Ignacia solicita un préstamo D. $ 925 dólares que utilizará en L. compra D. insumos que necesita, elL. se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Contribuye al crecimiento D. este negocio, forma parte D. los logros D. Maria, decídete a ayudarL..

loans.use: Purchase of tamale ingredients.  Compra de insumos

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
Business Description

Gilberto has 5 years of experience owning his own business. Since he was young he has enjoyed working. He began by selling seafood with the help of a friend. Together with his daughter he rents a sapce where they began selling foods. They work Monday through Saturday from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m, and his energy helps him keep his business going. The business is locatied in the commercial sector where there is high demand, and people come looking for them because of the great flavors his daughter is able to cook up.

Loan Use

This loan is being requested so that Gilberto can make improvements to his business space. He plans to purchase a door and a small piece of glass window where he hopes to sell ceviches and empanadas. He is also hoping to install an air conditioner is the eating area of his restaurant, in order to improve the service he provides to his clients.

Personal Information

Gilberto is 48 years old and has 3 children. The youngest is is school, and the other 2 are working. His daughter works with him, and is also studying at the university. She wants to be an architect. Gilberto has been seperated from his wife for 2 years. He is an example for his children, of whom he is very proud. In his house he has been able to contruct a space to run his business. He also hopes to sell during the weekends, and he wishes for help to realize his dreams.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva Volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

Gilberto tiene una experiencia de 5 años con su negocio propio. Desde joven le ha gustado trabajar. Se inicio con la venta de mariscos por medio de un amigo. Junto a su hija alquilaron un local donde empezaron con la venta de comida. Trabajan de lunes a sábado en horario de 8 a.m. hasta las 7pm. Ha podido mantener los dos negocios con su esfuerzo. Esta ubicado en un sector comercial donde tiene buena demanda. La gente lo busca por la sazón que le da su hija a sus platos.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo solicita para poder adecuar su local. Comprar una puerta de vidrio y una vitrina pequeña. En la que piensa vender corviches, empanadas. Posee un aire acondicionado el que lo piensa instalar en su local. Mejorando de esta manera el servicio a sus clientes.

Información Personal

Gilberto tiene 48 años y 3 hijos. El menor de ellos estudia. Y los otros dos ya trabajan .Una es su hija que además también estudia en la universidad. Sigue la carrera de arquitectura. Esta separado de su esposa hace dos años. El se ha convertido en el ejemplo para sus hijos. Los que están orgullosos. En su casa ha podido construir un local. Piensa en el también vender encocado los fines de semana. Espera con la inversión poder cumplir sus sueños.

loans.use: To make improvements to his business space

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase pigs to raise and sell for a profit.

loans.name: Thi Dung

texts.vi:
Mrs. Dung, 20 years old, is married and has one children. Her family is living in Nghiem Xa village, Bac Ninh, where business on wasted materials is every common. This activity is very stable and the income is enough for her family basic living cost. Every day, she buys used books, newspapers, waste-paper, and plastic or metal goods from the retailers and then sells them to the recycling plants. She hopes to borrow money to assist her activities in business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Dung 20 tuổi đã lập gia đình và có 1 con nhỏ. Gia đình chị sống ở thôn Nghiêm Xá, Bắc Ninh là nơi có nghề thu mua phế liệu. Công việc này rất ổn định và thu nhập kiếm được đủ để trang trải các khoản chi tiêu cơ bản của gia đình. Hàng ngày chị mua lại các loại sách, báo, giấy vụn cũng như là các hộp nhựa hay đồ kim loại cũ từ những người bán lẻ và sau đó bán buôn lại cho các cơ sở chế biến đồ tái sử dụng. Chị hy vọng có thêm vốn để hỗ trợ cho các hoạt động trong công việc kinh doanh của chị.

loans.use: To assist in business

loans.name: Olena

texts.en:
Olena S. is divorced and lives in Ivano-Frankivsk with her 12-year-old son. She owns a small business selling women’s lingerie at the central city mall called “Prikarpattya”. Olena offers a huge assortment of inventory and the range of prices is quite diverse too. A loan she received from Nadiya Ukraine promoted the growth of her business. Olena has been in the trade for 10 years. Currently, she has about $8000 in inventory. Her monthly income is about $1400.

Olena’s business is the only source of income for her family. After the birth of her son, Olena worked as a market vendor and then started her small venture in the central city mall. Today she would like to get a loan of $600 to buy a variety of lingerie wholesale for further retail sale. One of her dreams is to give her son the chance to get good college education which is why she is ready to work long hours to generate more profits and be able to afford it.

loans.use: To purchase inventory wholesale

loans.name: Ann

texts.es:
Ann has an account with the community bank Corazon de Jesus, located in the Jr. Carmen Cabrejos No. 762, in the Calleria district, within the city of Ucayali. She is 45 years of age, is mother of 4 children and her husband is a carpenter. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, one of S/ 300, she decided to invest the funds in a tailoring shop.

Today she continues to work in her tailoring shop and she also busy and sells goods, for which she has to travel to Lima to get items at a good price for resale. Once she's done selling the goods she uses those earnigs to purchase fabrics to create bedsheets.

With the loan of $450, which will be repaid in a term of 4 months, she will invest the funds into the purchase of items such as skirts, blouses, slacks, shirts, polo-style shirts, shoes, belts, and fashion jewelery, etc.

Ann feel very happy since she has gained the support of Manuela Ramos. She has become an even more hardworking and entrepreneurial woman.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.
