La señora Ann pertenece al banco comunal Corazón de Jesús, ubicado en el Jr. Carmen Cabrejos N° 762, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 45 años, es madre de 4 hijos y su esposo es carpintero. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300 decide invertir en un taller de costura. En la actualidad sigue con el taller de costura y también se dedica a la compra y venta de mercadería, para lo cual tiene que viajar a Lima a comprar a un precio cómodo y luego venderlo. Una vez que termina de vender su mercadería utiliza su capital para comprar telas y confeccionar sus prendas y sábanas. Con el préstamo de S/.1,300 el cual pagará en 4 meses, invertirá en la compra de mercadería como faldas, blusas, pantalones, camisas, polos, zapatos, correas, fantasía fina, etc. Ann se siente muy contenta desde que cuenta con el apoyo de Manuela Ramos, se volvió una mujer más empeñosa y emprendedora.

loans.use: to purchase skirts, blouses, and slacks, etc.

loans.name: Cesar Eli

texts.es:
Mr. M. C. is a 35-year-old surgeon who lives in house #99 in the Madrid neighborhood. He is married with two children, ages 3 and 3 months. His wife is a lawyer and works as a legal consultant for the DGI [General Directorate of Revenue] located in Juigalpa, Chontales. Mr. M. has been working as a surgeon for 8 years now and is well known in his professional organization. For 7 years he has been working at the Asuncion medical center. Together with his wife, he has been able to purchase a home. They would like to improve it with a new room, which is currently made of wood. This way they can have more security and better family living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Martínez C. de 35 años de edad, habita en el barrio Madrid, casa # 99, medico cirujano de profesión, casado, con 2 hijos, uno de 3 años y otro de 3 meses de edad, su esposa es de profesión abogado, labora para la DGI Juigalpa, Chontales como asesor legal; el Sr. Martínez tiene 8 años de ejercer su profesión de medio y de reputación conocida en su gremio, actualmente se desempeña en la Empresa Medica Asunción con 7 años de laborar en este centro; junto a su esposa han logrado adquirir su vivienda, que pretenden mejorar con una habitación, ya que en la actualidad ésta es de madera, y así tener mejor seguridad y condiciones de vida familiar.

loans.use: To make home improvements

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
In a city called Yaguaron, 15 km. away from our Paraguari branch office, there is a group of women with full of entrepreneurial ideas. They want to do something to improve their quality of life and they know that the only way to do that is by working very hard.

They are involved in many activities. Some of them own a grocery store, others a sewing workshop; some are housekeepers; others sell different products from food and vegetables to underwear. The credit provided would be used to buy raw materials depending on their business. For example, fabrics, food and drinks.

This group of 16 women called “San Francisco” has been working with Fundacion Paraguaya showing us an excellent performance in its payment.

loans.use: Its loans would be invested in each of their activities. Purchase of fabrics, thread, meta, drinks, milk, pasta, rice, lingerie, fruits, and vegetables.

loans.name: Albina

texts.es:
Albina is a member of the Community Bank Yachay Wasi which means “house of knowledge” in Quechua.

Albina is married, is 46 years old and has 7 children. Albina sells wood, which she obtains in the forest of Ayacucho. She moves the wood with cars that she rents. She distributes her products to carpenter shops.

Albina needs a loan of USD $ 550, money which will be invested in the purchase of moena and tornillo wood.

Albina dreams of one day owning her own car for the transport of her products, her own home and the ability to provide a good education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Albina es socia del Banco Comunal Yachay Wasi que significa Casa del Saber en quechua.

Albina es casada, tiene 46 años y 7 hijos, Albina vende madera, que adquiere en la selva ayacuchana, el transporte de la madera lo realiza con carros que alquila, sus productos los distribuye a carpinterías.

Albina necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de madera moena y tornillo.

Los sueños de Albina son tener un carro propio para el transporte de sus productos, casa propia y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Albina needs a loan of USD $ 550, money which will be invested in the purchase of moena and tornillo wood.

loans.name: Abdukavi

texts.ru:
Abdukavi has been buying and selling cattle for years, even as a child, with his father, he raised domestic cattle and that's where he learned all the secrets of the trade.

Now, he's a professional with a good business sense. He started out his business buing and selling small cattle and gradually began to buy and raise large livestock.

Today, he goes from district to district to buy cattle from one and sell to another. He uses part of the profits for his family's subsistance, and the other part he puts back into his business.

He has been working with Microinvest for a year, and in this time, has proven himself to be punctual with his payments. Abdukavi has applied for a new loan to help him further expand his business.

Translated from the Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva volunteer.

Абдукави уже много лет занимается куплей продажей скота. С детства он еще вместе с отцом занимался выращиванием скота дома и оттуда познал все секреты этого занятия.

Сейчас он уже профессионал и знает толк в своем деле. Свой бизнес начинал с купли продажи мелкого скота, постепенно стал покупать и выращивать крупный рогатый скот. На сегодняшний день он ездит по району и покупает скот в одном месте а перепродает в другом и получаемый доход частично тратит на семейные расходы а другую часть вкладывает в бизнес.

С Микроинвест сотрудничает год и за это время показал себя пунктуальным клиентом. В планах у Абдукави дальнейшее расширение бизнеса и поэтому он обратился за новым займом.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Sokhon

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhon L. is a beef seller in Preak Takeo Village in Kandal Province, while her husband, Mr. Sitha Nov, is a construction worker. They have two children, both attending school. Although she and her husband have businesses, they still cannot support their family well. Therefore, Mrs. Sokhon L. is requesting a loan to start a pig breeding business in order to improve her living conditions.

She previously obtained a loan from Acleda Bank to start her current business and has fully repaid it. Within the last two years, Mrs. Sokhon L. gave birth to her youngest child, and her medical expenses totaled $750. Starting a new business will enable the family to more readily deal with any future expenses. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To start a pig breeding business in order to improve her living conditions.

loans.name: Irene Mapuga's Azizi Group

texts.en:
Irene M., age 42, is married and has three children ages 23, 20 and 12. Since 1990, she has run a business selling drinks. She starts her workday at 10 a.m. at ends it at 10 p.m. on weekdays and 11 p.m. on weekends. She makes a monthly profit of about $280.

In the past, Irene has taken out two loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her supply of items to sell. She paid these loans back successfully and now hopes for a new loan to buy more drinks and more chairs. She will share these funds with her loan group, Azizi, which totals 16 members. These people hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

In the picture, Irene is the first person on the left in the front row.

loans.use: To increase her supply of drinks and buy chairs

loans.name: Martha Esther

texts.es:
Martha es socia del Banco Comunal Inti.

Martha es separada, tiene 42 años y 2 hijos, Martha es docente y trabaja en una escuela primaria de Asentamiento Humano Los Artesanos ubicado en la periferia de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Martha vende productos de belleza por catalogo de las líneas Esika, Avon que ofrece a amigos, familiares, amigos, en sus tiempos libres y también vende productos naturales llamados Biolife. En algunas oportunidades Martha vende ropa a pedido, que adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.

Martha necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de jabones, cremas, champú y colonias. Los sueños de Martha son ampliar la construcción de su casa, que sus hijos sean profesionales y ahorrar más.
texts.en:
Martha is a member of Sun Communal Bank.

Martha is 42 years old, separated, and has two children. She works as a teacher at a the Asentamiento Humano Los Artesanos primary school located on the periphery of the city of Ayacucho. Martha sells beauty products by catalog from the Esika and Avon lines. She offers the products to friends and acquaintances in her free time, and she also sells natural products called Biolife. Sometimes she sells clothing by order, which she buys in Lima.

Martha needs a loan of 1,000 soles ($350) which will be invested in the purchase of soaps, creams, shampoos and colognes. Martha’s dreams are to expand her home, that her children will be professionals, and to save more money.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soaps, creams, shampoos and colognes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a nail art printer, nail polish, and acrylic and gel nails

loans.name: Shakeela M.saleem Group

texts.en:
Shakeela baji is the wife of M., and they reside in the city of Borewala, Pakistan, where they have lived for the past 2 years. She is the mother of eight children: six daughters and two sons. Her two eldest daughters are married, her third daughter is a teacher, and her other daughters stay at home where they help her make decorative, embroidered dresses. As for her sons, her oldest son works at a catering business (and she notes that he has been in this business for the past 8 years), while her youngest son is a student in the 8th standard. Shakeela baji’s husband has a (chicken) meat-selling business.

As alluded to above, Shakeela baji herself has a decorative, embroidery business. Specifically, she takes orders for embroidered dresses from her customers, and she then makes such dresses to earn a profit. Notably, she has already successfully repaid two prior loans from Asasah, a microfinance institute of Pakistan. Now she is applying for another loan to buy materials (e.g., utensils, chairs, and table clothes) to help expand her son’s catering business.

Shakeela baji is joined in her loan group by four other members: Fazilat baji seeks a loan to buy materials (e.g., colored threads, beads, clothes, and sketches) to display in her boutique; Shamim baji requests a loan to buy materials (e.g., colored threads and clothes) for her decorative, embroidery business; Wakeelan baji would like a loan to buy engine oil to resell; and Fatima baji is in need of a loan to buy colors for her tie-die business. This is a group loan; as such, the loan proceeds will be distributed amongst the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. Notably, the group members mutually guarantee one another's loans; as a result, if one group member does not repay her portion of the loan, then the other members are responsible for curing the arrears.

loans.use: To expand and improve her son's catering business by purchasing additional materials (e.g., utensils, chairs, and table cloths)

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza tiene 50 años, es madre de 2 hijos, vive junto a su esposo que la apoya en todo lo posible. Desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de ropa para niños y adultos, su esposo, quien es trabajador independiente la apoya mucho en su negocio durante los momentos que le es factible. Ella se levanta muy temprano para preparar la comida del día, luego se lleva a vender su prendas por  los diferentes lugares de su zona. Le es muy rentable porque ya cuenta con una clientela selecta y le va muy bien. Es su primer préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a ser puntual en sus cuotas. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más ropa, además mandará a construir en su propia casa un local, para poner su tienda de ropa.
texts.en:
Maritza is 50-year-old mother with 2 children. She lives with her husband, who supports her with everything he possibly can. For a year, she has been selling apparel for children and adults. Her husband, who is self-employed, helps her with the business whenever possible. She gets up very early in the morning to prepare the meals for the day, then goes to sell her garments in the different parts of her zone. The business is very lucrative because she has a solid client-base, which makes it prosper. This is her first loan with MFP, which is why she promises to be punctual with her monthly installments. With the money she is requesting, she will purchase more apparel, as well as have an office space built in her home so that she can set up her own clothing boutique.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build an office space for her business

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania!

Rehema I. from Dar es Salaam has been running a cloth and clothing business since 1994. She sells a variety of items including vitambaa (thick cloth with bold and colorful patterns used to make Tanzanian traditional clothing), viatu (shoes), mikoba (bags), madira (plus size clothing for women), and nguoza watoto (children’s clothing).

She works at the business for 5-8 hours a day. Rehema currently earns about $100 USD a month from her business. She is is 37 years old, single with 2 children, who are 11 and 15 years old.  She is requesting a loan of $375 USD to expand her business by increasing her inventory. Rehema thanks you for your support!


ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To expand her business by increasing her inventory

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia B., 42 years old, is married and lives at San Pedro, Dapitan City. She is blessed with 9 children, and only 5 are in school. Her husband is a driver and sometimes a laborer at Pier, Dapitan City.

They really experience crisis in their family, especially with financial matters. It is not easy to raise 9 children, and they need to sacrifice and work very hard for them to be able to eat. She joined Paglaum on April 27, 2007, and the loan she availed was used to open a sari-sari store in front of their house. They generate income from this, and she is able to send some of her children to school.

Just this January 16, 2009, she got a loan of 14,500 for the purpose of expanding her sari-sari store business, and she wants to add more grocery items, school supplies and other items to her store.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for her sari-sari store

location.town: Dipolog-San Pedro, Dapitan City, Zambo.Del Norte

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Mrs. Maribel G., 41, married to Danilo, a farmern, is blessed with one son. Presently, she is residing at Napilan, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She was recognized as member of PDP-LP, the micro-finance Program of Paglaum last April 28, 2006. She is presently operating a small sari-sari (variety) store located at their residence. She started it through her first loan from the Cooperative amounting to PHP 2,500.

In  two years of being a PMPC member she learned how to manage a small business, save money and attended various training activities. She is very thankful to PMPC for the programs and services that help her a lot. She is now on her 7th loan amounting to  PHP 14,500.00 to be used as additional capital of  her sari-sari store.  She will purchase additional grocery items such as canned goods, rice, condiments and many others. She plans to expand her business to become a mini grocery someday. 

Her greatest ambition in life is be able to let her son finish college and have a decent home for the family.

loans.use: Additional Grocery Items for sale

loans.name: Rebeka

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 35 year old Rebeka M. from Tukuyu. She is married with 3 children, between the ages of 5 and 15. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting 2 dependants because their parents died of HIV.

Rebeka has been running a crops selling business since 2003. Her business purchases crops from farmers and sells them in town for a higher price. She works at the business 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Rebeka currently earns about 65USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 325USD in order to purchase bags of rice and beans in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and the range of her business. Rebeka thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase bags of rice and beans in bulk

loans.name: Suitaitaifono

texts.en: Suitaitaifono F., 30, is married with 2 children.  She has 5 years of experience in the laundry business. She sells to the general public 7 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 208 Tala.  SPBD loans are Suitaitaifono’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To improve her laundry business

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Âgée de 33 ans, mariée  mère  de 4 enfants, Mariam S. a un statut de mariage polygame, mais vit seule avec  son mari et ses enfants  dans le quartier Sogomougou  de la préfecture de Koutiala ( Région de Sikasso ). 
Pour des raisons sociales elle n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Très tôt elle s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment  l’embouche qu’elle  a   appris auprès de sa maman. Elle exerce  cette activité depuis maintenant 8 ans  et elle lui est très rentable.  Elle peut vendre plus de 15 têtes dans le mois, pour les seuls clients étrangers. Sa notoriété ne cesse d’augmenter et elle est très sollicitée.    
Pour  la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle, et l’augmentation de  son chiffre d’affaire, Madame Mariam S. a décidé de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis 5 ans.  Après avoir  8 prêts  solidaires  (prêt de groupe ) tous payés correctement sans difficulté, elle est à son 2 ème prêt individuel dont le précédent à été également bien remboursé. Madame Mariam envisage utiliser ce prêt pour l’achat  de 30 têtes  et des aliments bétail.  Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants  et dans la ville de Koutiala  et effectue sa vente dans le marché à bétail  de la ville de Koutiala à des clients Ivoiriens très généralement au comptant.   Madame compte sur un bénéfice de 150 000 FCFA par mois qu’elle envisage utiliser pour le remboursement des d’intérêts du prêt, contribuer aux dépenses  de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mariam S., age 33, is married and the mother of four. Her status is that she is in a polygamous marriage, though she lives alone with her husband and her children in the Sogomougou district of Koutiala prefecture (Sikasso region). For societal reasons, she did not attend school. She soon got interested in working to earn an income, notably in fattening livestock, a trade she learned from her mother. She has been in this business for eight years now, and it is very profitable. She can sell over fifteen heads of livestock each month for just foreign customers.

To do right by her customers and to increase her sales figures, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso five years ago. After eight solidarity loans (group loans), all correctly repaid without difficulty, she is on her second individual loan. The preceding loan was also repaid.

Ms. Mariam envisions using this loan to buy thirty heads of livestock and some feed. She supplies herself in and around the village of Koutiala and makes her sales generally in cash transactions at the livestock marketplace of Koutiala. Customers includes those from the Cote d'Ivoire.

She is counting on a profit of 150,000 francs CFA per month to be used to make loan interest payments, to help cover family expenses, and to invest the rest in her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep

loans.name: Cythia

texts.en: Cynthia is a businesswoman at Kasoa. She trades in lace, materials and cloths. She is married and blessed with one child, who is currently in school. Cynthia is very supportive to her family through her trading business. She has been selling for the past three years but progress has persistently been low due to insufficient funds. She hopes this loan will enable her to revive her business and to make it more viable. She wants to purchase lace, in bulk, and materials and clothes to increase her inventory. She believes she would be able to save more to provide her children with a quality education. She belongs to the group called victory Trust Group. The group provides assistance and support to one another in repaying their loans.

loans.use: To purchase bulk lace and materials and clothes.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity E. sells clothes and sarongs. She is 32-years old and married with one child. She is requesting a loan so she can purchase more sarongs and clothes to sell. Having more merchandise will increase her income and help her business service more customers. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and sarongs to sell.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Abdul K. is forty-three years old, married, and has four children: a daughter and three sons. Some are currently in the senior high while others are in the junior high and the primary schools. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. His wife is a trader.

K. also trades in cereals such as maize, beans, millet, etc. He buys his goods from nearby communities at affordable prices and sells at the market square in his community. He supplies to food vendors and retailers. K. also treks to other markets to sell. He has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. He aspires to expand his business and sponsor his children in school.

loans.use: To buy cereals in bulk

loans.name: Lipa

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Lipa R. from Mwanza. She is single with two children between the ages of 9 and 20 years old. Lipa has been running a tailoring business since 2005. Her business is to make clothes for women. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Lipa currently earns about 240 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to purchase thread and a sewing machine. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Lipa thanks you for her support!


ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase thread and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Granito De Oro Group

texts.es: La asociación “Granito de Oro” pertenece al centro focal Germán Buch, a la fecha esta formada por doce integrantes. Diferentes son los negocios de este grupo, como ser; venta de caramelos, cosméticos, ropa, comida, pero  en su mayoría son artesanos, se dedican al trenzado de mantas. Tal es el caso de Tatiana, una joven madre de vente años, que aprendió este oficio de sus padres, ella desea comprar una maquina tejedora que le permita aumentar su producción. Del mismo modo sus compañeras solicitan créditos para la compra de materia prima y maquinaria especial,  de este modo  aumentar sus ventas y obtener mayores ingresos para sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Granito de Oro Association belongs to the Germán Buch community center. There are currently 12 members. The members of the group have different businesses like selling candy, cosmetics, clothes, and food. However, most of them are artisans. They weave blankets. Such is the case of Tatiana, a young 20 year old mother. She learned this skill from her parents. She wants to buy a weaving machine that will allow her to increase her production. Her colleagues also are asking for loans to buy raw material and special machinery to increase their sales and get greater income for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material

loans.name: Kuini

texts.en:
Kuini P. (10100006914) is a 25-year-old woman living in the town of Toamua Safune.  She is married and has one infant child.  To make a living, Kuini owns & operates a business harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community.  Kuini has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 250 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Kuini joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Kuini is requesting for the first time a loan from SPBD of 1000 WST, which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.  The loan will be the first loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Kuini plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Bibi Pakia Group

texts.en: Bibi Pakia is the group leader of Bibi Pakia group. There are three members in this group. They are requesting a loan to expand businesses. They are requesting a group of loan 30,000 Afghani. Bibi Pakia wants to take a loan for her husband who has general store. Fwazia wants to take a loan for her husband who has fuel selling shop. Hadala wants to take a loan for the business of a beauty salon. They all very thankful for Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding businesses

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La señora  Gregoria es socia del  Banco Comunal “Nueva Flor”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 41 años de edad, estado civil casada y es madre de 3 hijos y estudio educación primaria incompleta (3er grado), vive en el centro poblado Rosa Cami.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 6 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, para la compra de ganado ovino.

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, este dinero lo invertirá en la compra de ganado ovino para cría, y alimento balanceado para truchas.

Su mayor deseo continuar trabajando y educar a  sus hijos.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y los encuentros.
texts.en:
Sra. Gregoria is a member of the Communal Bank “Nueva Flor” (New Flower), which is located in the District of Ilave, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 41 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children. Sra. Gregoria has a 3rd grade education and lives in the central village of Rosa Cami.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 6 years. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy sheep.

She is currently requesting a loan of in the amount of 1500 soles to acquire more sheep for breeding and feed for her trout pond.

Sra. Gregoria hopes to continue working and provide her children with an education. She enjoys her savings and the Communal Bank meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheep & feed for her trout pond

loans.name: Jamila Group

texts.en:
Jamila is the group leader of the two-member Jamila group. Both members would like to expand their businesses and bring about new changes in their businesses and lives. They have requested a group loan of 20000 AFN.

Jamila wants to take a loan for her laboratory. She wants to complete her requirements.

Najeeba is a tailor and would like to buy a new sewing machine and other supplies that she needs.

They would like to extend their gratitude to Kiva lenders for their support of entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To complete the requirements for her laboratory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Liney

texts.en:
Liney S. is from the village of Tinaclaan, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old and married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Liney owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. Liney has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $75 a month from these activities.

In 2008, Liney joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Liney has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Liney is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
la sra Carolina M. C. tiene 64 años de edad, tiene un negocio el cual es de video juegos, su negocio es en su casa de habitacion, este negocio le permite estar en su casa y atender a sus clientes, ella es una persona de edad la cual no puede tener muchos esfuerzos y este negocio es muy bueno para ella ya que no se esfuerza mucho, solo prende las maquinas y cobra antes de que jueguen los clientes.
Carolina se dio cuenta de que este negocio era bueno y tomo la decision de ponerlo, cerca de esta localidad no hay otro negocio como este de video juegos.
ahora quiere invertir en mas maquinas ya que a veces esta lleno y no hay maquinas vacias para otros clientes que vienen y tienen que esperar bastante para poder jugar.
texts.en:
Carolina M. C., 64, runs a video arcade in her home. This allows her to stay home and still take care of her customers. She is an older person that cannot have very strenuous activities so this type of business is very good for her since it is low-key; all she does is turn the machines on and charge her customers before they start to play. Carolina became aware that this was a good business and decided to set it up. There is no other video arcade near her. Now, she wants to invest in more machines since sometimes she is full and there aren't any available machines for other customers who come and have to wait a long time to be able to play.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy video arcade machines.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
S. Farida is a very hardworking woman and knows that each day she has to give her best effort and all her courage. She is married and has three children.

Farida works raising cattle and feeding them with the goal of later selling them. This activity gives her feelings of satisfaction because it allows her to provide a considerable amount of the household income. She makes sure not to neglect her role as a mother, because she’s also very dedicated to lovingly raising her adorable little daughter.

Farida wants to improve her stable stalls and produce milk in a quantity sufficient for selling it commercially. It is for this reason that she’s requesting a loan of 3000 Somoni to buy small cattle and fodder for her animals. Please support this woman who is determined to change the course of her life with dedication and hard work.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase small cattle and feed

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes J. is currently in the business of designing bedspreads and selling them. She also has a beauty salon and is requesting a loan to stock more materials for bedspreads. Agnes is 40 years old and divorced. She has two children and her children do not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a clinic.

About BRAC: BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. The programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more materials to make bedspreads

loans.name: Luzvilla

texts.en: Luzvilla D. is from the village of San Vicente. She is 40 years old, is married, and has five children, three of whom are already adults while the remaining two are still studying. Luzvilla owns and operates a food stall, selling a variety of food products including chicken barbecue in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 2,300 PHP a month. In 2007, Luzvilla joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. Luzvilla is requesting a new loan of 14,500 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital for the business. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and to pay for her children's education. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more used clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bags of flour.

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en: Juditha U. is from the village of Pob. Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 45 years old. Juditha is widowed and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Juditha owns and operates a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from selling specialty food products in the local community. Juditha has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Juditha joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juditha has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Juditha is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Juditha from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Vera

texts.en:
Vera owns a shop where she sells cosmetics – body sprays, lipsticks, facial powder, etc., to customers at retail prices. She started the business in the year 2005. She runs the business with the help of her two children who support her after school hours. Her younger child is 11 years old and is doing well. Her wish is to become mother of graduates in future, and she hopes to assist her husband in paying for her children’s education. Vera also provides other needs like food, clothing etc.

Vera hopes to expand and improve her business and she is requesting for a loan of NGN 80,000  She thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
El Señor  Vicente M., tiene 51 años de edad, está casado con la Señora Maria Viveros, tienen 2 hijos, todos mayores de edad.
Para poder comenzar con esta actividad trabajaba en forma dependiente como chofer de camiones, luego se retiró y con el pago de su liquidación comenzó su trabajo actual, cual es la producción de ladrillos.
    Esta actividad ya lo realiza hace aproximadamente 15 años, por lo que ya posee experiencia en la misma y una clientela formada por la buena calidad de sus productos.
El préstamo solicitado es para la ampliación del horno en donde realiza el quemado de los ladrillos.
 El deseo del Señor Juan es llegar a comprar un pequeño camión para poder llevar su producto y no pagar más por fletes.
texts.en:
Sr. Vicente M. is 51 years old and married to Sra. Maria Viveros. They have two adult children. Before he started this business, he was employed as a truck driver. He later quit and used his severance pay to start his current business of manufacturing bricks. Vicente has been in this business for approximately 15 years. He has the experience and has gained customers due to the good quality of his products.

The loan he is requesting will be used to enlarge the oven he uses for baking bricks. Vicente hopes to buy a small truck for transporting his products so that he does not have to pay extra for freight.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for labor to enlarge the oven he uses for baking bricks

loans.name: Medicia

texts.en:
Medicia B. is from the village of San Simon, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 51 years old, single, and has one adult-aged child. To make a living, Medicia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Medicia has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2007, Medicia joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. She has chosen to request a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her fifth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

location.town: San Simon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Vanessa Manuela

texts.es:
En una vista el Banco Comunal Lomas Del Viento, en un sector apartado de la ciudad de Portoviejo nos reunimos con más de 23 socias que forman parte de este banco, y conversamos con varias de ellas, la señora Vanessa nos colaboró.

La señora Vanessa está casada desde que era una adolescente, tiene 19 años y cuenta con el cariño de su primer bebe de dos añitos, es  nuestra socia  desde hace tres ciclos y nos comentó que no ha sido nada fácil lidiar con tantas ocupaciones pero ha podido salir adelante, se dedica  a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, cuando ella tenía  18 años su cuñada la motivó a que ingrese a Yanbal y desde hace un año se desenvuelve muy bien en el negocio, con los prestamos que ha recibido ha podido comprar los productos, en los actúale momentos son mas los clientes que esta ganado.

Vanessa nos cuenta que durante el tiempo que lleva como  comerciante le ha resultado muy interesante todo lo que ha podido logar hacer, ahora cuenta con su propio capital para invertir todo en los productos que los clientes le encargan para así dejarles más tiempo de crédito. Con este nuevo crédito ya tiene presupuestado ganarse el 30% de todo lo que invierta comprando cremas, delineadores, perfumes, bisutería  y mas productos,  ella  a fututo desea  ponerse un local de comida rápida en la ciudad de Portoviejo, aparte de eso el sueño de nuestra socia es terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
We met up with the 23 members that make up the Lomas Del Viento Communal Bank in the city of Portoviejo and talked to several of them. Ms. Vanessa P. collaborated with us.

Ms. P. has been married since she was a teenager. She is 19 years old and already has her first baby, who is two years old. She has been our client for three loan cycles, and she states that it has not been easy having to deal with so many activities, but she has been able to get ahead. She sells beauty products by catalog for a living. When she was 18, her sister-in-law motivated her to join the Yanbal company, and she has been in business with them for a year. With her previous loans, she has been able to purchase beauty products. Her clientele has now grown.

Vanessa states that during the time that she has been in business, everything that she has been able to do has been very interesting to her. She now has her own capital to invest entirely in purchasing the products that her customers order so that she can give them credit for a longer period of time. With this new loan, she estimates that she will earn 30% of what she has invested by purchasing lotions, lip liners, fragrances, fashion jewelry, and other beauty products. In the future, she would like to have her own fast food place in the city of Portoviejo. Aside from that, our client dreams of finishing construction of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase lotions, lip liners, fragrances, fashion jewelry, and other beauty products

loans.name: Esiya

texts.en: Esiya S. is currently in the business of baking and selling bread and cakes and selling ice cream at the market and is requesting a loan to bake more cakes to sell. Esiya is 25 years old and is married to a builder. She has two children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a shop. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To bake more cakes to sell

loans.name: Madou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Madou Sangaré est un homme marié de 28ans qui vit dans une famille monogame avec  ses deux enfants et son épouse dans le quartier N’gola  dans la  ville de  Fakola  (Sous-préfecture) dans la   troisième région (Sikasso) de la République du Mali. 
Monsieur Madou  Sangaré est éleveur, boucher et vendeur de bétails depuis maintenant huit ans.
Pour augmenter son capital il adhère au programme crédit de  Soro Yiriwaso avec qui, il est à son premier prêt individuel. 
Il  compte acheter, des bœufs dans la Sous-préfecture de Fakola et environnants.  La vente se fait au comptant à Nièna et à  Bougouni.   
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75.000FCFA qui servira à payer les frais de santé, de nourriture et le reste sera investir dans l’entreprise.
Il ambitionne acheter un lot à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
Mr. Madou Sangaré is a 28-year-old married man, living in a monogamous household with his wife and two children in the N’gola borough of the Fakola Sous-Préfecture, in the third region (Sikasso) of the Republic of Mali. Mr. Maou Sandgaré has been raising cattle for the past eight years. He also butchers and sells the cattle. To increase his working capital he joined the Soro Yiriwaso credit loan programme, and is now requesting hs first loan. He intends to buy oxen in the Fakola Sous-Prefecture and the surrounding area. He conducts his sales against cash in Nièna and Bougouni. He hopes to attain monthly earnings of 75,000 FCFA which will be used to pay medical bills and food, and the remainder will be reinvested in the business. His ambition is to buy a plot of land to build a house.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cattle

loans.name: Mrs. Ken Chhoeng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ken C. works as a pig breeder at home. Her husband, Mr. Sang Sem, is a farmer who owns a 1 hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to support the family. With this activity, the couple supports three children: two of whom are enrolled in the local public school while the youngest one is 5 years old. Nowadays, they have some problems because it is time to plant, but they do not have enough rice seed and the field has infertile soil. So, to improve production, Mrs. Ken C. is requesting a loan to buy rice seed and fertilizer. 

Eighteen people make up this village bank loan and they are villagers in Rovieng village in Takeo province. Mrs. Ken C. is the village bank president, selected by the other members. They will each use a small piece of the loan for different purposes.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Maria Daysi

texts.es:
Doña Maria Daysi de 43 años de edad, labora como cajera desde hace 3 años, desempeñandose con gran responsabilidad en sus funciones, tiene  un hijo de 14 años de edad el que actualmente esta cursando su primer año de secundaria.  

Esta solicitando su 2do credito con el cual pretende construir una habitacion para asi tener mejor comodidad en el hogar, ya que en su casa solamente cuenta con una habitacion. 

Su sueño para el futuro es ir poco a poco mejorando su vivienda con los creditos y espera seguir siendo beneficiada por AFODENIC y que su hijo siga estudiando para que llegue a ser un profesional en el futuro.
texts.en:
Maria Daysi is 43 years old, and she has worked as a cashier for the past 3 years, performing her duties in a highly responsible manner. She has one son, age 14, who is currently in his first year of secondary school. She is requesting her second loan, with which she plans to construct a room to provide more comfort in her home, since her house currently only has one room. Her dream for the future is to continue improving her home little by little with the loans, and she hopes to continue benefiting from AFODENIC and to see her son continue studying so that he can become a professional someday.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Constructing a room

loans.name: Otilia

texts.es: Otilia, de 48 años es una mujer que se esmera por lograr sus objetivos, es soltera, tiene un hijo mayor de edad, que trabaja independientemente en Lima, mientras ella, vive sola en su casa propia, ubicado en la ciudad de “Santa Ana”. Ella es una persona muy sociable y reconocida por la zona donde vive, la ciudad de “Santa Ana”,  en la selva central peruana, esto le permite tener amigos quienes la quieren, respetan y colaboran mucho, pues antes de joven, Otilia, era conductora radial en una emisora local de este lugar, ahora siente que su vida transcurre de manera tranquila, por eso en su vivienda instaló un bar donde vende diversas clases de bebidas, además de gasificadas, caramelos, chicles y cigarrillos. Sus principales clientes son sus amigos, que la visitan u organizan alguna reunión familiar, esto es lo que más le gusta, ya que no se siente sola, además que los ingresos económicos le permite vivir cómodamente e incluso arreglar la construcción de su casa, porque con el transcurrir del tiempo, quiere instalar una bodega que este bien surtida. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y como presidenta de la junta directiva de su grupo, hace prevalecer todos los acuerdos que toma la mayoría, además asegura que su grupo comunal, laborará de manera activa en bien de cada uno de sus compañeros. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará bebidas, cigarrillos y diferentes dulces.
texts.en:
Otilia, 48 years of age, is a woman who has a great desire to meet her objectives. She is single, and has a grown son who is on his own and working in Lima. She, on the other hand, lives alone in her own home located in the city of “Santa Ana”. She is a very sociable and well-known person around the zone where she lives, Santa Ana, located in the Peruvian jungle. This allows her to have friends who like, respect, and work with her. When she was young, Otilia worked at a local radio station. Now she feels that life is calm, which is why she installed a beverage bar in her home where she sells a variety of beverages, as well as sodas, candy, gum and cigarettes. The majority of her customers are friends who visit her or organize family gatherings, which is what she enjoys most since she doesn’t feel alone. The income from the business allows her to live comfortably and, in fact, she hopes to make improvements to the house because she wants to have a well-stocked store over time. This is the first time she is obtaining a loan with MFP and, as president of her group’s board of directors, she makes sure that they comply with their commitments. In addition, she assures that her group will work actively for the good of all the associates. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy beverages, cigarettes, and a variety of candy.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beverages.

loans.name: Las Alfareras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario se llama Las Alfareras. Esta ubicado en la comunidad de Barrio Santiago, Acteopan, en el estado de Puebla, México. El grupo esta conformado por 5 integrantes que se conocen por ser vecinos. Este es su 1er. Préstamo con Fundación Realidad.
El representante del grupo es la señorita Pompilia T. A. tiene 37 años de edad, estudio hasta el 6º. Año de primaria obteniendo su certificado de primaria, Ella es soltera no tiene hijos y se dedica a la Alfarería y necesita el préstamo para comprar barro, leña, greta, celite, pintura para elaborar sus cazuelas, ollas y jarros en varios tamaños y modelos. Ella desde muy pequeña le gusto ayudarle a su papa con el trabajo y le fue enseñando como se trabaja el barro, tiene en el negocio 15 años y  participan en el la elaboración de sus productos, su papá, su mamá y su hermano unos cortan el barro, otros lo machucan y otro va poniendo las cintas, las asas y las orillas a las cazuelas, ollas y jarros. Ella considera importante su negocio porque de ahí tienen ingresos para los gastos de su casa, la alimentación  y para ir ahorrando para seguir comprando la  materia prima este negocio ya viene de familia, pues se a trabajado por generaciones en la alfarería, le proporciona gran satisfacción ver sus cazuelas, ollas y jarros ya terminados por que se ven muy bonitos, o cuando los clientes les dicen que están muy bonito. Ellos llevan sus productos a vender a la plaza de  Ozumba los martes. Y también a Tonatico, estado de México, se enfrenta mucha competencia pues éstos son lugares donde especialmente se vende alfarería, lo bueno es que la señorita Pompilia ya tiene clientes que solo le compran a ella por su calidad, buen precio y buen servicio, las ganancias que obtienen son para comprar mas barro, leña y va guardando para pagar los gastos de la casa. Barrio Santiago, Acteopan, Estado de Puebla es un pueblo bonito hay árboles, campo, siembran sorgo, milpa, cacahuate y utilizan para trabajar en el campo los burros, caballos, mulas utilizan las yuntas de bueyes para arar sus tierras, sus calles pavimentadas, algunas con adoquín o cemento, también hay una fiesta del barrio Santiago el 25 de Julio celebran misa, procesión, queman castillo, hay baile, chinelos y comida para todos los que van a la fiesta del barrio Santiago. Sus sueños y esperanzas son comprar una camioneta para transportar el barro, la leña y también su mercancía que van a vender a Tonatico Estado de México.
Las integrantes del grupo son Fidelia M. P. y va a comprar con su préstamo barro, greta, celite y pintura para elaborar sus ollas y cazuelas, la Señora Jaime T. Martínez va a comprar barro, Tierra blanca para elaborar sus macetas rusticas, La señora Gregoria M. H. va a comprar greta, leña, barro, etc. para elaborar sus cazuelas, la señorita Pompilia T. A. va a comprar barro, greta, leña, celite, pintura para elaborar sus cazuelas, ollas y jarros, la señora Virginia B. B. va a compra barro para elaborar sus cazuelas.
Las integrantes del grupo quieren decir a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “agradecerles que confían en nosotros y si vamos a cumplir con el pago, para que nos vuelvan a prestar.”
texts.en:
This solidarity group is called Las Alfareras ["The Potters"]. It is located in the community of Barrio Santiago, Acteopan, in the state of Puebla, Mexico. The group is made up of 5 members who know each other because they are neighbours. This is their first loan with Fundacion Realidad. The representative of the group is Miss Pompilia T. A., age 37, who studied until the 6th grade and obtained her primary certificate. She is single and has no children. She is a potter and needs a loan to purchase clay, firewood, lead, celite, and paint for decorating her pans, pots and jars of various sizes and models. From a very young age she has enjoyed helping her father with this work, and he taught her how to work with clay. She has been in this business for 15 years and her father, mother and brother are involved in the making of the products. Some will cut the clay, others will crush it and others put on the plaster, handles and edges of the pans, pots and jars. She considers her business to be important because it generates the income for her household costs, food and savings to continue purchasing materials. This is a family business; generations of her family have worked in pottery. She takes great satisfaction in seeing her completed pans, pots and jars because they are very beautiful; and she gets great satisfaction when her customers say that they are beautiful. They bring their products to sell in the Ozumba plaza on Tuesdays, and also in Tonatico, in the state of Mexico. They have much competition since these are locations where much pottery is offered for sale. The good thing is that Pompilia already has customers who only buy from her because of her quality, good price and good service. Her earnings are used to purchase more clay and firewood, and she saves to cover her household costs. Barrio Santiago, Acteopan, in the state of Puebla is a very beautiful village. There are trees and fields, and they sow sorghum, corn, and peanuts and use donkeys, horses and mules to work in the fields. They use yoked oxen to plough the land. There are paved roads, some with cobblestone and some cement. They have a festival in the neighbourhood of Santiago on July 25th where they celebrate mass, have a procession, and set off fireworks. There is dancing, the Chinelos [a traditional Mexican dance] and food for all who go to the Santiago neighbourhood party. Pompilia and her family dream and hope to purchase a truck to transport the clay, firewood and their merchandise for sale to Tonatico in the state of Mexico. The group members are: Fidelia M. P., who will use her loan to purchase clay, lead, celite and paint to make her pots and pans; Mrs Jaime T. M., who will purchase clay and ceramic to make her rustic flowerpots; Mrs Gregoria Montano H., who will purchase lead, firewood, clay etc for the making of her pans; Pompilia T. A., who will purchase clay, lead, firewood, celite and paint to make her pans, pots and jars; and Mrs Virginia B., who will purchase clay to make her pans. The group members want to tell Kiva and Fundacion Realidad "thank you for your confidence in us, and we will repay the loan so that you will lend to us again".

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of clay, firewood, lead, celite and paint for making pots, pans and jars

location.town: Barrio Santiago, Acteopan, estado de Puebla

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
This is Gertrudes T., 60, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Albino T., a carpenter, and is the mother of a young, well-rounded adult.

Gertrudes operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5-pesos-worth of cooking oil, or an egg.

Gertrudes earns by buying supplies at the wholesale price and selling them retail. Her store is located adjacent to her house and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns Php 200 in sales every day.

To help Gertrudes continue operation of her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. She will use to buy more products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.

Gertrudes has been a member of Center for Community Transformation for almost five years now and regularly attends fellowship meetings*. 
 
Gertrudes dreams of living a comfortable and well-off life.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Sospó Group

texts.es:
La señora Guillermina Juárez Gómez vive en tecpatan Estado de Chiapas México. Tiene 67 años de edad, se caso con el señor Valentín Guzmán Hernández y tuvo siete hijos tres hombre y cuatro mujeres que ya están casados y está muy orgullosa de cada uno de ellos.

   Ella se dedica a su hogar y a la elaboración de embutidos como son: chorizo y longaniza,  comenzó  con esta actividad desde hace nueve años, desde entonces ha  estado practicando este trabajo el cual le va muy bien, ya que hay muchas personas que le compran su producto para mandarle a sus familiares que radican en los estados unidos y la prefieren por que  los da a muy buen precio.

  Guillermina se inspiro en esta actividad por ser un trabajo donde se obtiene buenos ingresos y es un producto, de buena calidad que se vende rápido. Nos platica que gracias a Dios y a este trabajo ha podido ingresar al programa de fundación realidad y en otros programas con los que también ha trabajado y ha salido sin ningún problema.

  Con las  ganancias que obtiene de su venta  compra más ingredientes para elaborar su actividad, a si como también  a horrar para estar pagando los prestamos en fundación realidad  y para sostenerse hasta que dios le preste vida.

  Ella paso a formar parte de este programa por las promociones que se hizo en su barrio llamado costa de oro, se informo de cómo eran los préstamos  se intereso y hoy es parte del programa. El grupo se llama sospó la razón del nombre es porque en casa de una de las señoras hay unas flores bonitas llamadas con ese nombre.

Los integrantes que conforman el grupo son la siguiente:

 Marisela Guzmán Juárez: invierte el préstamo en compra de a lajas de oro, como son: aretes, anillos, cadenas entre otros, para venderlo en el mismo municipio.
 Guillermina Juárez Gómez: es la señora que se le tomo la entrevista utiliza el préstamo para la elaboración de  embutidos y esta de vestido rosado.
 Arely Hernández Hernández: invierte el préstamo en la compra de gallinas de rancho para venderlo en el mismo municipio.
 María de Lourdes G. Gómez: invierte el préstamo en la compra de ingrediente como son: huevo, harina, margarina, entre otro para la elaboración de pasteles y flanes.
 Minerva Hernández Jiménez: invierte  el préstamo en  la compra de ingrediente para elaborar dulces típicos de la región.
 María lidia Juárez Domínguez: utiliza el préstamo en compra de  productos naturales y para recargas telefónicas.
 Adela Nañez C.: invierte el préstamo en la compra de mercancía para surtir su tienda de ropas de niños, damas  y caballeros.
 Rosalinda Pérez Gómez: invierte el préstamo en la compra  y venta de zapatos por catálogos de la marca Andrea y mega shoes. 
 Alberto Hernández Jiménez: utiliza el préstamo para pagar el  personal  de la tortillería y refracciones de maquinas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Guillermina Juárez Gómez lives in Tecpatan, Chiapas, México. She is 67 years old. She married Mr. Valentín Guzmán Hernández and had seven children, three boys and four girls who are already married. She is very proud of each one of them. She is a housewife and also makes sausages like chorizo and longaniza. She started this activity 9 years ago. Since then she has been in this line of work and has done very well because many people buy her product to send to their relatives that live in the United States and they prefer her because she sells at a very good price. Guillermina was inspired to go into this particular work because it produces good income and it’s a high-quality product that sells quickly. She relates that, thanks to God and this work, she has been able to participate in Fundación Realidad’s program and other programs that she’s collaborated with and has finished problem-free. Profits obtained from her sales are used to buy more ingredients for her activity as well as for savings to repay loans with Fundación Realidad and to support herself for as long as God wills her life. She became part of the program thanks to promotional activities held in her neighborhood, called Costa de Oro. She learned about the loans and became interested and today is part of the program. The group is called “Sospó” because in the house of one of the members beautiful flowers so named grow. The members of the group are: Marisela Guzmán Juárez: to buy gold jewelry like: earrings, rings, chains, etc. to sell in town. Guillermina Juárez Gómez: she’s the woman who was interviewed and will use the loan to buy ingredients for sausage making. She’s wearing the pink dress. Arely Hernández Hernández: to buy ranch chickens to sell in town. María de Lourdes G. Gómez: to buy ingredients like, eggs, flour, margarine and others to make cakes and custards. Minerva Hernández Jiménez: to buy ingredients needed to make typical regional sweets. María lidia Juárez Domínguez: to buy natural products and telephone recharge cards. Adela Nañez C.: to buy stock ítems for her clothing store. Rosalinda Pérez Gómez: to buy Andrea and Mega brand catalogue shoes to sell. Alberto Hernández Jiménez: to pay tortilla shop employee salaries and for machinery repairs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to prepare sausage like: meat, ancho chili peppers, vinegar, onions, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more rolls of cotton fabric

loans.name: Basilio Antonio

texts.es:
Basilio Antonio López Velásquez
Basilio es de 58 años de edad, casada, es comerciante se dedica a la actividad de tejeduría, en la actividad tiene nueve años de experiencia, solicita su primer crédito para ampliación de capital de tejeduría. Sus referencias personales indican que es una persona responsable y trabajadora, por tal motivo no tendrá inconvenientes para pagar el préstamo.
texts.en:
Basilio Antonio López Velásquez
Basilio is 58 years old, married and is a merchant working in textile weaving.  He has nine years of experience in this activity.  He is requesting his first loan to increase his working capital.  His personal references indicate that he is a responsible and hard working person and therefore will not have any problems repaying the loan.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mashibei Kiparmet

texts.en:
Mashibei is married with four children whom she and her husband support.

Mashibei joined KADET through a credit officer. She is taking a first loan with KADET LTD and is not involved with other Micro-Finance. Mashibei has been in the livestock business for two years. With the loan she intends to increase the number of livestock she has. Mashibei's business is located near a busy market, giving her many customers.

With the extra profits, Mashibei hopes to send her children to university. In the future, she hopes to transport her livestock to Kenya Meat Commission for sale. Mashibei believes she is hardworking.

loans.use: The loan will be used to increase livestock.

loans.name: Catalina De Lourdes

texts.es:
Catalina de 58 años, es vendedora de artículos y bisutería en un puesto. Vive con su esposo y tres hijos en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada las orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas). 

Comenzó hace varios años con su negocio vendiendo bisutería hasta que pudo conseguir en el municipio de Guayaquil un puesto en la calle para vender sus artículos y bisutería. Trabaja desde las 08h30am hasta las 18h30pm todos los días vendiéndole a las personas que caminan por la calle donde esta ubicado su puesto. Vende revistas, bisutería, periódico, dulces, blusas etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar blusas para diversificar un poco la mercadería que vende. En el futuro quiere seguir trabajando para seguir ayudando a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Catalina is 58 years old.  She sells goods and costume jewelry from a stall.  She lives with her husband and three children in Orquídeas de Guayaquil (an urban area which is called 'Las Orquídeas' – 'Orchids' because when it was discovered there were many orchids there).

She started her business several years ago selling costume jewelry until she could manage to get a street stall in the town of Guayaquil to sell her goods and jewelry.  She works from 8.30am to 6.30pm every day selling to people who pass by her stall in the street.  She sells magazines, jewelry, newspapers, sweets, blouses, etc.

With her loan she would like to purchase blouses to diversify the goods which she sells a little.  In the future, she would like to continue working in order to continue helping her children.

loans.use: To purchase blouses

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Mensajeras” ubicado en el distrito de Juliaca, provincia de San Román, departamento de Puno, tiene 34 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y tiene 03 hijos. La señora estudio hasta primero de educación primaria.

Bertha viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 07 años,  nos cuenta que su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le sirvió para  incrementar el capital de su negocio de venta de estructuras metálicas.

La señora solicitará un nuevo de  S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra de materiales para su negocio de venta de estructuras metálicas, especialmente puertas y ventanas.
	
Su sueño es tener más capital para mejorar el negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  son las reuniones y las charlas.
texts.en:
Bertha is a member of “Las Mensajeras” (The Messengers) community bank which is located in Juliaca district, in San Román province, in the department of Puno.  She is 34 years old and lives with her partner.  They have 3 children.  She studied up to the first year of her primary education.

Bertha has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 7 years.  She tells us that her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles and she used it to increase the working capital of her business selling metal structures.

She is requesting a new loan for 800 nuevos soles and will invest it in the purchase of material for her business selling metal structures, especially doors and windows.

Her dream is to have more capital to improve her business.  What she most likes about her community bank are the meetings and the talks.

loans.use: To buy materials for making doors and windows

loans.name: Mujeres Luchando Por El Progreso Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Luchando por el Progreso nace hace un buen tiempo mediante el deseo de unas señoras de formar un grupo para trabajar en forma conjunta y de esa manera ayudadar a sus familia. 
Asi se formó el grupo y sigue trabajando hasta la actualidas atravesando todos los inconveniento que se presentan.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de bebidas como cerveza, vinos, sidras y otros, ya que ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas.
La venta lo realiza desde su casa y comenta que las mayores venta los tiene lo fines de semana.
Comenta que se siente muy realizada con el comité ya comparte muchas experiencias que muchas veces las ayuda en sus vidas, y desea continuar con el grupo.
texts.en: The "Women Fighting for Progress" Committee was born out of the desire of many women to form a group and work together while helping their families. So, the group was formed and continues working overcoming all the challenges that arise. One member is asking for a loan to buy drinks such as beer, wine, ciders and so on, to support her liquor store. The business is run out of her home, and the majority of her sales are during the weekends. She adds that she feels very fulfilled with the Committee, in sharing their many experiences they help her in her life, and she wants to continue with the group.

loans.use: To purchase drinks such as beer, sodas, wines, ciders and more.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly N. born in 1978; she is a married woman and blessed with two children. Both of them are students in the local public school. She typically makes around $1.25 in profit each day to share responsibility with her husband who works as a firewood seller in and around the province of Kompong Tom, and makes a profit of around $4 per day. 

Ly N. has built a pigpen behind her house where she raises many pigs to earn a living. Because selling animals is the core activity for making extra profit for her and her family, she wishes to buy two cows so that she can begin growing a small herd.

loans.use: To buy two cows  to begin growing a small herd

loans.name: Reynalda

texts.es: Reynalda, de 50 años, es una mujer luchadora. Ella se separó de su esposo hace 4 años, con él tuvo 3 años de edad, todos ellos independientes y mayores de edad. Ahora ella vive con su mamá de 83 años de edad, a la que cuida y protege en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Palca. Cosmetóloga de profesión y luchadora incansable, así se puede definir a Reynalda, quien a pesar de los contantes problemas que tiene, sigue trabajando duro para salir adelante. Los fines de semana, ella se dedica a cortar, maquillar, teñir cabellos y todo lo demás que se requiere a mejorar el aspecto de los pobladores de su localidad, según menciona tiene muchas ganancias, ya que es el único salón de belleza de Palca. Mientra que los demás días de la semana se dedica a la venta de miel y queso, los cuales lleva a la capital del país, donde viaja una vez a la semana, ya que según afirma tiene que cuidar a su anciana madre; por el bienestar de ella y su familia, desea más adelante mejorar su salón de belleza y hacerlo reconocido. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, y según menciona está orgullosa de pertenecer a una entidad que se preocupa en el surgimiento constante de su negocio. Por ello asegura seguirá apoyando a su banco comunal. De adquirir el crédito solicitado piensa invertir en el mejoramiento de su peluquería, y si el dinero le alcanza comprará mercadería para su negocio.
texts.en:
Reynalda, 50 years of age, is a fighter.  She separated from her husband 4 years ago, with whom she’d had 3 children who are now grown and living on their own.  She currently lives with her 83-year old mother, who she cares for and protects in her own home located in Palca.  

Cosmetician by profession and tireless fighter are how one can define Reynalda who, despite constant struggles, continues working hard to get ahead.  On weekends, she dedicates herself to cutting and dyeing hair, applying makeup, and everything else related to tending to the people of her community.  She mentions that her earnings are good, given that hers is the only beauty salon in Palca.

The rest of the days of the week, she sells honey and cheese, which she takes to the country’s capital city once per week because she has to take care of her elderly mother.  For her sake, and that of the rest of her family, she wants to make improvements to her beauty salon in the future and make it very well known.

This is her first loan with MFP and she says she’s proud to be part of an entity that cares about the constant growth of her business.  For this reason, she assures that she will continue to support her cooperative bank.  Upon receiving her loan, she plans to use it to make improvements to her beauty salon and, if she has enough money left over, to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.use: To improve the ambience in her beauty salon.

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es:
Eliana forma parte del banco comunal “Ríos de Valdivia”, perteneciente a la ciudad de Valdivia. Su negocio es la producción y venta de empanadas, tortas, galletas, kuchenes y sopaipillas, en una tienda de rotisería y amasandería,  ubicada en un amplio sector de Valdivia, desde hace varios años. Hace un tiempo cuenta con un ayudante panadero, quien está a su cargo. 
Con este préstamo comprará una máquina laminadora de cecinas.
 Su sueño es lograr trabajar solo supervisando el su local, ya que hasta ahora trabaja mucho en la mantención de su negocio. 
Gracias a Fondo Esperanza, Eliana ha obtenido varias máquinas necesarias para la elaboración de sus productos, entre ellos hornos, batidoras, etc.
Valdivia es una ciudad del sur de Chile, ubicada en la región de Los Ríos. Se destaca por tener uno de los pocos ríos navegables de Chile, el Calle Calle. Valdivia presenta, dentro de sus principales actividades económicas, la industria de la construcción naval, maderera, papelera, celulosa (Celco), cervecera y molinera. El turismo desempeña un papel importante, como también los servicios educacionales universitarios, encabezados por la Universidad Austral de Chile.
texts.en:
