Eliana is a member of the "Ríos de Valdivia" community bank, in the city of Valdivia.  Her business is making and selling empanadas, cakes, cookies and fried pastries in a delicatessen and bakery store located in a sector of Valdivia.   She has been in this business for several years.  She has employed an assistant baker for some time.

With this loan, Eliana will buy a machine for packaging cured meats.  Eliana's dream is to manage to supervise her premises alone since up to now she has worked a lot on maintaining her business.  Thanks to Fondo Esperanza, Eliana has obtained several machines that she needs to make her products such as ovens, mixers, etc.

Valdivia is a city in the south of Chile which is located in Los Ríos region.  It is noted for having one of the few navigable rivers in Chile, the Calle Calle.  Some of Valvidia's principal businesses are the shipbuilding industry, the lumber industry, the paper industry, the wood pulp industry (Celco), the beer industry and the milling industry.  Tourism plays an important role as does the university business, headed by the Universidad Austral de Chile.

loans.use: To buy a machine for packaging cured meats

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma G. is a farmer. She lives in the community of Banga, South Cotabato. She also raises pigs and chickens. She wants to improve her livelihood and have a bigger farm someday.

With 10 years experience, it is her hope to continue her business and earn a bigger income for her family. She needs this loan to be able to buy fertilizers and seeds. The profit from her business will help buy the basic needs for their family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is 32 years old, married and has six children who are in the range of one and twelve years old.  Currently, five of her children attend school. Joyce sells a variety of items in her store such as soap, salt, etc. She has been with this store for two years. Her husband helps her in the business. Joyce will use the loan to buy more soaps, salt, and rice to sell. Joyce's profits will be used to expanded her store. Joyce also plans to reinvest in her business and pay school fees for her children. In the future, she would like to become a wholesaler and hence make more profits.

loans.use: Buying soap, salt, and rice to sell.

loans.name: Bertha María

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal La Inmaculada, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.

En este lindo lugar encontramos a Bertha, ella es una  jovencita muy luchadora y trabajadora, tiene 25 años de edad, está soltera y vive en casa de los padres junto con otro hermano menor, ella está estudiando en cuarto año de colegio y sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y obtener un título universitario que le permita ganarse la vida.
 
Ella tiene un puesto en el mercado de Tosagua en el cual vende frutas y verduras, trabaja todos los días desde las  06h00 hasta las 19h00, ella se desplaza desde la madrugada hasta el mercado mayorista de Tosagua a comprar los mejores productos para poder ofrecerles el mejor producto a sus clientes, nos cuenta que lleva con su negocio ya por ocho años y que gracias a esto ha podido seguir con sus estudios ya que este trabajo a ella le permite estudiar y ganarse la vida honradamente.

Este crédito es para comprar más frutas y legumbres y así seguir para adelante. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 5 años y le gusta porque le han ayudado mucho.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua, every 15 days, La Inmaculada (the Immaculate) Community Bank meets. This place is known as being very dynamic, where the majority of its inhabitants are farmers or raise animals because this area has so much vegetation.

In this beautiful place we meet Bertha. She is a young woman who is a fighter and a hard worker. She is 25 years old, single, and she lives in her parents' house with her younger brother. She is in her fourth year of college and her dream is to finish her studies and get a degree that will allow her to make a living.

She has a booth in the Tosagua market where she sells fruits and vegetables. She works every day from 6 am to 7 pm. She gets up at dawn to go to the wholesale market in Tosagua to purchase the best products so she can offer the best to her customers. She tells us she has had this business for eight years and thanks to this has been able to continue with her studies since this work allows her to go to school and make a living honorably.

This loan is to purchase more fruits and vegetables and continue moving forward. She has been in the community bank for five years, and she likes it because they have helped her so much.

loans.use: Purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Bokk Jom Group

texts.fr:
le groupe de solidarité BOKK JOM est créé le 16 février 2000. Il est composé de 16 femmes du même département administrative mais pas du même quartier. Elles se réunissent tous les mois pour des activités d'épargne et de prêt et de parler également des perspectives de leur Banc Villageois. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de Keur Khaly

Madame Fatoumata D. (debout tout à fait à droite sur la photo, emmitouflée avec une écharpe blanche et portant des lunettes) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 47 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants. Elle a aussi la responsabilité de deux autres enfants de son mari. 

Elle fait du petit commerce d'huile de palme, de poissons séchés et de pâte d'arachide. Elle fait aussi de la broderie à la main. Elle a une expérience de plus de 6 ans dans le domaine du petit commerce.

Son financement augmentera sa capacité d'autofinancement afin de d'accroitre son activité

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de leur progéniture tout en renforçant son niveau d'épargne dans le Banc Villageois
texts.en:
The solidarity group BOKK JOM was established on February 16, 2000. It is composed of 16 women from the same administrative department, but not from the same neighborhood. They get together every month for savings and loaning activities, as well as to discuss perspectives for their Banc Villageois. The group belongs to the Keur Khaly Banc Villageois.

Mrs. Fatoumata D. (standing on the far right in the photograph, wearing a white scarf and glasses) is the group leader. She's 47 years old, married, and the mother of seven children. She also has to support two other children of her husband.

She retails palm oil, dried fish, and peanut paste. She also does embroidery. She has an experience of more than 6 years in commerce.

This loan will bolster her self-financing capacity in order to expand her business. Her goal is to support her husband in providing for their children, while at the same time boosting her savings.

loans.use: to buy 40 liters of palm oil, 2 baskets of fried fish, and peanuts to transform

loans.name: Kentui

texts.en:
Kentui O. N. is 33 years old, married, and a father to two wonderful children. He has been a farmer for the past three years with a monthly income of Kshs 7,500. 

Kentui has now applied for his second loan from KADET LTD after he repaid his first loan as promised. He plans to use these loan funds to buy farm inputs like seeds, fertilizers, tools and other items for the next planting season. With the profits generated, he plans to pay school fees for his children.

He dreams of becoming a prominent farmer in his local area. He is a diligent man who works with effort to attain more despite the limited resources.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Lallan's Group

texts.en:
Lallan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her livestock business. She will use the loan money to buy goats and sheep to sell for profit to butchers. Her business grows busier during the Muslim festival of Eid-ul-Azha because people purchase animals to slaughter. 

She is married to K. B. who is involved in different kinds of work to financially support the family. He is a rickshaw driver as well as a farmer. He provides transport services to his passengers. He also works in the field growing different seasonal crops.  

Lallan has given birth to a son and 2 daughters. Her children are very young and are not of school age yet. Lallan is fully aware of the importance of education. She wasn't educated due to the poor financial conditions of her parents, but she wants to provide a good quality education to her children. 

She has been doing this business for the past 10 years and hopes that the loan investment will be profitable for her. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. She is a responsible client and paid her responsibilities efficiently.

loans.use: to buy goats and sheep for selling

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman, with one child who is still too young for school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and transport costs.

For the past two years, she has operated an open-air market business, selling at the market to her neighbours and market dwellers. Her major challenge in the business is the high cost of transportation. She dreams of establishing a big restaurant in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, cooking oil and vegetables. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, cooking oil and vegetables.

loans.name: Cornilla

texts.en:
Cornilla V. is from the village of Militar. She is 43 years old. Cornilla is married and has three school-aged children. 

To make a living, Cornilla owns and operates a general store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Cornilla has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Cornilla joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Cornilla is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase dried fish, bagoong (fish paste) and soft drinks for resale. This will be the first loan taken out by Cornilla from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish, bagoong and soft drinks for resale

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge, de 28 años, es un hombre muy amable y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Carmen de 23 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo que realiza Jorge le da los ingresos necesario para ayudar a su familia con los gastos del hogar, él es conductor de su propia movilidad urbana, la cual recorre la ruta desde Ancon hasta Villa El Salvador. Tiene mucho tiempo trabajando en esta ruta, por lo cual conoce muy bien a las personas que vive cerca. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene, ya que puede conducir tranquilamente su movilidad por las calles en busca de clientes. Lleva 8 años realizando en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es arreglar el carro cuando sufre algún desperfecto. Para el futuro, anhela tener un negocio más rentable en su casa. Es el primer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo, puesto que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, en donde es uno de los pocos varones y siente que tiene el compromiso de ser muy responsable. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará material de escritorio, ya que desea poner una librería, puesto que no hay ninguna en su barrio.
texts.en:
Jorge is 28 years old.  He is a kind and cheerful man who lives in his own home together with his wife, 23 year-old Carmen, and their three beloved children who he would like to provide with a better quality of life.

Jorge's work makes him the income he needs to help his family with their household expenses.  He drives a vehicle which he owns on a route between Ancon and Villa El Salvador.  He has been working this route for a long time and so he knows the people who live nearby very well.

What Jorge most enjoys about his work is the freedom that he has since he can drive his vehicle peacefully through the streets in search of customers.  He has been in this business for eight years and he considers the most difficult part of his work to be fixing his car when it has a problem.  In the future, he would like to own a more profitable business in his home.

This is Jorge's first loan from MFP.  He knows that he must repay it on time if he doesn't want to cause problems for the other members of his community bank where he is one of the few men in the group.  He feels that must be very responsible.  He will use the 1,000 Peruvian soles that he has requested to buy stationery products since he would like to set up a stationery store as there isn't one in his neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy stationery and school supplies to stock his stationery store

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea, 33, is a local farmer in the Prey Chor district. She always plants rice on her existing farmland following the rainy season and the dry season. Besides this, Chea is good at making bamboo baskets for the market. Her husband works in the construction filed as a casual construction worker. In the past, Chea used to hire the neighbor’s cow to plow the farmland. Right now, she hopes to buy her own cow and that is why she is applying for a loan from Kiva. Chea has three-age-school children.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Glen

texts.en: Glen, a 26-year-old married mother of two children, lives in Plaridel where she has a business making living room and dining furniture. She earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month.  A member of PMPC for two years, Glen is requesting a loan to purchase raw materials needed to make her products.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make new products.

loans.name: Sainbayar

texts.en:
Sainbayar is 36 years old and lives with his wife and three daughters in a "ger", a Mongolian yurt, in Uvs province of Mongolia. His older daughter is a pupil while the younger two are in kindergarten. He manages a grocery trading business in his town. He is responsible for purchasing and transporting products and his wife is responsible for selling them to their customers. 

In addition Sainbayar conducts a taxi service business in order to supplement his earnings. They collect and put aside 5000 MNT daily, so they can have  savings for future use. Sainbayar is a polite man who says, "I am doing my best to better my living conditions." He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more grocery items for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is 38 years old and married. She has two children aged 12 and 10. Geraldine’s husband works as a farmer and driver.

Geraldine has had a sari-sari (variety) store business for 15 years. She sells items like noodles and canned goods to the people in her community. She sometimes helps her husband grow rice crops at their farm. They also grow cassava plants on a part of their land.

Geraldine requested this loan to buy farm inputs like fertilizers and seeds. She also plans to buy more items to sell such as sugar, shampoo and soap. Geraldine hopes to have a stable income that will sustain her family and her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers and items to sell such as sugar, shampoo and soap

loans.name: Miyelsis  Patricia

texts.es:
Miyelsi de 27 años de edad vive con su cónyuge y su hijo de 3 años de edad en Simón Bolívar, un barrio muy tradicional, que combina alegría, dinamismo, educación y escenarios culturales, como cuando  su reconocido  boulevard se prepara anualmente,  para dar paso a los tradicionales desfiles del carnaval de Barranquilla.  En este ambiente de gente trabajadora y educada  tiene su negocio de vender mercancía a crédito Miyelsi desde hace dos años , sus clientes son los vecinos de  Simón Bolívar y sus barrios aledaños entre los que se encuentra , costa hermosa, las palmeras, amigos, familiares, y referidos;  los productos que vende son, ropa en general y telas por metros.  
En la actualidad está aplicando a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará mercancía como jeans, suéteres, tela de dril, tela de lino, sandalias y camisas, con el fin de seguir expandiendo su negocio. Sus estados financieros  están acordes con la actividad de su negocio, las ventas cubren sus gastos familiares y le generan una utilidad con las que fácilmente cubre su obligación. Su negocio es producto de su experiencia en el trabajo, pues hace 11 años fue vendedora en almacenes ubicados en el centro de Barranquilla y ganó mucho conocimiento, el cual se convirtió en su gran fortaleza para el desempeño actual de su microempresa. Con su negocio apoya a su cónyuge en los gastos del hogar, pues ambos están muy de acuerdo en que cada día trabajarán persistentemente, para aumentar su bienestar familiar, En la actualidad sus esfuerzos han logrado generar en su negocio una rentabilidad del 38,74%, mientras sus  cuentas por cobrar rotan cada 26 días, su nivel de autonomía es de un  100% y la  rotación de inventarios es de cada 10 días. Su meta más adelante es terminar de adecuar su vivienda y tener un local comercial bien posicionado y prosperó que ayude a sacar adelante a su hijo,  especialmente en los estudios profesionales.
texts.en:
Miyelsis is 27 years old and lives with her partner and her 3-year-old child in Simón Bolívar. The neighborhood is very traditional combining joy, dynamism, education and cultural scenes. Every year the neighborhood’s well-known boulevard is set up for the traditional Carnival parades of Barranquilla. It is in this ambience of hard working and educated people that Miyelsi has had her business of selling merchandise on credit for two years. Her customers are her neighbors from Simón Bolivar and bordering neighborhoods such as Costa Hermosa and Las Palmeras, and among them are friends, relatives and referrals. The products she sells include general clothing and fabric by the meter.  

She is currently applying for her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the loan to buy merchandise like jeans, sweaters, drill and linen fabrics, sandals and shirts in order to continue expanding her business. Her financial situation is in tune with the business’ activity. Her sales cover her family expenses and generate enough profit to easily cover her loan obligation. Her business is the product of her work experience. Eleven years ago she was a salesperson in wholesalers located in the center of Barranquilla. There she gained a lot of experience which she transferred into a great strength in running her microbusiness. 

She helps her partner with the household expenses through her business. Both of them are in agreement that each day they will work persistently to improve the wellbeing of their family. Her current efforts have produced a profitability of 38.74% in the business while her accounts payable turnover is every 26 days. She has 100% autonomy and she has a 10 day inventory turnover. Her goal is to finish fixing up her house and acquire a commercial space that is well positioned and prosperous so that she can help her child get ahead especially in professional studies.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise like jeans, sweaters, drill and linen fabric, sandals and shirts in order to  continue expanding her business.

loans.name: Bolorkhorloo

texts.en:
Bolorkhorloo is a young hard-working woman who lives with her husband and children in the outer 'ger' (Mongolian yurt) district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Both of her children, aged 3 and 5, attend local kindergarten while her husband works as a tractor-trailer driver at a local company. 

After working as a saleswoman for five years, she decided to start her own business in an indoor market called Tumen Plaza. She mostly sells women’s clothing imported from Beijing, China. As the market is located in a very busy shopping area, her business makes outstanding revenue. 

Bolorkhorloo is requesting a 1,300,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to import more clothes for the upcoming season since the new school year is starting which is a high shopping season. She is a responsible client of our institute who repaid her previous loans successfully and on time. Bolor is working hard to improve her family’s living standards so her children can enjoy a safe and good quality of life as they grow.

loans.use: to import more clothes for the upcoming season.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is 33 years old and married to Keziah. They are not blessed with children yet. He has been running a boda boda (motorcycle transport) business for the last two and a half years, making a monthly profit of KES 30,000. He has been loaned KES 50,000, which he plans to use to buy another motorbike.

With the anticipated profit made, he plans to buy a taxi. In the near future, he hopes to own a Mini-bus (a transport vehicle).

loans.use: to buy another motorbike

loans.name: Rosenith

texts.en: Rosenith is married with one child. She is 33 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. To earn a living, Rosenith has a store in the market selling vegetables, spices and eggs. She has had this business for 7 years. Each month, she earns approximately 20000 PHP. She has requested the amount of 25,000 PHP to purchase more stock of vegetables and spices for her store. Rosenith has been a member of PMPC for more than a year. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of vegetables and spices for her retail store

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 11 years.  She is 51 years old, married to Sospeter, and they have two school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her second loan.  She repaid her previous loan of Kshs 15,000 well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy a dairy cow.

In future, Hannah hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann is a hardworking business woman, age 31. She is single and blessed with one child. For the last two years, she has been managing a tailoring business to bring up her family. She also practices dairy farming to boost her income. Ann has retained her business because of her good reputation with her customers. In the next 5 years, she wants to become successful in her business. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy fabric for making clothes. She expresses gratitude to Faulu Kenya for enabling her to access business loans easily.

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 40 years of age, married and has four children. Her family lives within the village of Nagbukel San Isidro. All four of her children go to school, so her expenses have increased. Teresa would like her children to finish college so that they could have a better future someday. 

Teresa runs a direct selling business. She has had this business for five years and she's glad because her husband is supportive in improving the business they have. The couple works hard to make their dreams come true. In addition, Teresa is asking for financial assistance in the amount of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to purchase dried fish, red eggs, beans and some cosmetic products needed in her retailing business. She hopes that through her requested loan, she will be able to improve the economic conditions of her family and support her children in their studies.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish, red eggs, beans and some cosmetic products needed in her retailing business.

loans.name: Maria Veronica

texts.es: María Veronica, tiene 39 años de edad, casada, tiene un hijo de 19 años de edad, ella es comerciante, tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación. Inicio este negocio a los 29 años de edad, inicio con tan solo una mesa y pocos productos para ofrecer pero con el pasar del tiempo ha venido progresando su pulpería, ha logrado preparar a su hijo, mantener los gastos del hogar y lograr tener sus propios ingresos. Pero siente que necesita poder vender y surtir mas su tienda, es por ello que solicita el préstamo para comprar granos básicos, aceite, enlatados, jugos, productos de limpieza, carnes, huevo, pan, leche. Productos que se mueven rápido y de los cuales necesitan mantener surtida su pulpería para vender mas y mejorar sus ingresos, pues en lo futuro le gustaría tener su distribuidora de productos varios.
texts.en: María Veronica is 39 years old, married, and has a 19-year-old son.  She is a shop keeper and has a grocery store in her home.  She started this business when she was 29 years old with just a table and a few products to sell.  However, over the years she has gradually made progress with her store, managed to educate her son, covered her household expenses and managed to make her own income.  She feels that she needs to further stock her store and sell more.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy basic grains, oil, canned food, juice, cleaning products, meat, eggs, bread and milk.  These are products that sell quickly and with which she needs to keep her store stocked so that she can sell more and improve her income.  In the future, she would like to have a wholesale store and sell a variety of products.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, oil, canned goods, juice, cleaning products, meat, eggs, bread and milk

loans.name: Venancia

texts.en:
Venancia is married with two adult children. She is 57 years of age and resides at Balintawak, Aurora Zamboanga del Sur.

Venancia is in the agricultural business, planting & harvesting flowers for sale to earn a living. This is the primary business of Ms. Venancia. She has been in this business for two years. Venancia is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase fertilizers.

Venancia became a member of GDMPC in October 2011. Her future plan is to acquire another flower farm, because for now she has only three slots.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Perina

texts.en:
Perina is a 38-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has eight children between the ages of 25 and 10.  Six of them go to school. 

Perina runs a food store business and she has been in the business for six years. She has no employees. Perina heard about Finance Sudan through the marketing done in the market. She is taking a loan of 800 SDG to purchase more food items like sorghum, maize and cassava. Besides this business, Perina has no other source of income. 

In five years time, Perina would like to hope for an increase in the business size.

Her major challenges include high competition and home expenses.   

Perina says that she is happy for Finance Sudan’s support in South Sudan.

loans.use: to purchase more food items like sorghum, maize and cassava

loans.name: Seferina

texts.es:
La señora Seferina es socia del Banco Comunal “Candelaria” del distrito y provincia D. Yunguyo, departamento D. Puno, tiene 65 años D. edad, es viuda y tiene 09  hijos. Ella no cuenta con estudios.

Seferina nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar el capital D. su negocio D. compra y venta D. ganados como ovinos, vacunos y porcinos.  Nos cuenta que también la señora se dedica a la chacra.

Ella solicitará un nuevo crédito  D. S/. 600.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá incrementar a su capital y comprará una vaca para engordarlo por tres meses.

Su sueño para el futuro es seguir trabajando en el negocio y mejorar sus ganancias.

Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Seferina is a member of the "Candelaria" communal bank in the district and province of Yunguyo, in Puno department. She is 65, a widow and has nine children. She never went to school. 

Seferina buys and sells livestock, such as sheep, cattle, and pigs. She also works on her small farm. Seferina tells us that with her first loan from Movimiento Manuela Ramos, she was able to increase the working capital of her business.

She will apply for a new loan of 600 nuevos soles, with which she will be able to increase her working capital, and buy a cow, in order to fatten it for three months.  

Her dream for the the future is to continue working in her business, and to improve her earnings. What she likes best about the communal bank are the easy loan terms.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.es:
La señorita Adelina es una joven muy trabajadora y emprendedora que le gusta mucho el trabajo que tiene, cuenta con la edad de 23 años y es soltera, es la menor de 4 hermanos y quien cuida a su mamá, tiene una taquería con la cual lleva apenas 1 año.
Ella dice que empezó con esta actividad, porque quiere mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia también, para tener una buena solvencia económica, y así empezar a ahorrar y asegurar el futuro de su madre ya que es de edad avanzada, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de insumos como: chiles, tomates, cilantro, cebollas, rábanos, tortillas, gas, carne, aceite y sal, para continuar con la elaboración de sus ricos tacos. 
Una de las metas que tiene ade (así es como le dicen en su casa), es la de hacer crecer muchísimo su negocio, puesto que quiere construir un local, mucho más grande, comprar más sillas y mesas, para poder mejorar e incrementar sus ventas junto con sus ingresos.
Esta muy agradecida con FRAC y los donadores de kiva, por este gran apoyo que les están ofreciendo, ya que gracias a esa ayuda su negocio y vida de su familia han cambiado bastante.
texts.en:
Adelina is a very hard-working and enterprising young woman.  She really likes the work that she has.  She is 23 years old and single.  She is the youngest of four siblings, and she takes care of her mother.  She has had a taco stand for barely a year.

She says that she started this business activity because she wants to improve her quality of life and that of her family as well.  She wants to be financially solvent and start to save in order to secure her elderly mother’s future.

She will use the loan that she received to buy supplies like chilies, tomatoes, cilantro, onions, radishes, tortillas, gas, meat, oil, and salt in order to continue making her delicious tacos.

One of the goals that Ade (as she is called at home) has is to make her business grow a lot.  She wants to build a much bigger place.  She will buy more chairs and tables in order to be able to increase her sales along with her income.

She is very grateful to FRAC and the Kiva lenders for this great support they are offering her.  Thanks to this help her business and her family life have  changed quite a bit.

loans.use: to buy supplies like chilies, tomatoes, cilantro, onions, radishes, tortillas, gas, meat, oil, and salt.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a farmer and the father of 3 children, aged 8 to 10 years. He has 7 years of experience in farming and currently supplies the local market with milk and eggs.

Patrick has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says the additional income will enable him to meet the family's basic needs by providing milk and extra income for repaying the loan and meeting other needs. He hopes to grow the business and join the ranks of the major milk suppliers in the area.

Patrick mentions animal diseases as his major challenge.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma nació en la ciudad de Huayllabamba y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. (El distrito peruano de Huayllabamba es uno de los siete distritos de la Provincia de Urubamba, ubicada en el Departamento del Cusco, perteneciente a la Región Cusco, Perú). 

Irma tiene 25 años edad, es soltera y aun no tiene hijos, ella tiene varias actividades económicas principales que realiza durante el año y estos son: Durante los meses de abril hasta octubre se dedica a trabajar de forma dependiente osea ya se ha en un hotel, en un restaurante o en la municipalidad de Yucay. Durante los meses de Octubre a Marzo se dedica al negocio de venta de choclo y lleva sus productos a la ciudades de Juliaca, Puno, Cusco y los distribuye en diferentes mercados de esas ciudades. En esta oportunidad Irma requiere el préstamo para comprar más choclo. Su sueño de Irma es abrir una cabina de internet o abrir una empresa especializa en realizar software. Irma ha estudiado la carrera técnica de computación e informática en uno de los institutos de la ciudad del Cusco.      

Irma es integrante del banco comunal “Virgen Natividad” y el grupo está conformado con 15 socios que viven unos en el ciudad de Huayllabamba y otros en el ciudad de Yucay. El distrito peruano de Yucay es uno de los siete distritos de la Provincia de Urubamba.
texts.en:
Irrna was born in the city of Huayllabamba, and lives in the same city where she was born. The Peruvian district of Huayllabamba is one of the seven districts in Urubamba province, located in Cusco department, which is part of the Cusco region of Peru. 

Irma is 25, single, and has no children yet.  She has various main economic activities that she does during the year. During the months of April to October she works as an employee, whether it be in a hotel, restaurant or for the Yucay municipality. During the months from October to March, she sells corn, and takes her products to the cities of Juliaca, Puno, and Cusco, and distributes them in various markets in those cities. 

On this occasion, Irma needs the loan to buy more corn. Irma's dream is to open an Internet booth, or a company specializing in developing software. Irma has studied for a technical career in computing and informatics, in one of the institutes in the city of Cusco. 

Irma is a member of the "Virgen Natividad" communal bank, and the group is made up of 15 members, some of whom live in the city of Huayllabamba, and others in the city of Yucay. The Peruvian district of Yucay is one of the seven districts in Urubamba province.

loans.use: To buy more corn.

loans.name: Josefa Petrona

texts.es: Josefa Petrona tiene 40años de edad, su actividad económica es la venta de repuestos de bicicleta, el negocio lo tiene establecido en su casa de habitación donde ya tiene sus clientes fijos y eventuales que llegan para que le brinde el servicio. Este negocio que ahora esta cargo Josefa anteriormente lo tenía sus esposos pero el encontró trabajo en una empresa y ella se hizo cargo del negocio y junto a sus hijos lo han sacado adelante. Josefa esta solicitando crédito para comprar repuestos de bicicleta entre otros productos y aumentar su inventario.
texts.en: Josefa Petrona is 40 years old and works selling spare bicycle parts.  She has her business set up in her house and she already has both regular and occasional customers whom she serves.  Josefa’s husband used to run this business but he got a job at a company and she took over.  Together with her children, she has gotten the business ahead.  Josefa is requesting this loan to buy spare bicycle parts and other items in order to increase her inventory.

loans.use: to buy spare bicycle parts.

loans.name: Mwanthi

texts.en: Mwanthi is 35 years old, married, and has two children, ages 3 and 6. He does maize farming to earn a living. He has worked in farming for five years and has employed one person. Mwanthi earns extra income from his saloon.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy fertilizer and maize seeds.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and maize seeds.

loans.name: David's Group

texts.en:
David is 22 years old, has 2 children, and lives in Ugu village in Ndhiwa sub County, Kenya. Ugu village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from ka-David well. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, meaning that David and his family may fall sick and become unable to work or attend school.

David works as a subsistence farmer, but has also volunteered his time to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser program that enables his community to drink safe water and stay healthy. David and three other promoters in his community, including Noah, Kenedy and Joseph, need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. David will encourage the community to treat their water with the dispenser and refill the dispenser with chlorine as needed. David wants to be a promoter because he believes that the chlorine will kill germs in water making it safe for use.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that David’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To install and maintain chlorine dispensers to provide access to safe drinking water for the community

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 33 years old, married and has two children. Her family depends on a small piece of land where she grows vegetables and beans. Joan has benefited from the group and WEEC by accessing small loans and this has increased her capacity to look after her family without relying on her husband. She is a dedicated agri-business woman; she applies the business skills she has attained over the years from group trainings to make money from what she produces. The following gives her income: sale of milk, tealeaves and vegetables from her small farm. For some time, she has been selling Napier grass from a rented small piece of land. From her farming, she is able to earn about USD150 monthly but this is not enough to sustain her family. 
Right now she plans to rent a bigger plot of land to plant more Napier grass vegetables for sale. As the business grows, she wants to buy another dairy cow to increase milk production. Joan is optimistic that she will get a break through and live a happy life.

loans.use: Joan would like to rent a plot of land to grow vegetables and Napier grass for sale

loans.name: Nadir

texts.en: Nadir is a low-income person from Agsu. He is 32, has 2 kids. He started his service business in January 2006. He borrowed $250 he used for improving his business condition. Now he applies for $550 to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy equipment

loans.name: Orepa

texts.en: Orepa is a married, thirty-four year old mother of four sons who is a good baker and who runs a muffin business. Orepa learned baking skills at school and although she never thought of baking as her talent, she baked muffins for her son’s school. There, Orepa heard the kids talking about her muffins and asking her son to make her bake some more for them. Orepa then joined SPBD for financial support to start her business.  She now bakes muffins not only forhe son's school but also for village people. With her requested loan, Orepa will build another extra oven to increase her daily production.

loans.use: Buy ingredients for her muffins and cement for making a new oven.

loans.name: Olga Lidia

texts.es:
Olga is married with two children, ages 7 and 14. Her husband is a taxi driver who does not receive a set salary. Because of that, it is sometimes very difficult for them to cover all of the expenses of their home. Olga began selling perfume five years ago to help out her husband and to have some extra income. Olga’s strong sales skills have helped her grow her business.

In order to fill the orders made by her clients, Olga is asking for a $200 loan, which she will repay in 3 months. With this loan, she will be able to offer better service and to gain more clients. You can be an important part in the growth of this business and in the life of Olga and her family. They send their thanks for your support.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

Olga es casada y tiene dos hijos, de 7 y 14 años de edad. Su esposo es taxista y no recibe un salario fijo, por lo que en ocasiones es muy difícil cubrir todos los gastos de su hogar, para ayudar a su esposo y tener un ingreso extra, Olga inició con la venta de perfumes desde hace cinco años. La facilidad de palabra que tiene y su gusto por las ventas han ayudado a Olga a hacer crecer su negocio.

Para surtir los pedidos que tiene de sus clientes Olga solicita un préstamo de $ 200 dólares, que se compromete a devolver en 3 meses, con esto podrá mejorar la calidad del servicio que ofrece e incrementar sus clientes. Se parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio y en la vida de Olga y su familia, ellos agradecen mucho tu apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Edmundo

texts.es:
Business Description

Edmundo and his wife run a shoemaking business. Currently they manufacture only sandals. They have had this business for two years, and they have dedicated a part of their home to the business.

Purpose of the Loan

He would use the loan to buy raw materials so as to increase the amount of goods he can merchandise. He would use part of the loan to fix up the workshop, which needs repairs.

About the Applicant

Edmundo is 41. He has two children who attend school. His house is of mixed construction styles, and his family life is stable. His goal is to advance his business to ensure that his children get a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio and Sarah Padial, Kiva Volunteers

Descripción del Negocio

Don Edmundo y su esposa tienen un taller de calzado en la actualidad solo hacen sandalias, este negocio lo tienen hace dos años, y en su domicilio pues han adecuado un local para ubicar el taller

Uso del Préstamo

El necesita el credito para comprar mas materia prima y asi tener mas producto para comercializar. Otra parte del credito louasara para acondicionar su taller pues necesita una remodelacion

Información Personal

El tiene 41 años y dos hijos que estudian su casa es de construcción mixta y tiene estabilidad familiar. Su principal meta es de poder progresar en su negocio para asegurar la educación de sus hijos

loans.use: To buy raw materials for his shoemaking business

loans.name: Ni Kadek Mandasari

texts.id:
Mandasari has been very involved in running her food mart since she married I Putu Arnawa five years ago. With an initial working capital of 1,000,000 IDR (1USD ~9,000 IDR) and a very humble food mart shack, Kadek Mandasari began her business by selling vegetables, ice and other kitchen needs. Her food mart business was growing everyday. Her patience and hard working in serving customers wins her more customers. Unfortunately with her limited capital she could not meet all of her customers demand. Mandasari opens her shop from 7AM to 8PM and earns 35,000 IDR of profit per day Mandasari wants to improve her service's quality by adding more merchandising items. With the loan from Dinari, Mandasari purchases many type of new merchandising items such as instant noodle, soap, detergent and other snacks. With the increase in the merchandising items Mandasari could double her daily profits to 70,000 IDR. The profit will help her family's prosperity since her husband only works as a traditional farmer.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Menambah modal usaha untuk membeli aneka makanan dan minuman ringan,mie instan, sabun cuci dan keperluan dapur

loans.name: Ven

texts.en: Mrs. Ven N., age 27, works with her husband in the paddy fields growing crops, earning together about $3.20 each day. They have no children, but one of her sisters lives with them and works in a garment factory. She would like to request a loan of $500 in order to purchase a water pump machine and dig a well for her water supply.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump machine and dig a well for her water supply.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.pt:
Rolando N., resident of the Bagamoyo neighborhood, is married and the father of four children. He joined the program on March 15th, 2006, borrowing the amount of 3000 meticais. He is now in his fourth loan cycle. He will borrow 3000 meticais, and with this amount, he plans to buy a television.

Translated from Portuguese by Ilse Ackerman, Kiva volunteer.

Rolando N., residente no bairro de Bagamoyo, vive maritalmente Portador do BI nº110074764F, pai de 4 filhos entrou no programa a 15/03/06, tomando o valor de 3000 mt esta no 4º ciclo vai tomar o mesmo valor de 3000 mt com o valor do emprestimo pretende comprar um televisor.

loans.use: purchase of goods

loans.name: Davlatbek

texts.ru:
Davlatbek K. is 50 years old, has finished high school, is married and has 8 children. Mr. K. is a private rancher. He has been raising and selling cattle for the last 10 years. He is planning to use the loan to purchase a few calves for fattening and sale. Every 40-45 days he is planning to sell the fattened bulls and purchase new calves. He will use the money earned from sales to buy additional animals and feed for them as well as use the surplus money to support his own family. Mr. K. is planning to pay back his loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Киёмов Давлатбек, возраст – 50 лет, образование среднее, женат, имеет 8-х детей. Давлатбек частный фермер. Он занимается разведением и продажей крупного рогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 10 лет. На полученный кредит он планирует приобрести несколько молодых бычков для покупки и продажи. Через каждые 40-45 дней он будет продавать бычков и покупать новых. Вырученные деньги он будет использовать на приобретение молодых бычков и корма для них, а полученную прибыль будет направлять на содержание своей семьи. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: purchase of cattle

loans.name: Sinfuriana Eumelia

texts.es:
Señora Sinfuriana is a member of the communal bank Corazón de Jesús ("Heart of Jesus"), located at Av. Universitaria Mz G Lt 22 in the district of Calleria in the province of Ucayali. She is 52 years, has seven children, and her husband is a locksmith. With the first loan of 300 Soles that she received from Manuela Ramos, she invested in raising chickens.

Presently Sinfuriana owns a shed in which she raises diverse types of birds so that later she may sell them in the market and to different restaurants. Sinfuriana works with the support of her kids in order to grow the business so that each day it prospers more than the previous day.

With the loan of 1700 Soles, which she will pay back in four months, she will invest in fixing up the shed, buying a balanced diet for her birds, and purchasing a great quantity of little chicks.

For Sinfuriana working with Manuela Ramos is a great help, especially for all the support and motivation that is offered to her.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

La señora Sinfuriana pertenece al banco comunal Corazón de Jesús, ubicado en la Av. Universitaria Mz G Lt 22, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 52 años, 7 hijos y su esposo es cerrajero. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300 decide invertir en la crianza de pollos.

En la actualidad tiene un galpón en la cual cría diversos tipos de aves, para luego venderlos en el mercado y en los diferentes restaurantes. Sinfuriana cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos para llevar adelante el negocio que prospera cada día más.

Con el préstamo de S/.1,700, el cual pagará en 4 meses, invertirá en el arreglo del galpón, en la compra de comida balanceada para sus aves y en la compra de mayor cantidad de pollitos.

Para Sinfuriana trabajar con Manuela Ramos es un apoyo y una gran ayuda, mas que todo por las charlas que le brindan, le ayudan y le motivan para seguir adelante.

loans.use: The loan will be invested in improving the shed and buying food for her birds.

loans.name: Dina Lisette

texts.es:
In the city of Leon, in the county of Achuapa, Dina Lisette Narvaez is a farmer, and helps her husband by working near their home and in many other places too. She has 2 daughters who are both school age, and who are both excellent students.

In order to solve the problem of living in a home with no electricity, Dina Narvaez has fitted a solar panal in order to get light. Now she would like to cancel the debt that she has because of this panal, and this is why she would like a loan from Ceprodel. She will use it to pay off the debt as the solar panal is just what they need in their home.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

En la ciudad de León en el municipio de Achuapa la señora Dina Lisette N. se dedica al negocio de agricultura en apoyo a su esposo trabajando en las cercanías a su hogar de habitación y a la vez en lugres muy distantes a su hogar. Ella es madre de dos hijas ambas en edades escolares que se han destacado por ser muy excelentes estudiantes.

Para solucionar la problemática que viven en su hogar como es la ausencia de energía eléctrica, la señora Dina N. ha implementado un panel solar para aprovechamiento de la energía eléctrica y al haber obtenido dicho panel está en la obligación de cancelar esta deuda y para ello ha acudido a CEPRODEL para ser beneficiada con crédito que le permita saldar la deuda y de esta manera darle uso al panel solar que tanto necesita en su hogar de habitación.

loans.use: To pay for a home solar panal/Pago de panel solar para vivienda

loans.name: Merling Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Merling is 38-years-old and lives in the Francisco Salazar neighborhood. She is single with two sons, who are 18 and 17. They help her with the family's expenses by working in construction. She has had a grocery store for 3 years, which she started with the help of her parents. With this loan, she want to invest in the purchase of basic grains, which are what her customers buy the most. She wants to satisfy them and improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Doña merlyng tiene 38 años de edad habita en el barrio Francisco Salazar, soltera con dos hijos de 18 y 17 años de edad que la ayudan con los gastos ellos trabajan en construcción su negocio es una pulpería con 3 años de tenerla que la comenzó con ayuda de sus padres, con el préstamo quiere invertir mas en granos básicos que son los que se adquieren mas y sastifacer a sus clientes, y mejorar su nivel de vida.

loans.use: To invest in her grocery store

loans.name: London 2014-4 Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Busena K.. She is 28 years old and is married to a husband who is an accountant. Busena has 2 children, ages 1 and 5. Busena currently sells rice and beans at a hotel and each week makes approximately 35 Sudanese pounds ($US 17) in profits. With the additional profits from her loan, she hopes to construct a hotel.

Busena is joined in her small group by Kejia K., Mary K., Glady Y., and Erico I.. Kejia K. sells bread and will use her part of the loan to buy clothes for sale. Mary K. currently sells beer and wants a loan to open up a bar. Glady Y. brews local beer and wants to buy motor bike. Erico I. sells charcoal and will use the loan to increase her inventory.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: For the construction of a hotel

loans.name: Jose Patricio

texts.es:
José Patricio is a long-time client. He has three school-age children. He does not own his own home. His wife sells CDs. Both work 12-13 hours a day to be able to cover household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

El Sr.José Patricio es cliente antiguo de la institución, tiene tres hijos en edad escolar, no cuenta con vivienda propia, su esposa se dedica a la venta de Cds, ambos trabajan de 12 a 13 Hrs. al dia para poder sustentar los gastos de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of computer accessories and DVDs for sale

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is a married woman. Every day, she works from 8am to 18pm at her business. She can earn a monthly profit of about $250.

In the past, Angela has taken out two successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Angela now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is a married woman with 4 children between 8 and 25 years old. Her husband is a self-employed ceramic engineer. When he works, he can earn about 1200 KM, but in the period when he doesn't work, they spend their savings. Fatima will use this loan in the amount of 1000 KM to buy chicken for fattening. Fatima had done this work before, and she wants to keep doing it during the winter. Fatima will use part of the loan to build a brick hen house because she has one made of wood. She wants to ensure good conditions for chicken breeding.

loans.use: To buy chicken.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Legión.

Julia es casada, tiene 60 años y 7 hijos D. los cuales 4 viven con ella, Julia vive en la ciudad D. Lima donD. tiene un Kiosco ubicado cerca D. un grifo en donD. venD. quesos, panes, molidos D. cereales, que adquiere en la ciudad D. Ayacucho, Julia viaja constantemente a la ciudad D. Ayacucho en donD. venD. ropa a pedido a amigos, conocidos en los diferentes distritos D. la región, sus ventas son al crédito y regresa cada fin D. mes a realizar sus cobranzas.

Julia necesita un préstamo D. 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. panes variados, carne y queso. Los sueños D. Julia son que su hija ingrese a la universidad, ampliar su negocio y tener capital propio.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Communal Bank "Legión".

Julia is married; she is 60 years old and has 7 children of which 4 live with her. She lives in the city of Lima where she has a kiosk located near a gas station where she sells cheese, bread, and cereals that she acquires at the city of Ayacucho. Julia travels constantly to the city of Ayacucho where she sells clothing by order to friends and acquaintances in the different districts of the region. She takes credit with her sales so she returns every weekend to collect money owed to her.

Julia needs a loan of $725 USD which will be used to purchase various breads, meat and cheese. Julia hopes that her daughter enrolls in a university; she also hopes her business will grow, and would like to have her own money.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various breads, meat and cheese

loans.name: Keti

texts.es: Keti a sus 40 años de edad es madre de 4 hijos que están estudiando, a los cuales tiene que apoyar hasta que sean profesionales. Mujer decidida y trabajadora, es dueña de un motocarro, el mismo que lo maneja su esposo Segundo, quien se dedica al transporte de pasajeros por los diferentes lugares de su  zona. Aparte de administrar las ganancias del motocarro, vende ropa por los distintos lugares de su localidad, estas actividades las realiza con el fin de que junto a su esposo, sostengan la economía familiar.  Es por eso que quiere comprar repuestos para mandar a reparar su motocarro, para realizar su deseo necesita de un capital lo más pronto posible. Ayuda a esta madre que muestra su interés por salir adelante.
texts.en:
Keti, 40, is the mother of 4 children of school age, who she wants to support so they can become professionals. A decisive and hard-working woman, she is the owner of a three-wheeler operated by her husband Segundo, who transports passengers around the different areas within his zone. Apart from managing the income from the three-wheeler, she sells clothing in various locations in her neighborhood. She carries out these activities so that she and her husband can support the family. This is why she wants to buy spare parts to repair her three-wheeler, for which she needs capital as soon as possible. Help this mother who is demonstrating her desire to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to repair her three-wheeler

loans.name: Mrs. Srey Vong Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Srey V. is the president of a village bank [solidarity borrowing group] of thirteen people who all live in Kandal Leu Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Srey V. is a farmer who owns 3 hectares to cultivate rice for a living. On this plantation she now faces a small problem because her field is infertile, which has a bad effect on her crop. To deal with this problem, Mrs. Srey V. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to enable the field to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Chhoem Chantha, is a policeman who can make a small salary to support his family. Mrs. Srey V. is 44 years old and the mother of four children, three of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is only three years old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to enable the field to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Waldermar

texts.es: Waldemar tiene 26 años de edad, es soltero, vive junto a sus padres que lo apoyan mucho. Levantarse muy temprano a lavar motos y motocarros es la labor diaria de este joven, brindando servicios de lavado desde hace tres años en un pequeño lavadero implementado en las afueras de su casa. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es conocer a muchas  personas, además le es muy rentable porque los conductores con sus vehículos concurren diario a su lavadero. Esto le da muchos ánimos de continuar creciendo en su negocio. Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP, y ha demostrado ser responsable con sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mangueras para su lavadero, además quiere mandar a reparar algunas imperfecciones de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Waldemar is 26 years old, single and lives with his parents, who give him a lot of support. He gets up very early in the morning to wash vehicles, a job this young man has been doing for the past three years in a small car wash he set up outside of his home. What he enjoys about his work is meeting a lot of people, and the business is very profitable because drivers bring their vehicles everyday to his car wash. This gives him a lot of encouragement to keep growing his business. This is his third loan request, and he has shown himself to be responsible with his payments. With the money he is requesting, Waldemar plans to purchase hoses for his car wash, as well as make some repairs to his home.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase hoses for his car wash and make repairs to his home

loans.name: Favour

texts.en: Favour is 31 years old and married with a child. She sells drinks, frozen foods and foodstuffs. Favour needs the loan amount of 140,000 to purchase more frozen foods and drinks to sell. She is a LAPO client. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks and frozen food to sell

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Mr. Keo H. was born in 1962 and lives in Angk Prasat village in Takeo province. He is a rice middleman who buys rice to keep in stock to re-sell later at a better price. He is a widower with three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too small to work or study. Mr. Keo H. is requesting a loan to invest in more rice stock so he can improve his income and his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To puchase more rice and expand rice business

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is 24 years old and already married to Noel, a furniture maker.  They have a six year old son named Jericho and he is now in grade one studying in the public school located in their Barangay at San Lorenzo Ilagan, Isabela.
 
Her husband is managing and operating a furniture business in their house.  The business is not that big and progressive, they only have few customers since their business is not popular to other villages.  With this, Adela thought of seeking for financial assistance to support their furniture making and to make more designs and market their products.  She is now requesting at least PHP4,000 for expansion and she is also planning to start another business to help her husband earn additional income.
  	
Adela also shared that serving her family brings her happiness in her heart. In simple ways she shows her support and perseverance to be of help to her husband and child.

loans.use: Business Expansion

loans.name: Lay

texts.en: Lay V. is forty-one years old and sells silk cloth in the Bati, Takeo province. She usually purchases silk cloth from the Bati district and resells in the market at Phnom Penh. On average, she makes $3 per day. Her husband stays at home and weaves silk scarves. He typically makes $2 a day. This couple has two children, one who is a student and one who is a weaver. Lay V. would like to take out a loan to purchase silk cloth to resell at Phnom Penh.

loans.use: To purchase silk cloth

loans.name: Tilomai

texts.en: Tilomai T., 42, is married with two children.  She has three years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the general public 5 days per week. She has successfully repaid a previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 145 Tala.  SPBD loans are Tilomai’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase  a water gallon for water storage, weed eater, plant sprayer, pesticides and gromozones.

loans.name: Salwa

texts.en:
Salwa S. is a 38-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of six children. She decided to open a small grocery store in her home in order to support her husband with their outgoings and household costs.

Now Salwa needs a loan with which she will increase her merchandise and provide her customers with a diversity of products. She is ready to work even harder and to make sacrifices in order to help add to her family income.

Note: The photo featured in this business profile is of Salwa’s husband. In Palestine, it is culturally unacceptable to some people to post a picture of a woman on the Internet. However, the loan is to Salwa.

loans.use: To increase her merchandise to provide her customers with a diversity of products

loans.name: Adja Coumba

texts.fr: ADJA COUMBA M. EST UNE JEUNE FEMME NEE EN 1980 A THIES .ELLE EST MARIEE ET MERE D'UNE FILLE.ELLE A COMMENCE A FAIRE DU COMMERCE TRES JEUNE AVEC SA MERE. ACTUELLEMELLEMENT ELLE TRAVAILLE SEULE.ELLE SE REND A KAYAR POUR ACHETER DES LEGUMES POUR LES REVENDRE AU MARCHE MOUSSANTE DE THIES.AVEC CE PRET, ELLE VEUT AUGMENTER SON CHIFFRE D'AFFAIRE ET SES BENEFICES.
texts.en:
Adja Coumba M. is a young woman who was born in 1980 in Thies. She is married and the mother of one daughter. At a young age, she began to work at petty trading, together with her mother. Presently she works independently. She goes to Kayar to buy vegetables which she sells at Moussante market in Thies. With this loan, she wants to expand her turnover and her profit.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of vegetables

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sabougnouma est constitué de six femmes mariées toutes monogames ayant en moyenne 38 ans et  4 enfants. Elles habitent à Bougoula hameau, une des communes rurales  de  Sikasso  (3ème région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente  des céréales,  des tissus, des pagnes  wax, et  des condiments alimentaires. 
Elles sont à leur  quatrième   collaboration avec le programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de  satisfaire le besoin de leurs  clientèles et augmenter leurs revenus. Les prêts précédents ont été tous correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter  40 sacs de 50 kg de  céréales et  50 colis de condiments. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso et dans les villages environnants. Les marchandises sont vendues en détail, au comptant et souvent à crédit, dans les différents marchés de la ville de Sikasso, à domicile et de façon ambulante. La clientèle  est composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 23 000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour aider les maris  à construire et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités et le remboursement du prêt.
texts.en:
The group Sabougnouma is composed of six married women, all monogamous, who average 38 years of age and 4 children each. The women live in the hamlet of Bougoula, a rural community of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They operate diverse businesses, including the sale of grains, fabrics, Wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth), and condiments. They are on their fourth collaboration with the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy customer demand and to increase their revenues. The preceding loans have all been correctly repaid. With this new loan, the group members intend to buy forty 50-kg sacks of grain and fifty packages of condiments. Supplies are gotten at the grand marketplace of Sikasso City and in surrounding villages. The merchandise is sold retail, in cash transactions and often on credit, at the different markets of Sikasso City, out of the house, and door-to-door. The customers are composed of women and men. The group members each envision realizing an average monthly profit of 23,000 francs. A portion will be used to help the husbands with construction, and the other portion will be invested in business and used for making loan payments.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grain and condiments

loans.name: Celedonio

texts.en: Mr. Celedonio V. lives in the city of Fernando de la Mora and is married to Mrs. Gregoria Genez, with whom he has several children who all live outside of the home.  Celedonio works as a carpenter and makes furniture.  He sells his furniture in the capital as well as in the interior of the country.  He started working as a carpenter around 1991, and began saving a little bit of capital.  As time went on and he got better at his work, Celedonio had to invest more and more in his business.  Due to this need for support, he introduced himself to the Fundación Paraguaya and applied for credit.  The credit he has now is for the purchase of merchandise and raw materials.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Ivona

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 36 year old Ivona P. from Mwanza. She is widowed with four children between the ages of 3 and 20 years old. Ivona has been running a clothes business since 1999. Her business is to make clothes and bed sheets and sell them to clients.

She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Ivona currently earns about 165 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase cloth and a sewing machine. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Ivona thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase cloth and sewing machine.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean A. is from the village of San Roque, Bukidnon. She is 27 years old. Jean is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Jean owns & operates a specialized retail business peddling food products, including snacks and viands, in the local community. Jean has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jean joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jean is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jean from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
This is the Ekirirwa Eira group in Jinja. Rose M. is the leader of this borrower group.

Rose has a retail shop that she has managed for eight years now. She has received a previous loan and is happy about her success in repaying it promptly. Thanks to that loan, Rosei was able to increase stock in her shop. The resulting profits and savings were a particular blessing because she has had to pay school fees and medical bills, as well as dealing with family emergencies. She was also able to increase revenue by offering refrigerated items such beer and other cold drinks. Her evening customer base has increased dramatically as a result, with the demand especially high for beer.

Rose is the mother of five children and she pays their school fees with the help of her husband, who helps her with the shop.

She needs a loan to help stock more products, particulalrly since it is now holiday time and more homesteads buy supplies in bulk.

loans.use: To re-stock her retail shop with more goods for sale

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
Jinky is a direct seller of Board Walk and NATASHA products. She is already 45 years old and is married to Arnolfo who works abroad for already three years now. They were gifted with 3 children, the eldest is Cherilyn Kate - 12 years old and the youngest is Argie - 10 years old both were in the grade school. The family lives in the simple community of Rio Del Grande in Enrile, Cagayan. 

Aside from direct selling, Jinky is also a vendor of meat .  She sells meat twice a week for her to have quality days spend to her family while at the same time doing a business. She wanted to borrow loan amounting to PHP5, 000 as additional business capital for she believes that the business is good enough to maintain their daily living and for the education of her children if it will be develop further. Having the amount will enable her increase her capital to revolve in the business and will somehow generate higher income.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
When Maria’s daughter was two years old and ready to start daycare, Maria decided to start her own day care center in order to provide a high-quality learning environment for her daughter, as well as other children in her community.  She started “Kids Place 2 Explore and Learn” two years ago and since then has transformed her home into a learning facility for six children from two to five years old.

When she started her daycare, Maria had trouble getting a small business loan from a bank. “They didn’t see my home daycare as a business, and I needed a very small amount of money,” she says.  She is grateful for a loan from Opportunity Fund and Kiva, which will allow her to purchase what she needs for her facility without the stress of high interest rate credit cards, the only other source of financing available to her. 

Maria needs a loan to purchase cubbies and bookshelves, portable cribs, educational toys and books, and new flooring. These supplies are essential to Maria’s business to keep her enrollment up, since parents look for the quality of materials, furniture, and toys when selecting a daycare.  

Maria is proud of the success of her business and that her enrollment is at capacity for the space she has. She is happy when the children, at first reluctant to leave their parents, begin to see her home as an enjoyable place to spend the day. In the future, Maria would like to move her daycare from her home to an off-site location where she would have the capacity to grow. Currently she employs one part-time and one full-time assistant, and would like to hire more people and enroll more children.

Learn more at http://kidsplace2exploreandlearn.com/ABOUT_ME.php.

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur Maria from  United States

loans.use: To buy cubbies and bookshelves, portable cribs, educational toys and books, and new flooring for a daycare center

loans.name: Benita

texts.en: Benita is 57 years old and married with 3 children. She has been in this fire wood business for the past 3 years. She hopes for the loan amount of N 80, 000 to purchase more fire wood to sell. Benita says thanks to all kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more fire wood to sell

loans.name: Hanan Jawed Group

texts.en:
Hanan is the group leader of Hanan Jawed group. There are three members in this group.  

All of them would like to receive money for his own business, as they want to expand said businesses. 
 
Hanan and B. Z. want to take a loan for their business of building services in order to improve it. Also, M. Jawad wants to take a loan for his general store, in order to attract more customers. They thank all lenders, Kiva, and AFSG in Afghanistan.

loans.use: buying materials necessary for their businesses

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita S. is from the city of Oroquieta. She is 51 years old. Anita is widowed and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Anita owns & operates a "sari-sari" store business. Her main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Anita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2007, Anita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anita has successfully repaid previous loans from PMPC. Anita is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Anita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:  Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her "sari-sari" variety store

loans.name: Lucila Petronila

texts.es:
La señora  LUCILA PETRONILA G. P. D. D. tiene 49 años, vive en el distrito D. MOCHE, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SAN BORJA. Ella presenta estudios hasta 3ero. D. secundaria, refiere que no continuó estudios superiores porque se casó muy joven. Tiene 5 hijos D. los cuales solo 2 dependen económicamente D. ella porque se encuentran estudiando. La socia se dedica a la crianza D. ganado vacuno, chanchos, huachos, etc.
Con su primer crédito D. 300 nuevos soles compró chanchos y huachos (ovejas) para criarlos y posteriormente venderlos.
Con este crédito D. 2,300.00 nuevos soles, también lo utilizará para comprar cerdos, reces y huachos (ovejas).
Lucila sueña con aumentar la crianza D. su ganado para así aumentar sus ganancias y continuar apoyando a sus hijos y terminen sus estudios en la universidad.
texts.en:
Señora LUCILA PETRONILA G. P. D. D. is 49 years old, and lives in the Moche district of Trujillo province, in the La Libertad region of Peru. She is a member of the communal bank San Borja. She completed studies up through the 3rd year of secondary education; she did not finish because she married very young. She has 5 children, 2 of whom are economically dependent upon her because they are in school. She raises livestock, including cows, pigs, and sheep. With her first loan of 300 nuevos soles, she bought pigs and sheep to raise and then later sell. With this loan of 2300 nuevos soles, she will also buy pigs, cows and sheep. Lucila dreams of increasing her livestock business so that she can have increased earnings and can continue to support her children so that they can finish their studies at the university.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy pigs, cows and sheep

loans.name: Taualofa

texts.en:
Taualofa F. is a 59-year-old woman living in the town of Fagasa. She is married and has 13 adult children. To make a living, Taualofa owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting taro for sale. Taualofa has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 280 WST a month from these activities.
