In 2008, Taualofa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Taualofa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Taualofa is now requesting a new loan of 1500 WST which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Taualofa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Omjime

texts.en:
Omjime B. is currently in the business of selling charcoal at home and is requesting a loan to stock more charcoal to sell.  Omjime is 35 years old and is married to a businessman. She has two children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a permanent house for her children's settlement.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Lhagvasuren

texts.en:
Lhagvasuren L. is 38 years old and lives with his wife and 18-year-old daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His only daughter is a student at the State Arts School of Ulaanbaatar. Lhagvasuren's family moved to the capital city from the countryside in 2000. In the beginning, he did not know what to do, but he eventually rented someone's car and drove it as a taxi in the city. Later, he bought a car for himself with the profits he earned and drives his own car as a taxi now. Since he is good at repairing old cars, he usually purchases broken cars and fixes them up to sell them at a higher price. It gives him a chance to earn extra income besides his main taxi business. In the future, he dreams of having his own car repair shop where he would be able to do what he is best at and fix many types of small cars.

Right now he is requesting a loan to fix his own car and buy necessary accessories for his taxi car.

loans.use: To fix his own car and buy necessary accessories for his taxi business

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr:
Monsieur Abdoulaye Dembélé est un homme marié de 33 ans et père de 3 enfants. Il vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans le  quartier Hérémakono Nord de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquenté le système scolaire, très vite il commença les activités économiques notamment la vente d’une boutique d’articles divers qu’il appris auprès de son oncle.  Avec une expérience de 4 ans, il maîtrise bien son activité et est très sollicité.
 Pour le renforcement de ses activités, il décida de collaborer avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son deuxième prêt. Le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé. 
Avec ce deuxième prêt il compte acheter, une grande quantité d’articles divers pour sa boutique.
 Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) auprès des grossistes et effectue sa vente à une clientèlle composée de la toute la population locale.
Avec ce prêt, il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 62 500 FCFA.
Avec ce bénéfice il envisage acheter une maison.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdoulaye Dembélé is 33 years old, married and father of three children. He lives with his wife and children in the North Hérémakono area of the town of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Without formal education, he quickly began commercial activities, in particular selling various products in a shop, trade learned from his uncle. After four years of experience, he masters rather well this activity and is in high demand. To reinforce his business, he decided to cooperate with the Soro Yiriwaso MFI, where is is now requesting a second loan. The first loan was correctly reimbursed. With this second loan he intends to buy a large quantity of various products for his shop. He gets his supplies from wholesalers in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali), and sells to the local population customer base. With this loan, he expects his monthly earnings to reach 62,500 FCFA, and with the benefits, he is considering buying a house.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various products for the shop

loans.name: Rufina Miriam

texts.es: Rufina Miriam tiene 53 años de edad, su actividad económica es ofrece el servicio de costura. Por lo que a pesar de su edad es una persona muy alegre y eficaz por lo que poco a poco y con el paso del tiempo y ha logrado crecer con su humilde negocio, ya que cuando era muy joven siempre le gustaba ser una persona muy independiente por lo que con este negocio tiene 38 años, que han sido muy constructivos por que le ha dado lo necesario para seguir adelante. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de telas, hilos, tijeras, zipper entre otros productos, por lo que se acerca la temporada de entrada a clases y ella quiere aprovechar este momento por los encargos que le hacen. El sueño de Rufina es proporcionarle mejoras su vivienda.
texts.en:
53-year old Rufina Miriam is a seamstress. In spite of her age she is a very lively and efficient person as over the years she has gradually built a small business. Ever since she was very young, she always enjoyed being independent and has had this business for 38 years. They have been profitable years as they provided her with enough to make progress in life. Rufina is asking for a loan to buy material, thread, scissors, zippers and other items. The back-to-school season is fast approaching, and she wants to take advantage of any orders that her customers give her. Rufina’s dream is to make her home more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa L. is from the village of Balbagon, Mambajao Camiguin Province. She is 40 years old. Marissa is married and has 7 school-aged children. Marissa owns & operates a specialized retail business where she sells seafood products such as fish and shrimp. She helps her husband, who is a fisherman, to earn a living. Marissa has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Marissa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Marissa is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Marissa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kotognontala Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Kotognontala, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 37 ans,  6 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à N’Tjifina sous préfecture de Fana,  Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce  de céréales, des condiments, de l’arachide et de poissons.
Les femmes du groupe Kotognontala sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, des condiments, des céréales, des poissons et de l’arachide.
Elles s’approvisionnent en condiments tantôt à Bamako tantôt à Fana et sur place pour les autres produits. Elles effectuent leurs ventes sur place et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 25.000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women from the Kotognontala group are all married. On average they are 37 years of age, have 6 children and all live in traditional extended families in N’Tjifina in the Fana Sub-Prefecture of the Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They were acquainted through family connections and are in the business of retailing grain cereals, food condiments, peanuts and fish. This is the first group loan request for the Kotognontala group, which will be used to buy condiments, grain cereals, fish and peanuts. They get the condiments from Bamako or Fana, and the other products locally. They sell locally and in area market fairs, retail, cash or credit, to both men and women customers. They hope to reach average monthly earnings of 25,000 FCFA each, which will be used to cover healthcare needs, nourishment, school expenses, the remainder being reinvested in the business.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy grain cereals, food condiments, fish and peanuts

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 60 years old and married with six children. Her husband is a commercial driver and he also supports his home. She lives in Benin City, Edo state. She sells firewood at retail prices to her customers. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. 

Julie hopes to expand her business by purchasing more firewood to sell and she is requesting a loan of 70,000 Nigerian naira to be able to do this. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more firewood to sell

loans.name: Mary Ann's Group

texts.en:
Mary Ann T. is from the village of Bitag Grande, Baggao, Cagayan. She is 36 years old. Mary Ann is the leader of a 5-member loan group sponsored by ASKI. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Mary Ann is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Ann grows fruit trees, and then harvests and sells the fruit. Mary Ann has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month from these activities.

Mary Ann joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Ann is requesting a loan of 7000 PHP to expand her business. This will be Mary Ann's first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Doña Eva Group

texts.es:
El grupo doña Eva lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es la señora Lesbia Antonia Gutiérrez D. quien 1990 comenzó vendiendo platanitos, elotes, yoitamal y nacatamales. En sus inicios según comento comercializaba poco pero conforme fue aumentando el negocio este mejoro.

Ella es madre de doce hijos siete niñas y cinco niños entre 21 años y un año de edad,  por los cuales trabaja arduamente para que tengan un mejor futuro. Ella con el préstamo lo invertirán en los diferentes productos que comercializa.

Sus compañeras de grupo son Juana Francisca Gónzales quien desde hace quince años vende frijoles, cigarros y tortillas, Fany J. P. comercializa cosméticos de la zermat y Julia Patricia L.  vende frutas en el mercadito.
texts.en:
The Doña Eva group is made up of four, hard-working women. One of them is Lesbia Antonia Gutiérrez D. who started selling bananas, corn on the cob and tamales in 1990. At the beginning, her sales were poor but gradually business improved. She is the mother of 12 children, 7 girls and 5 boys ranging from 21 to 1 year of age, for whom she works hard every day so that they can have a better future. She will use the funds to buy several of the items she sells. Her fellow group members are: Juana Francisca Gónzales who has sold beans, cigarettes and tortillas for the last 15 years and Fany J. P. who sells Zermat cosmetics and Julia Patricia L. who sells fruit in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, corn on the cob, cheese, sugar, rice, etc.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella Q. sells bread and groundnut products at market.  She is requesting a loan to stock cooking oil to sell.  Stella is 19 years old and is single.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services.  These are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is a 24-year-old single man. He prepares and sells popcorn, eggs and sausages to earn a living. He has been in this business for two years and employs one person.

Isaac has been saving his money on a weekly basis with a group in Faulu Kenya. He joined this group so as to access finances easily. This is because the group members guarantee each other’s loans.

Isaac has requested a loan of Kes 15,000 to expand his business premises. He hopes to expand his business so as to improve his living standard.

loans.use: To expand his business premises

loans.name: Nann

texts.en:
Mr. Nann N. is 32 years old and resides with other family members in a wooden house located in a rural area of Siem Reap Province. He got married maN. years ago to Naun, age 37, who is a professional teacher in the local public school. The couple is blessed with seven children. 

Mr. Nann N. is a domestic ox-trader. He buys oxen to fatten at his house for a while and he then sells them to other people to raise income. Mr. Nann N. will be using his first loan to purchase a lot of oxen to resell and gain income.

loans.use: To purchase a lot of oxen to resell and gain income

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es: Adriana tiene 55 años, es una madre D. familia muy trabajadora, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Hace mas D. 30 años, Adriana se dedica en la confección D. prendas D. vestir. Es especialista en la elaboración D. buzos hechas en tela polar, material grueso que es muy utilizado para abrigar. En entonces que la elaboración D. estas prendas lo hace D. acuerdo al modelo o diseño que piD. el cliente, D. esa manera asegura la venta sin tener el riesgo D. quedarse con alguna mercadería. Sus compradores asiduos son los vendedores ambulantes que trabajan en los diversos mercados aledaños D. su distrito; puesto que les deja a un precio muy módico. Adriana trabaja  sola es por ello que no se da abasto para continuar, faltándole materiales para continuar y eso hace que pierda varios contratos. Su mayor anhelo es ampliar su mercado y renovar su maquinas por otra multifuncional. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y se compromete a pagar  todas sus cuotas como hasta hoy, ya que sabe que este aporte le será muy favorable para aumentar su capital D. trabajo. Con este crédito que solicita, piensa comprar telas polares, ya que por la estación D. invierno aumentó sus pedidos y D. ese modo continuará produciendo.
texts.en:
Adriana is 55 years old. She is a hardworking mother who lives with her husband and her three children in their own home. More than 30 years ago, Adriana started manufacturing garments. She specializes in sweaters maD. of fleece, thick material that is widely used for shelter. She customizes these garments according to the style or design that is requested by the customer, thereby ensuring the sale without risk of excess inventory. Her frequent customers are nearby vendors who work in various markets surrounding her district. This is because she offers them a very affordable price. Adriana works alone because she does not have the supplies to continue, lacking materials and losing various contracts for this reason. Her greatest desire is to expand her market and renovate her machines to be multifunctional. This is her second loan with MFP, and she agrees to pay all of her dues as of today, because she knows that this contribution will be favorable to increase her working capital. With this loan request, she plans to purchase fleece material, because she increased her orders for the winter season and will continue to produce them.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fleece material

loans.name: Celso Gregorio

texts.es:
Celso es un padre de familia de 46 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, colindante con la ciudad de Chiclayo, este distrito es conocido como el mas poblado de la región y también es conocido como el más pobre, la mayor parte de sus habitantes vive en zonas urbano – marginales.

Se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir para caballero en un puesto de venta ubicado en los exteriores del Mercado Modelo de la ciudad de Chiclayo (El segundo mercado mas grande de la región). El adquiere su mercadería en la ciudad de Lima y las ofrece en venta con un trato amable y buena atención, esto ha hecho que cuente actualmente con un grupo de clientes fieles que siempre recurren a su puesto para adquirir los productos que ofrece.

Celso desea adquirir prendas de vestir de estación para que sus clientes puedan encontrar una oferta de acuerdo al invierno, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Celso es una persona amable y tranquila, sus compañeros de trabajo y vecinos le conocen por ser una persona honrada y que siempre está dispuesto a ayudar a los que le necesitan.
texts.en:
Celso is 46 years old. He lives with his wife and their two children in the José Leonardo Ortiz district, which is adjacent to the city of Chiclayo. It is known as the most populated district in the region. It is also know as the poorest. Most of the inhabitants live in marginally urban areas. He sells articles of clothing for men in a stand, which is located outside of the Modelo Market in the city of Chiclayo (the second largest market in the area). He gets his merchandise in the city of Lima. He treats his customers pleasantly and gives them good service. Therefore, he now has a group of loyal customers. They always come to his stand to get the products that he sells. Celso wants to get seasonal clothing so that his customers can find winter clothes. That is why he has requested, for the first time, a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2,000 soles. That will help him achieve his objective. Celso is a pleasant and level headed person. His work colleagues and neighbors know him to be an honorable person who is always ready to help those that need it.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy winter clothes to expand his sales stand at the market

loans.name: Aura Luz

texts.es: Aura Luz tiene 50 años. Su actividad económica es el destace de cerdo y elaboración de nacatamales.  Poco a poco con esfuerzo a podido generar más ingresos para su hogar con la ayuda de este negocio. Trabaja desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche todos los días de semana que son los más solicitados por sus clientes, ya que también conocen la ubicación de su negocio que es su humilde vivienda. Actualmente solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de cerdos, ingredientes para la elaboración de sus nacatamales, hojas, masa y bolsas plásticas.
texts.en:
Aura Luz is 50 years old. She butchers pigs and prepares Nicaraguan tamales to earn a living. With some effort, she was gradually able to generate more income through her business to maintain her household. Aura Luz works from 5am to 8pm every day of the week since her customers are placing more orders. She operates her business from her modest home.

At the moment, Aura Luz is requesting a loan to use as operating capital to buy pigs. She will also purchase ingredients and supplies for making Nicaraguan tamales such as banana leaves, cornmeal, and plastic bags.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pigs and supplies for making Nicaraguan tamales

loans.name: Dorlig

texts.en:
Mr. Dorlig is 46 years old and lives with his wife and five sons in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They all live together in a small house that they built recently. His eldest son is married but still lives in father’s house. His three younger sons, Chimiddorj, Turbold and Cagaancooj, are in high school and secondary school. 

Dorlig runs a taxi business in the city in his own car, which he bought on leasing contract from his taxi company. He enjoys transporting people. He also works in a secondary school as a carpenter and plumber on a part-time basis. Dorlig is a very hardworking person and is known for his good character. He has gained a lot of experience over the years and is a trusted driver for his many customers. 

Last April, Dorlig took a loan from Kiva, used it appropriately and paid back in full, on time. Now he is requesting a loan for the second time to complete his house improvement.

loans.use: To complete his house renovation

loans.name: Laura Azucena

texts.es:
Laura de 58 años, vende todo tipo de bebidas, su negocio lo tienen en su casa porque no ha podido conseguir un local, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, a su alrededor tiene el estero salado). 

Por necesidad y después de haber muerto su esposo comenzó a vender puerta a puerta botellas de agua y también hacer empleada domestica. Poco a poco fue incrementando su clientela y surtiendo las bebidas. Ahora no tiene horario fijo porque esta trabajando esporádicamente como empleada domestica y el resto de tiempo lo utiliza para su negocio. 

Para seguir con su negocio de venta de bebidas ella quiere comprar con el préstamo bebidas como coca cola, agua y jugos. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Laura, 58, sells all kinds of beverages. She operates the business in her house because she wasn't able to find another space for the business. She lives on the outskirts of Guayaquil (an area between the city and the nearby wetlands). Laura started selling bottled water, door to door, after her husband died because she needed the income. She also works as a house cleaner. Her customer base for the water business has increased little by little. She doesn't have fixed work hours now because she occasionally gets work as a cleaner and only operates the business other times. To keep the business going, Laura has to buy beverages--Coca Cola, water and juices. For the future, she wants to finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beverages to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothing for his stall

loans.name: Candelaria Amelia

texts.es: Candelaria Amelia M. G. de 42 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijas de 13  16 años de edad, las cuales se dedican a estudiar, junto a ellas reside en el departamento de Chalatenango. Candelaria es una madre de familia muy responsable y trabajadora, que ha pesar que desempeña tanto el rol de madre como el de padre, ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. Ella posee una tienda de productos comestibles como pan y golosinas, y también   de primera necesidad como: jabón y shampoo, y también comercializa verduras en su casa de habitación. Candelaria solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir aún más la tienda, así mismo para comprar mayor cantidad de maíz, y verduras los cuales son productos muy importantes en su negocio debido a que son de los que poseen mayor demanda, de manera que pueda atender mejor a sus clientes y de esta misma forma mejorar sus ventas lo cual es su prioridad para sacar adelante su hogar.
texts.en:
Candelaria Amelia M. G., age 42, is a single mother.  She has two daughters, ages 13 and 16.  Her daughters go to school.  They live in the Chalatenango department.  Candelaria is a very responsible and hard-working mother.  In spite of the fact that she fills the role of both mother and father, she has managed to get her family ahead.

She has a store where she sells edible products like bread and sweets.  She also sells basic needs items like soap and shampoo.  Additionally, she sells vegetables at her house.

Candelaria is requesting a loan to be able to stock her store even more.  She will buy a larger quantity of corn and vegetables.  These products are very important in her business because they are in the greatest demand.  This way she will be able to better serve her customers and improve her sales.  This is her priority in order to get her household ahead.

loans.use: Buy basic needs products

loans.name: Gune

texts.en: Gune L. is currently in the business of selling onions at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more onions to sell.  Gune is 30 years old and is married to a husband who is part of the Government of Southern Sudan staff. She has no children. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy land.

loans.use: Stock more onions to sell

loans.name: S. Léa

texts.fr: D. S. Léa est née le 15 Juillet 1985 et vit depuis cinq ans environs à Agbodjèdo, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Léa est mariée à AMOUSSOU Georges et est mère d’un enfant qui est scolarisé. En plus de son enfant, Léa a deux autres enfants à sa charge. Léa a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Pour faire face à ses besoins quotidiens, Léa gère un cafétéria, où elle vend en plus de son activité, des boissons et des divers (conserves de sardine, savons, etc.). Léa achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Léa désire augmenter le volume de son activité et accroître sa clientèle ; mais elle manque de moyens financiers pouvant lui permettre d’augmenter ses stocks de produits et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. C’est ce qui l’amène à solliciter auprès de ALIDé, un deuxième crédit. Plus tard, Léa envisage construire sa propre maison et avoir sa propre boutique.
texts.en:
Lea S. D. was born on the 15 of July, 1985 and has lived for the past 5 years in  Aghodiedo a neighbourhood of Cotonou,  the economic capital of Benin. Lea is married to George Amoussou and is the mother of one child who attends school. Bisides her own chiild, Lea cares for two other children. Lea stopped attending school after the secondary level. To meet her daily needs, and in addition to her other activities, Lea manages a cafeteria where she sells drinks and miscellaneous items including sardines, preserves, soaps, etc. She buys her products in Dantokpa, the international market in Benin.

Lea would like to increase her business volume and make new clients, but she lacks the financial means to allow her to increase her inventory in order to meet her client's needs. For this reason she has requested  this second loan from ALIDe.  In the future, Lea would like to build her own house and have a proper boutique.

loans.use: To buy drinks, jars of preserves, milk and soaps

loans.name: Jehova Jireh Group

texts.es:
el grupo Jehova Jireh esta ubicado en la colonia Eben Ezer de la ciudad de Danli, lo integran 3 personas, un hombre y dos mujeres. ellos tienen mucho tiempo de conocerse y se establecieron como grupo para salir adelante con sus negocios y sus familias, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan:

el sr. Manuel de Jesus R. se dedica al comercio y su actividad principal es la elaboración y venta de dulces, negocio que el lo ha nombrado “DULCES R.” su especialidad es la elaboración de dulces de banano, él a sabido ganarse la clientela por el buen sabor, tamaño y precio de los dulces que elabora.
sus dulces los vende a dueños de pulperías y mercaditos.
Don Manuel es casado y de principios cristianos, junto con su esposa sacan adelante su negocio, ya que ella le ayuda en la preparación de los dulces.
de su matrimonio ya solo dependen dos hijos y que actualmente están cursando sus estudios primarios.

la sra. Arcenia A. tiene más de 6 seis años de dedicarse a la elaboración y venta de tortillas de Maíz, actividad que realiza en su casa de habitación.
Ella se ha sabido ganar la clientela por el buen tamaño con que elabora las tortillas y por la higiene que muestra el lugar donde elabora su producto.
Sus clientes potenciales son los vecinos de la Col. Eben Ezer y la Col. Bella Vista ya que ella elabora las tortillas y las va a dejar a una pulpería, tambien vende en su casa de habitación y encargos que tiene permanente de otros clientes.
Doña Arcenia esta casada y es de buenos principios cristianos; su esposo se dedica a vender mercadería de manera ambulante y del matrimonio tienen 3 hijos los cuales dependen a un 100% y los tiene estudiando.

la sra. Gloria Marina F. se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de Donas.
las elabora en su casa de habitación y sale a venderlas en dos fabricas de tabacos que se encuentran muy cerca de donde vive, siendo sus clientes potenciales los empleados de la misma.
Doña Gloria es madre soltera de tres hijos, aproximadamente 3 años se separo de su esposo quedando sola al cargo de la educación y crianza de sus hijos, mismos que a la fecha están cursando sus estudios primarios.
Doña gloria es una mujer de admirar,  trabaja muy fuerte para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Jehova Jireh group is located in the Eben Ezer neighborhood in the city of Danli.  It is comprised of three people, one man and two women.  They have known each other for a long time.  They set up their group in order to get ahead with their businesses and their families.  What follows are details about their different business activities.

Manuel de Jesus R.’s main activity is making and selling sweets.  He has named his business “Ducles R.” (Delicious Sweets).  His specialty is making sweets from bananas.  He has known how to win customers by the good taste, size, and price of the sweets that he makes.  He sells his sweets to the owners of small grocery stores and markets.

Manuel is married and of Christian principles.  Together, he and his wife get ahead in his business.  She helps with the preparation of the sweets.  They only have two dependent children who are in elementary school.

Arcenia A. has been making and selling corn tortillas for over six years.  She does this in her house.  She has known how to win customers by the good size of her tortillas and the hygiene that is apparent in the place where she makes her products.  Her potential customers are the neighbors in the Eben Ezer neighborhood and the Bella Vista neighborhood.  She makes the tortillas and then leaves them in a small grocery store.  She also sells from her home, and she has standing orders from other customers.

Arcenia is married and of Christian principles.  Her husband sells merchandise in an itinerant manner.  They have three children who are all in school.

Gloria F. makes and sells donuts.  She makes them at home, and she sells them at two tobacco factories that are very close to where she lives.  Her potential customers are the workers in the two factories.

Gloria is a single mother, and she has three children.  She separated from her husband approximately three years ago.  This left her alone to raise her children and to be in charge of their education.  The children are in elementary school.  Gloria is a woman to admire.  She works very hard to get her children ahead.

loans.use: To buy sugar, flavorings, bags, fruit, firewood, lime, corn, wheat flour, oil, shortening, and margarine

loans.name: Buena Fé Group

texts.es:
El comité Buena Fé nace en diciembre de 2008 mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar.
Hasta la actualidad siguen trabajando con algunas integrantes nuevas dentro del grupo.
Una  de las integrantes es la señora Maria, una mujer muy trabajadora, quien se dedica a la venta de frutas en mercado municipal, desde un puesto que alquila.
Ella compra las frutas de los proveedores que llegan de interior del pais y venden a menor precio que los proveedores locales.
Se dedica a esta activida hace un buen tiempo y cuenta con clientes que la visitan por la calidad de sus productos.
Actualmente las frutas mas consumidas por los clientes son las bananas, nanaranjas, piñas, sandias y para la compra de los mismos ella solicita el préstamo.
texts.en:
The Buena Fé ("Good Faith") committee was born in December 2008 with the guidance and support of another committee that was working in the same location.  They continue to bring some new members into the group.  

One of the members is Señora Maria, a hardworking woman who sells fruit in the municipal market from a rented booth.  She buys fruit from suppliers who travel in from the countryside and sell their fruit at lower prices than local suppliers.  She has been doing this work for a while and has customers who visit for the quality of her products.

Currently the fruit that customers buy most are bananas, oranges, pineapple and watermelon. It is to buy these that she has requested the loan.

loans.use: Buying fruit: bananas, oranges, pineapples, watermelons and others.

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en:
Scovia is a forty-four-year-old widow and owns a semi-permanent house in Kasese. She has been selling paint and scrap materials for four years and rents a room to sell the products in. The hardship is buying scrap which is stolen. Her vision is to educate her children to higher institutions of learning.

Scovia intends to use the loan to buy scrap and paint for sale.

loans.use: To buy paint and scrap

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase pigs & llamas

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes M. M. is 30 years old business lady. She is married and has been a retail trader dealing in the sale of cereals and grocery for the last four years in Voi town. 

Agnes has been a KADET member and this marks her third loan from KADET, and she plans to purchase more stock of cereals, onions and flour. Agnes will direct the anticipated profits into the expansion of her grocery business. Her main customers are the residents of Voi. 

Her dream for the future is to own a big grocery store in Voi.

loans.use: purchase cereals, onions and flour

loans.name: Delma

texts.en:
Delma S., 34, is from the village of Makawa. She is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Delma owns and operates a fish selling business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of fish in the local community. Delma has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from this activity. 

In 2006, Delma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Delma is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. This will be her seventh loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to financially support her immediate family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and use as working capital.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda makes a living selling household goods such as soap. She is 29 years old, married and has two children, both of whom are in school. She is applying for this loan to buy more items to sell to her customers. In the future, she hopes to buy her own plot of land.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her shop

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is a married woman who lives in San Carlos City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a sari sari (general) store.  Her husband Edcor, who is 40 years old, works as a government utility employee to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have one child who is 8 years old. Cecelia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family.  With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Cecelia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 9,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 3,000 thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 16th loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future for her children's education. Cecelia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Tamarsu Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Tamarsu” group from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean leones for each one. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Marie B. is the leader of this group. The 24-year-old is married to a motorbike taxi driver and they have 2 children. Marie has been a businesswoman for 5 years now; she sells window curtains, door curtains, birthday cards, celebrity calendars, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items at wholesale to add to her current ones.

loans.use: to buy curtains, cards, calendars, etc. for resale

loans.name: Dessa

texts.en:
Dessa L. is from the village of Mandulog, Iligan City. She is 39 years old. Dessa is married and has two school-aged children. Dessa owns and operates a business making and selling snacks & other delicacies like rice & cassava cakes in the local community. She is also selling candies & sweet bananas. Dessa has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2010, Dessa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Dessa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Dessa is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients like flour & eggs. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Dessa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients like flour & eggs

location.town: Mandulog, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace L., 28 years old, is currently in business selling fruits and vegetables. She plans to use her loan to stock more vegetables. She is married to a businessman and they have four children. Her future goal is to build a nice house for her kids.

loans.use: to stock more vegetables.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita M. is 48 years old and married with six adult children. She is from the village of Taguitic, Kapatagan Lanao Del Norte. To make a living, Merlita owns and operates a specialized retail store. Her main source of income comes from selling seafood products such as fish and shrimp in the local community. Merlita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

Merlita joined GDMPC in 2008 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC that was used to purchase additional products to sell. Merlita is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase crabs and shrimp to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Merlita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase crabs and shrimp to sell

loans.name: Julia Piedad

texts.es:
Julia de 59 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, es separada pero tiene hijos ya casados y tiene 2 nietos que cuida con amor. Su actividad comercial es la venta de comida.

Comenzó hace un tiempo atrás como costurera viendo que no le alcanzaba y tiene a cargo de sus nietos que luego cambio a la venta de comida llevando a su cliente hasta en el centro va. Ella prepara los almuerzos en la mañana y cuida a una niña en el resto del día. Le afecta la delincuencia aya que sale a dejar los almuerzos a sus cliente y tiene miedo que le roben sus ganancias. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar materiales para construir un baño y arreglar una pared que se moja cada vez que llueve. En un futuro quiere mejorar su vivienda y tener un local donde pueda mejor vender sus almuerzo en el centro de la ciudad para dejar de estar haciendo mandados por seguridad.
texts.en:
Julia is 59 years old.  She lives in an urban area in Suburbio de Guayaquil.  She is separated but her children are already married and she has two grandchildren who she cares for with a lot of love.  Her business activity is selling meals.

Julia started working some time ago as a dressmaker.  However, seeing that she wasn't making enough in this business, and having grandchildren in her care, she changed her business to selling meals which she delivers to her customers, even in the city center.  Julia prepares her lunches in the morning and looks after a young girl during the rest of the day.  She is affected by crime as she has to go out to deliver her lunches to her customers and she is afraid that someone will steal her profits.  With the help of this loan, Julia would like to buy materials with which to build a bathroom and fix a wall which gets wet every time it rains.  In the future, she would like to improve her home and own premises in the city center where she can better sell her lunches and stop making deliveries for safety reasons.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for her home such as cement and blocks

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose, a 34-year-old single mother of one child, has been running her grocery business for the past six years. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a Kadet staff member, and this will be her second loan with which she plans to buy more stocks of assorted vegetables to sell. The  anticipated profit will allow her to buy even more vegetables.

A very hardworking woman, Rose hopes to own a wholesale grocery in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of assorted vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Eustiquia Group

texts.en:
Eustiquia is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is a widow with five children. For the past ten years, Eustiquia has been a farmer and she grows corn to earn a living. She has been a member of PMPC for two years.

Eustiquia is the group leader of this six-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member has her own business. Eustiquia is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer to increase her corn production.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to increase corn production

loans.name: Euhila

texts.en:
Euhila is 46 years old and married with one child. She has been running a general store in the Philippines for thirty years and earns an income from pig fattening and a carinderia (restaurant) as well.

Previously Euhila borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF. She is now requesting a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock for her general store.

Euhila works hard to provide for her family. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her general store.

loans.name: Mazam

texts.ru: Мазам проживает в городе Куляб. Она замужем. У неё 8 детей. Она имеет среднее образование. Уже семнадцать лет Мазам торгует на базаре женским нижним бельём. Она берет кредит для покупки пижам, маек и шорт.
texts.en: Mazam lives in the town of Kulob. She is married. She has eight children. She has secondary education. Mazam has been selling women's undergarments on the market for seventeen years. She is taking out the loan to buy pajamas, tank-tops and shorts.

loans.use: to buy pajamas, tank-tops and shorts

loans.name: Teobaldo Alonso

texts.es:
Alonso es un joven trabajador de 28 años de edad. Esta casado y  vive con su esposa e hijo en casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande – Piura, en la parte rural de este. La vivienda de Alonso no cuenta con los servicios básicos de saneamiento.

Alonso se dedica a la agricultura. Siembra limón semanalmente en una parcela que su padre le heredó. Además, Alonso  cuenta con una mototaxi (moto con cabina en la parte trasera para trasladar pasajeros), en la que brinda un servicio de transporte público. Estas actividades le permiten mantener a su familia y Alonso desea continuar con el buen desarrollo de ellas para tener mayores ganancias que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida.

Alonso solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar los fertilizantes que sus cultivos  de limón requieren , así como, para el mantenimiento de los asientos y rodajes de su mototaxi.

Alonso es un hombre responsable y este crédito le sería de mucha utilidad.
texts.en:
Alonso is a hard-working 28 year old young man.  He is married, and he lives with his wife and child in his own house in the rural eastern part of the Tambogrande – Piura district.  Alonso’s house does not have the basic sanitation services.

Alonso is a farmer.  He plants lemons weekly on a piece of land that his father left him.  Also, Alonso has a “mototaxi” (a motorcycle with a cabin in the back for transporting passengers).  He offers public transportation services.  These business activities allow him to support his family.  Alsonso wishes to continue the good progress of his businesses.  He wants to do this to have greater income that will allow him to improve his quality of life.

Alonso is requesting a loan for 2,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to buy fertilizers that his lemon crops need.  He will also have repairs done on the seats and wheels of his mototaxi.

Alonso is a responsible man, and this loan would be very useful to him.

loans.use: to repair the seats and wheels of his "mototaxi" (three wheeled motorized vehicle).

loans.name: Eldaniz

texts.ru: Eldaniz yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenenc iz Fuzuli qoroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoimi roditelyami. On ne jenat i ne iemyet detey. Eldaniz 23 qoda. On uje 2 qoda kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korov dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva skota dlya prodaji.
texts.en: Eldaniz is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with his parents.  He is single and has no children.  Eldaniz is 23 years old.  He has been a herdsman and cattle breeder for two years.  Now he needs 2000 AZN to buy cattle to increase his herd so that he can sell them.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is 41 years old, married and the mother of three children. She owns a tuk tuk in Kiembeni, Mombasa. Her business has been in operation for two years and is doing well.

Halima has been a KADET LTD client and this marks her second loan to finance her business. With this loan, she plans to purchase spare parts to repair her tuk tuk. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to provide for her family’s upkeep. Her dream is to own a vehicle.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to repair her tuk tuk

loans.name: Turamirize Group

texts.fr:
Anitha est une commerçante âgée de 42ans qui habite  dans la zone urbaine de Gitega au centre du pays. Elle  fait le commerce d’articles divers de boutique (riz, haricots, biscuits, savons, bonbons, etc)depuis 21ans. Elle était cultivatrice avant de commencer le présent métier. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en 6e année primaire. Elle est mariée  a Abel et ont ensemble 5 enfants dont 3 étudient  et 2 autres a l’école secondaire. 
Le crédit Kiva  de 550,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantités d’articles de boutique(riz, haricots, biscuits, savons, bonbons, etc ) à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  solidaire« TURAMIRIZE».
texts.en:
Anitha is a small-scale retailer of 42 who lives in the urban area of Gitega in the center of the country. She has been selling various shop goods (rice, beans, cookies, bars of soap, candy, etc.) for 21 years. She was a farmer before beginning her current business. She stayed in primary school up to the sixth grade. She is married to Abel and together they have five children of whom three are study and the other two are in secondary school. 

The Kiva loan in the amount of 550,000 Burundi francs that she will receive allows her to add to her working capital so as to buy large quantities of shop goods (rice, beans, cookies, bars of soap, candy, etc.) for resale in order to make a lot of profit. 

She is a member of the solidarity group called "TURAMIRIZE".

loans.use: to add to her working capital to buy large quantities of shop goods (rice, beans, cookies, bars of soap, candy, etc.) for resale.

loans.name: Abesamihigo A / Rsz Group

texts.fr:
Jean Bosco fait partie du groupe Abesamihigo A / RSZ. Le nom du groupe signifie « performers ». Il est marié avec 8 enfants de 6 à 25 ans, dont 8 scolarisés. 

Jean Bosco est cultivateur de riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques et payer la main d’œuvre pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser des engrais chimiques, cultiver peu d’espace et récolter une grande quantité. Dans les prochaines années, Jean Bosco voudrait être parmi les meilleurs cultivateurs de riz dans sa vallée. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer ses enfants et s’autofinancer.
texts.en:
Jean Bosco belongs to the group Abesamihigo A/RSZ. The name of the group means “performers.” He is married with eight children ranging in age from six to 25 years, eight of whom attend school. 

Jean Bosco is a rice farmer.  This is his second loan cycle with ACB.  He is going to use his loan to buy chemical fertilizer and to pay those who help him cultivate his rice. 

His strategy to grow his business is to use the chemical fertilizers in order to harvest a large quantity of rice in a small space.  In the years to come, Jean Bosco would like to be among the best rice growers the valley.  With his profits, he foresees being able to pay for his children’s education and to be financially independent.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and to pay labor costs in his rice cultivation business.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 29 years old and married to Janet. They have two children, two and six years old.

William has a shoe business that he has been running for the past seven years and has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to buy more shoes to add to his stock to sell.

He hopes to open up a shoe shop in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to add to his stock.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is 31 years old and married with three children: a son and two daughters. Her son is in 5th standard while her daughters stay at home and manage the household work.
 
Nasreen herself is involved in a sewing business. She operates her business at her home to financially contribute to the family. Her business earns her a good amount which helps her to manage the household expenses. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her brother’s business. Her brother runs a canteen in a school where he sells different edible items like biscuits, chips, cold drinks and juices to the school children and earns income. He has been in this business for the past 10 years. With the loan, he will buy the edible items and cold drinks in larger quantities to put into his canteen for increasing his sales. 

Nasreen is hopeful that the investment will be proven beneficial for her brother’s business.

loans.use: To buy edible items and cold drinks for a canteen business.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a fifty-nine-year-old married man with three children who stays in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in milling and transport businesses for eight years. His vision is to have a coffee huller plus he wants to educate his children up to university level so that they can have a bright future. 

However, paying all of their school fees is a challenge for him, and that is why he has requested a loan from a loan facility, as most parents do for their children to access quality education. James needs the loan facility to pay school fees for his children and also to repair his motor vehicle for his transport business.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children and also repair his motor vehicle for his transport business.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is 71 years old and lives in Upper Centro,Tudela,Misamis Occidental.  She is widowed with one child. 

Josefa has a shop that sells home products. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional home products to sell.

Josefa has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Josefa hopes to save money for her old age.

loans.use: to purchase more home products to sell

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es: La socia actualmente se encuantra con su negocio de elaboracion de chicha de jora y venta de cerveza, la socia tiene un pequeño local en su domicilio en el cual atiende estos productos, ella misma se encarga de elaborar la chicha a base de maíz amarillo, la socia tambien tiene su pequeño terreno de cultivo de maíz, ella cria tambien animales menores como cuyes y gallinas; La socia desea seguir creciendo e implementar mas adelante su local para recibir a mas clientes. La socia requiere el prestamo para invertir en la compra de maíz amarillo para la elaboracion de la chicha de jora y en la compra de cerveza.
texts.en: The member is in her business making ‘chicha de jora’ [drink made from fermented corn] and selling beer.  She has a small, home-based store where she sells these products.  She makes the chicha from a yellow corn base herself.  She also has a small field growing corn and she also raises small farm animals like guinea pigs and chickens.  She wants to continue growing and expanding her locale still more to be able to tend to more customers and needs the loan to buy yellow corn to make the chicha de jora and to buy beer.

loans.use: to buy yellow corn and beer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise and offer his clients better products.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is 31 years old. He operates a barber shop in Majaoni, Mombasa. He is single and has been in this business for the past four years and is doing great. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD and this marks his second loan to enable him expand his business. Christopher plans to buy more barber chairs and shaving machines. 

He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business and hopes to own another barber shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy more barber chairs and shaving machines.

loans.name: Eneria

texts.en:
Eneria is from Litapan, Ozamiz City. She is 59 years old, married and has 8 adult children. 

To make a living, Eneria is engaged in a livestock business, raising cows for sale. Eneria has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns about 10,000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2006, Eneria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eneria is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Ediatu

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Ediatu.  She is married and has two children aged 14 (in SSS 1) and 4 (in preschool). She has no additional dependents living with her.  

In 2004, Ediatu established her restaurant business. She began this business after she dropped out of school and started assisting her mother. Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she earns about Le 616,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000 to buy her stock in large quantity which will increase her profit.  

In the future, Ediatu plans to construct a modernized building that will house her restaurant. She thanks you for your support

loans.use: To buy palm oil, rice, Maggi, onions and other cooking condiments.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is 32 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is married with three children between 2 and 9 years old. Two of the children are in school and all live at home. Marie has been selling rice, peppers, and bitter ball for the past 17 years.  She started this business with money given to her by her husband and she learned this business from her mother. Her favorite part about her business is that she makes more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, peppers, and bitter ball for her business. In the future, she wants to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, peppers, and bitter ball to sell

loans.name: Shirley Rita

texts.es:
Shirley tiene 34 años de edad, es muy trabajadora y carismática, vive al lado de su esposo y juntos tienen 2 hijos de 10 y 12 años a los cuales ama muchísimo y por quienes da la vida por darle una vida digna. Su humilde vivienda se ubica en el distrito de Santiago, Ica, Perú. El distrito de Santiago se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla  la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón, uva, esparrago, entre otros. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho jugar con sus hijos y conversar con ellos, asimismo le encanta disfrutar en algunas ocasiones uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pato”. Debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres ella solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar enfermería.

Día a día Shirley traba en un fundo de su distrito como obrera, ella trabaja alrededor de 9 hora sal día, con lo cual puede colaborar con su esposo para los gastos del hogar; ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es responsable, honrada y sobre todo tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Shirley está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda, ya que podrá colocar lunas a su puerta de fierro, mejorar las ventanas, entre otros; de esta manera podrá darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y podrá seguir luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar de construir su vivienda y darle una buena educación a sus hijos”.

loans.use: Para mejoramiento de vivienda (colocar lunas, mejoramiento de ventanas, entre otros)

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es: Alexander es un hombre de 37 años de edad, casado y padre de un hijo de 7 años. Desde hace 15 años comenzó su negocio de fotografía, cuyo oficio aprendió de sus familiares y contó con el apoyo de sus padres para iniciarlo. Allí, además de ofrecer el servicio de fotografía, también se dedica a  la producción de televisión, ya que se capacitó en este campo de acción, con el fin de ampliar su portafolio de servicios y complementar sus ingresos, con los cuales lleva el sustento a su hogar. Alexander es activo, entusiasta, pujante y dedicado a su familia y a su labor. Actualmente solicita el crédito como apoyo para fortalecer su negocio, el cual invertirá en la compra de activos fijos (cámara profesional, luces y computador), de esta manera podrá aumentar su patrimonio y a la vez tendrá la capacidad de ofrecer a sus clientes un mejor servicio, con mayor calidad y agilidad; lo que se verá reflejado en el incremento de sus ventas y sus ingresos y poder continuar velando por mejorar el bienestar y la calidad de vida de su familia y, brindar una mejor educación a su hijo. Es así, como Alexander desea seguir trabajando para llegar a cumplir el sueño de  producir campañas publicitarias para grandes empresas, que le generen mayores ganancias a mediano plazo.
texts.en:
Alexander is a 37 year old man. He is married and is the father of a 7 year old child. Fifteen years ago he opened his photography business, learning the trade from his family members and relying on the support of his parents to get started. Now, besides offering his photography services, he also works in video production (a field in which he has been trained) with the purpose of expanding his portfolio of services and supplementing his income. This income is the means of support for his home.

Alexander is active, enthusiastic, thriving, and dedicated to his family and his work. Currently he is seeking a loan as a means of support to strengthen his business. He will invest it in fixed assets (a professional camera, lights, and a computer). In this way he will be able to increase his assets. At the same time, he will be able to offer his clients better service, with better quality and flexibility, which should be reflected in an increase in sales and income. He will be able to continue to safeguard and improve the well-being and quality of life of his family, and to give a better education to his child. As Alexander would like to keep working to eventually achieve his dream of producing publicity campaigns for major companies, in the meanwhile this will generate higher earnings.

loans.use: to buy fixed assets such as a professional camera, lights, and computer.

loans.name: 3 Thôn 6 Quảng Đại Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Diện works in agriculture, farming food. Diện has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is lack of capital.

Diện is 35 years old and she is married with four children. She lives with her four dependents in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Diện joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Diện is the group leader of the 3 thôn 6 Quảng Đại solidarity group, which consists of four members. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell.

In the future, Diện hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and to make enough money to provide for her children.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be honest. 

Joyce operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a populated area and her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

Joyce will use this KES 70,000 loan to buy beauty products for salon use. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.  The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy beauty products for salon use

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on the stock and to meet the family needs.

loans.name: Fatish

texts.en: Fatish is an IDP from occupied Agdam district of Azerbaijan. He fled to Baku in 1993 and started his private business in 1999. He is married, has three children. In 1999-2006 he borrowed five loans totalling $3000 from Normicro Baku branch. Now he would like to borrow $1000.

loans.use: To expand volume of business

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en: Tamara has been a member of SPBD for a year and a half.  She resides in a small Samoan village with her extended family.  Tamara is the dependable caretaker of the family plantation.  With the help of her nieces and nephews living in the village, she is able to keep up with the hard farm work.  Having used (and fully repaid) previous loans to invest in her land and improve her taro crop, she is now seeking funds to purchase new tires for the truck she uses to haul her crop to the market every week.  Without the ability to transport her crop, she can’t turn her crop into the income that her family relies on.

loans.use: Repair crop transportation

loans.name: Bélgica

texts.es:
Business Description

Ms. Bélgica sells"basic needs" groceries such as: noodles, rice, oils, beef, chicken, etc. She tends her store from 6am to 10pm. She has 15 years experience in her store. Ms. Bélgica began her business with money her husband gave her for the groceries, which she managed to save from and began to purchase more merchandise. Ms. Bélgica's store is run from her own home and she has plenty of experience.

Loan Use

Ms. Bélgica wishes to apply for a loan to stock more merchandise for her store, such as chicken, meats and vegetables because her store is very well located and she has high demand from her customers for these items.

Personal Information

Ms. Bélgica is 55 years old, she is separated from her husband and she has 4 children, 2 who are adults and help with the household expenses and the others go to High School. Her husband pays her child support every month to help with her childrens' studies and to purchase food. Her home is made of wood and cement, but is also very modest. She has fought to support her home and family. She hopes that this loan will improve her business and this will improve her own quality of life and that of her family's.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Descripción del Negocio

La señora Bélgica se dedica a la venta de víveres de primera necesidad como, fideos, arroz, aceites, carne de res, pollo, etc. Ella atiende en su negocio desde las 6am hasta las 10pm. Ella lleva 15 años dedicada a esta actividad. La señora Bélgica inicio su negocio con el dinero que su esposo le daba para la comida ella iba ahorrando y así empezó a comprar mercadería. Doña Bélgica tiene su tienda en su mismo domicilio y tiene experiencia en el negocio.

Uso del Préstamo

La Sra. Bélgica desea el crédito para abastecerse de mas mercadería como pollo, carne y legumbres ya que su negocio tiene una muy buena ubicación y existe gran demanda de los clientes en el sector de estos productos.

Información Personal

La Sra. Bélgica tiene 55 años de edad, esta separada de su esposo, tiene 4 hijos, 2 son mayores de edad y le ayudan con los gastos del hogar, tiene un hijo especial y otro que estudia en el colegio. Su esposo le da una mensualidad para los estudios y alimentación de sus hijos. Su casa es propia de madera y cemento, muy modesta. Ella es una mujer que ha luchado por sacar adelante su hogar. Ella desea con este crédito mejorar su negocio y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.)

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise, such as chicken and meats.

loans.name: Qarib

texts.en:
Qarib I. is a 52-year-old farmer who owns a milk product business in the southern Azerbaijani region Bilasuvar. He is an internally displaced person from Nagornniy Karabakh who fled to Bilasuvar during the Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict. 
Qarib has been running his business since 1994.  He sells yoghurt, cheese and milk to the local people and also  to bazaar traders in Bilasuvar. Qarib has two cows, but needs more to cover his family's needs. Qarib plans to expand his business by purchasing a cow and a calf. The estimated cost for one milk cow is 700-800 USD and for calf 400 USD.  He plans to pay the loan back in 18 months.

loans.use: Going to purchase one milk cow and one calf

loans.name: Tavalea

texts.en:
Tavalea T. is 40 years old, married with 7 children. Her husband works for one of the supermarkets in town. His weekly salary is not sufficient to support her family. In addition to his job, her husband has a pineapple farm. Every day after work he works on the farm with their children.

Tavalea decided to do something for herself and to occupy her time. Pancake was the business she chose. Families around her village buys them for breakfast especially on Sundays, and she is also close to the village school. Tavalea is a very hard working mother and with her first loan she wants to make sure she will use it wisely and to develop her business to another level.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her pancakes business

loans.name: Sren

texts.en: Mrs. Sren S. M., age 38, runs a stand at a market selling clothes, making around $5 per day in revenue. Her husband is a recycler, selling the recyclable items he collects to the recycling company to earn about $4 per day in revenue. They have four children, two who help her with her business, and two who are students. She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to purchase more recycling items to resell for an additional profit. This will increase the income of her family and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase recyclable items to resell for a profit.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en: My name is Shabana B. and I live in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. Because my husband has suffered from TB for many years, I am my family's only breadwinner.  I support my husband and my three children, all of whom are in school, by making bags. I need a loan of $350 to expand my business so that I can continue my husband’s treatment and my children's education.

loans.use: Expand a bag-making business

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en: Mariatu K. sells rice and peanuts in Mbikolo village on the outskirts of Makeni town.  She is 45 years old and married with two children.  She is grateful for the previous loans, as they helped increased her business and income.  She is now able to meet her children’s school requirements and also supplement other family expenses.  She is requesting another loan to expand her business.

loans.use: Mariatu is ambitious and hard working.  With the help of the Kiva loan she wants to expand her business.

loans.name: Ebenezer, Group 2

texts.en:
Maria has a small cafeteria where she sells frituras, which is a variety of fried Dominican food. She is asking for a loan so that for the first time she will have extra capital to buy more merchandise to expand her business. Specifically, she wants to buy ingredients in bulk to cut down on cost, as well as occasionally buying a wider variety of meats to sell that she hasn’t been able to afford before.

She lives with her two children and husband in a small community outside of the capital, Santo Domingo. Her dream is to watch her children graduate high school, go to one of the universities in Santo Domingo and become professionals. For herself, her dream is to own a bakery and dessert shop where she can sell what she loves making most: breads and cakes. She also hopes at one point to return to school herself.

Maria's biggest challenge to overcome is not a lack of money, or poverty, but rather the insecurity and doubt she harbors in herself — it is hard for her to understand that she really is capable of improving her life and doing better for her family. Thankfully, with the help of Esperanza, and the group lending method, she is supported by her group members and learning to overcome this insecurity—she says they help her believe more strongly in herself.

On behalf of everyone at Esperanza, and on behalf of Maria and her group members, we thank you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase bread, chicken, beef, pork and cooking ingredients

loans.name: Patisepa

texts.en: Patisepa owns a small shop at Toamua village. She is an experienced entrepreneur, having own her business for 10 years. She tries to maintain a good selection of items in her shop that would be in demand by passing shoppers. Patisepa’s business is a large source of income for her, her husband, Lafi, and their 12 children. She makes $700 (local dollars) profit in a typical month. She has requested a loan of $900 (U.S. dollars) to purchase new inventory. We are happy for this opportunity to continue assisting Patisepa as she works to support her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory for her retail shop

loans.name: Clisentia

texts.en:
Clisentia is a 32 year old married woman with one child. She lives with her family in one of the slums of Kisumu, Kenya. Her business, which she started in 2000, offers a variety of staples such as bread, rice, flour, sugar, cooking oil, along with other items often used by her customers.

Her hard work, perseverance, good reputation and many years in business, coupled with a well-established clientele base ensure that her business will continue to grow. She has applied for a loan of $800 US to help her purchase additional stock of essential commodities.

loans.use: Purchase stock of basic commodties for sale

loans.name: Régina

texts.fr:
Born on October 17, 1979 in TOVICLIN (in COUFFO County) in the Southwest of Benin, Ms. Régina A. is married and the mother of a girl, Oluwatob, age 5. She is a seller of women's undergarments and shoes. A traveling saleswoman in the beginning, she was able to make a deal on a shop located about 500 meters from her home, where she is going to become situated in order to better serve her customer base. She is requesting a loan to procure supplies and to meet customer demands.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Née le 17 octobre 1979 à TOVICLIN dans le département du COUFFO au Sud-ouest du BENIN, dame A. Régina est mariée et mère d’une fille OLUWATOBI âgée de 5 ans. Elle est revendeuse de sous vêtement féminin et de chaussures dames. Ambulante au départ, elle a pu négocier une boutique située à environ 500 mètres de son domicile où elle va s’installer afin de mieux servir sa clientèle. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour s’approvisionner et répondre aux attentes de ses clients.

loans.use: To buy one bale of undergarments and a half bag of shoes

loans.name: Humberto's Group
