texts.es: hola mi nombre es Humberto R., tengo 66 años de edad, estoy casado y tengo 4 hijos, de los cuales 3 estan casados, toda via 1 depende de mi, este se encuentra cursando la escuela, Resido en esta ciudad desde hace 4 años y tengo 2 de dedicarme a la venta de productos de consumo popular, el cual me genera ganancias para sustentar mi familia, en este momento no cuento con suficiente capital para surtir mi negocio y la demanda es mucha, por lo que necesito su apoyo monetario para poder salir adelante con mi negocio que es lo unico que tengo para poder generar dinero ya que por mi edad ninguna empresa me contrata para trabajar.

loans.use: compra de manteca, azucar, dulces, carnes, embutidos, arroz, jabon y refrescos.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is 30 years old. She is a married woman with a 7 year-old child. She became a clothes seller in 2007. Every day, she works from 7am to 12pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Paulina now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Bashiran's Group

texts.en:
Bashiran baji is married to M. A. and lives in the city of Arifwala, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the last four years. She has one son who is just 9 months old. Her brother-in-law also lives with her family and is a painter by profession, painting houses, windows, doors, etc. Her husband runs a grocery shop and has six years of experience. Bashiran baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. Bashiran baji successfully completed her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for another loan to buy more groceries to expand her husband's business.

She is joined in her loan group by two others. Safia baji wants a loan to buy more fruit to re-sell. Razia baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw, a local three-wheeled motor vehicle.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more grocery inventory

loans.name: Maria Hilda

texts.es:
La señora María Z. D. Gutiérrez  tiene 59 años vive en la Avenida Primavera sin número del distrito D. Mache provincia D. Otuzco,  departamento D. la Libertad  Perú.
Cursó hasta el tercer año D. Primaria y no continuo estudiando porque no contaba con el apoyo económico D. sus padres, tuvo que trabajar desD. muy pequeña y no podía ir a la escuela.
Se casó D. dieciséis años con el señor Víctor Gutiérrez y tuvieron dos hijas mujeres y un hijo varón, una D. sus hijas falleció a causa D. neumonía.  Su hijo varón y su hija mujer ahora viven cerca D. ella pero ya no dependen económicamente, son casados.
Tiene un negocio que consiste en comprar animales, engordarlos y venderlos en carne, lo realiza en su propia casa.
Manifiesta que gracias a Manuela Ramos obtuvo un préstamo D. 300 con lo que compró dos cerdos y algunos cuyes los que volvió a vender en muy buen precio, devolvió su préstamo en cuatro meses. D. esto ya hace mucho tiempo  manifiesta.
Con este préstamo D. 600 soles y comprará cerdos y gallinas, que los venderá en carne porque así obtendrá mejores ganancias. Su préstamo lo devolverá en cuatro meses.
María pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres D. Trabajo, es una socia que está muy contenta con su Banco.
Su gran sueño es reunir a toda su familia y celebrar una gran fiesta.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Z. D. G. is 59 years old and lives on Primavera Avenue in Mache, Otuzco in the state of La Libertad, Peru. She studied through the 3rd year of elementary school but could not continue studying since her parents could not support her. She had to work since she was very young and could not attend school. She got married when she was 16 to Victor G. and they have two daughters and one son. One of their daughters died of pneumonia. Her son and daughter now live close to her but are now independent and are married with their own families. She runs a business purchasing animals, feeding them (fattening them up) and selling them; she runs it out of her own home. Thanks to the Manuela Ramos organization, she received a $100 loan which she used to purchase 2 pigs and some guinea pigs which she sold for a good price. She paid back her loan in 4 months. With this loan of $225 she will purchase pigs and chickens which she will sell and hopefully earn more income. She will repay her loan in 4 months. Maria belongs to the Working Women village bank and is very glad to be a member of the bank. She would love to gather who whole family in order to have a great celebration.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock in order to sell at retail prices

loans.name: Rukia Mohamed's Sea Cliff B Group

texts.en:
Rukia M., age 38, is married with 4 children, ages 18, 13, 10 and 8. Rukia has a business of selling traditional clothes such as vitenge (Swahili fabrics) and kangas (Swahili sarongs). She started this business 20 years ago! She works daily from 7:00 AM until 4:00 PM and is able to earn a monthly profit of about $167.

This will be Rukia's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the first loan to increase her stock and has since paid the loan back successfully. She intends to use this new loan for the same purpose.

Rukia will share this loan with her subgroup, Sea Cliff B. The group has 7 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Rukia is in the back, second from the left.

loans.use: To increase stock of clothes

loans.name: Nusratullo

texts.ru: Вохидов Нусратулло фермер . Уже четыре года занимается животноводством. Закупает бычков , откармливает их около 40-45 дней , а затем продает на рынке. Имеет несколько голов животных , но планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Это даст возможность увеличить доходность дела.Для этого он планирует получить кредит и использовать его для покупки породистого бычка. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Nusratullo V. is a farmer. He has been raising animals for four years. He buys bull calves, feeds them for 40-45 days, and sells the finished calves at the market. He has a few head of livestock, but wants to use a loan to increase that number. This will allow him to improve the business's profitability. To do this he plans to receive a loan and use it to buy a pure-bred bull calf. The loan will be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase number of livestock

loans.name: Grace J.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Grace M. from Kyela. She is married with four children between the ages of five and 11. Grace has been running a khanga business since 2004. She buys khanga (Tanzanian traditional dress) on a wholesale basis and sells them in her shop.

Grace works at the business for 9 to 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by her husband. She is requesting a loan of 625 USD in order to purchase more khanga in bulk. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Grace thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more khanga in bulk

loans.name: Ada

texts.en:
Ada is a member of the Alianza (“Alliance”) Village Bank. She is 38 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their son. 

She and her partner have a workshop where they do different sizes of artistic paintings. They fill custom orders and also have a small school supply store, which her husband runs. Ada is also a teacher at a private school.  

Ada needs a loan of 1,400 soles to buy notebooks, pens and paints.  Ada’s dreams are to have a larger business, a large school supply store, and to provide her son with a good education. 


Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Ada es socia del Banco Comunal Alianza.
Ada es conviviente, tiene 38 años y 1 hijo, Ada junto a su pareja tiene un taller de pintura de cuadros artísticos, paneles, su local es alquilado, realizan trabajos a pedidos y en el mismo local tienen una pequeña librería que es atendido por su esposo. Ada es docente en un colegio particular.

loans.use: To buy notebooks, pens and paints

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Mrs. Sem B. is a villager in Chrouy village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn her living. On her plantation, she is faced with the problem of an infertile field. So, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to improve the soil. She will use the rest of the loan to buy pesticides to kill all kinds of insects.

She is a 58-year-old widow with five children. Two children are masseurs at the Massage Club. Two others are employed in a garment factory and the youngest one is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to improve her field.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo is a responsible husband to Donata and a good father to their two children: Edonna, 20 years old and a college student, and Edmund, 19 years old, a high school graduate. Their younger child is helping his father in the farm since he was not able to pursue his college studies due to financial difficulties.

Eduardo is engaged in raising chickens and is also a farmer. With lack of capital, he is now asking for a loan of PHP 4,000 that he can use in the business. They are hoping that through his business, he can provide the immediate needs of his family and cater for the education of their daughter.

loans.use: business capital

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Văn 45 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2002. Hiện gia đình chị đang kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá và sản xuất công cụ lao động thủ công ( Liềm, dao, cuốc..) tại nhà. Đây cũng là những công việc đem lại cho gia đình chị nguồn thu nhập ổn định 3.500.000/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ một phần chị sử dụng để mua sắt về sản xuất liềm, dao bán, phần còn lại chị sử dụng để đầu tư kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Văn, 45 years old, has participated in the TYM Fund since 2002. Currently, her family operates two businesses from their home – selling groceries and producing hand-crafted tools for manual labor such as sickles, knives, and hoes. Together these businesses provide the family with a steady income of 3,500,000 VND (200 USD) per month. In the next round of lending, she hopes to borrow 10,000,000 VND (575 USD), one part to be used to buy iron to produce sickles and hoes for sale, and the rest she will invest in her grocery shop.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Manufacturing hand tools, selling groceries

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en:
KamA. is a 44-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. KamA. has owned a grocery store for a year. He requested a loan of 1500 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store. This is the first time that KamA. has requested a loan.
KamA. is speciA. in his work because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t have the startup capitA.. KamA. decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans on improving his store and starting a new business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en: Agatha is 35 years old and is married with 5 children. She sells cooked foods like rice, beans, etc. She also sells sachet water. She hopes for a loan in the amount of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell.

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr: Monsieur A. a abandonné les études en 2004, n’ayant pas trouvé de travail il s’est alors lancé dans la restauration. Il a ouvert un cafétéria qu’il a appelé « CAFETARIA LA GRACE » en 2007. Les produits de première nécessité qu’il utilise dans son activité sont épuisés, il sollicite pour se réapprovisionner un second crédit de WAGES. Il a déjà obtenu de WAGES un premier crédit qu’il a parfaitement bien remboursé. Il est célibataire, c’est avec le revenu  de son activité de cafétéria qu’il subvient aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. A. abandoned his studies in 2004. Not having found a job, he then started working in the catering business. He opened a cafeteria which he named "CAFETERIA LA GRACE" in 2007. Since the basic need goods that he uses in his business are depleted, he is seeking his second loan through WAGES to resupply himself. He has already obtained one loan through WAGES, which he repaid without problems. He is unmarried, and it is with the income from his cafeteria business that he meets his family's expenses.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic need goods for use in his cafeteria

loans.name: Emmanuella

texts.en:
Emmanuella Y. is 25 years old. She is married and one child, a daughter who is currently in the primary school. Emmanuella lives with her husband and child in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase, which is a farming and trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband is a farmer.

Emmanuella is a trader. She trades in secondhand textiles, specifically ladies’ underclothing and dresses. She hawks her wares in her neighborhood and also treks to other towns to sell. She procures bales of textiles from Dormaa. She has been in business for three years.

She hopes to receive a loan to procure her textiles in bulk. She is eager to expand her business and to help improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy secondhand textiles in bulk

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.en:
Nicolasa runs a small grocery store with her sister.  When her husband had an accident at work, Nicolasa was obliged to work in order to support the living expenses of her family.  She sold lottery tickets for a while.  After saving some money, she was able to open her grocery.  The store grew little by little and, eventually, her sister transferred all her rights to Nicolasa, so that she is now the sole owner of her small business.

Nicolasa applied for this loan in order to purchase goods such as sugar, herbs, rice, noodles, breads, dairy porducts, and beverages.

loans.use: The purchase of merchandise such as sugar, herbs, rice, noodles, breads, dairy products and drinks

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi de l’association Tièssiri II est un regroupement de six femmes, mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygames, elles ont en moyenne 45 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans le quartier Hamdallaye de la ville de Ségou (4ème  Région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ce groupe de femmes  fait essentiellement  le commerce d’articles divers tels, les  pagnes wax, les  calebasses, les condiments alimentaires, les  céréales etc. Elles sont très sollicitées et appréciées pour la qualité de leurs marchandises. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de commerce, elles ont décidé d’adhérer au programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  elles sont à leur 1ier prêt solidaire.
 Ce  prêt  sera utilisé pour acheter, 10 pièces de pagnes wax, 6 colis de calebasses, 2 corbeilles de tomates et de piments, un sac de mil et 300 kg de tamarin. Elles se ravitaillent en calebasses à Tonan, en pagnes wax et en condiments à Bamako, en mil et en tamarin dans les foires de Djonforo et Sirakorobougou. Elles revendent toutes leurs marchandises en détail au comptant et à crédit à domicile, au marché château de Ségou et en ambulant dans les quartiers à une clientèle composée d’hommes, de femmes et d’enfants. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 29.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et la prise en charge des frais de santé des enfants.
Elles ont pour ambition de devenir des grossistes.
texts.en:
This Benkadi group, part of the Tièssiri II Association, unites 6 married women, mostly from polygamous families. Their average age is 45 and they have 3 children, on average. They all live in the Hamdallaye neighborhood of the town of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

This group of women mostly sell various items such as "wax"-brand "pagnes" (lengths of high quality African print cloth), gourds, condiments, cereals, etc. They are much in demand and the quality of their merchandise is greatly appreciated.

Wishing to increase their working capital, they decided to join the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom they are on their first solidarity loan. This loan will be used to buy 10 lengths of "pagne-wax", 6 packages of gourds, 2 baskets of tomatoes and hot peppers, 1 sack of millet and 300 kg of tamarinds. They buy their gourds in Tonan, their "pagnes" and condiments in Bamako, the millet and tamarinds at the weekly markets of Djonforo and Sirakorobougou.

They sell all their merchandise retail, for cash and credit, out of their homes, at the "château" market in Ségou, and walking through the residential neighborhoods, to a clientele composed of men, women, and children. They expect to make an average monthly profit of 29,000 F CFA which will be used to reimburse the loan and to pay health-related expenses for their children.

Their ambition is to become wholesalers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various items for re-sale

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky M., 28, is from the village of Marilag, Bukidnon. Vicky is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Vicky owns and operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector operating a manufacturing business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing and selling bags and sandals to local businesses and community members. Vicky has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns ~5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Vicky joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vicky is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children’s education and supplement her family’s income.


About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Leda Group

texts.en: Leda N. M. is the group leader of Leda group. There are four members in this group. Each of them would like a loan to expand their business. Leda will use the loan for her husband’s new business of leather sewing. Rabeya wants to take out a loan to grow her tailoring business. Meir Aqa wants a loan to improve his bakery, and Gull Aqa wants to buy necessary materials for his general store. They are very happy that this small loan system is available in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Matilde Dos Santos

texts.pt:
Matilde dos Santos N. nasceu na província de Maputo no distrito de magude (a 200 km a norte de maputo), tem 51 anos de idade, fez a 3 classe na era colonial e parou por falta de condições financeiras. É casada, pai de 4 filhos maiores de idade que vivem nas suas casas. Vive no distrito de boane no bairro de Marconi com seu marido e 3 netos sob sua responsabilidade.

Matilde cresceu na companhia dos seus pais e mais tarde mudou se juntamente com os pais para o distrito da Manhica donde mais tarde casou se e, devido à guerra dos 16 anos, que era bastante intensa neste distrito, saiu para o distrito de Boane em busca de lugar mais seguro para viver, no ano de 1985.

Foi desde essa altura que aprendeu a fazer actividades de geração de renda, enquanto o marido trabalhava numa das pedreiras de Boane (este distrito possui cerca de 4 pedreiras onde se extrai pedra para construções de casas e estradas).

Matilde é comerciante e dona do negocio. Vende vários produtos de primeira necessidade (sabão, colgates cervejas e refrescos) que os adquire na cidade de Maputo e rende cerca de 500,00MT por mês e consegue poupar algum valor no Banco comercial.

Já teve empréstimos com uma Associação de créditos que usava metodologia de grupos solidários e tendo levantado e concluído os valores de 1.500,00MT; 2.500,00MT e 3.000,00MT com sucesso. E, com a Hluvuku-Adsema este é o seu quarto empréstimo no valor de 23.500,00MT que pretende ampliar o seu negocio (vendendo peixe). Quer iniciar a venda deste produto porque o os produtos que vende actualmente não tem tido muita procura.

Teve informações sobre a Hluvuku-Adsema através de vizinhos e tendo levantando 16.00,00MT; 22.000,00MT e 23.000,00MT, respectivamente para o exercício da mesma actividade (venda de produtos de primeira necessidade).

Propõe se a pagar o empréstimo para poder aceder a mais créditos com o objectivo de ampliar o estabelecimento comercial.
texts.en:
Matilde dos Santos N. was born in the province of Maputo in the Magude district (200km north of Maputo). She is 51 years old. She attended school until the 3rd grade in the colonial era and stopped attending due to financial considerations. She is married and has 4 adult children who have their own homes. She lives in the Boane district in the Marconi neighborhood with her husband and 3 grandchildren, whom she supports. Matilde grew up with her parents and later moved with them to Manhica where she later married. Due to the 16 year war, which was very intense in this region, she left for Boane in 1985 to find a safer place to live. During this same timeframe, she learned to do activities that could generate income, while her husband worked in one of the Boane quarries (this area has around 4 quarries where stones are extracted for construction of homes and roads). Matilde owns her own business. She sells a variety of items to meet basic needs (soap, toothpaste, beer, soft drinks) that she acquires in Maputo. She earns around 500,000MT per month and is able to save some money in a commercial Bank. She has had loans in the past with an association that used group loan methodology, through which she took out and successfully paid off loans of 1.500,00 MT; 2.000,00 MT and 3.000,00 MT. This loan with Hluvuku-Adsema will be her fourth, with a value of 23.500,00 MT that she will used to expand her business (by selling fish). She wants to start selling fish because the products she currently sells have not had much demand. She learned about Hluvuku-Adsema through neighbors who had taken out loans for 16.00,00 MT; 22.000,00 MT and 23.000,00 MT, respectively, for similar activities (selling basic goods). She plans to pay off the loan to have access to future loans with the goal of growing her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy and sell personal care  and other products

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es:
El señor Domingo actualmente vive en casa D. su mama; en elL. vive su esposa sus 2 hijos y su papa el hace tiempo compro un terreno el cual ha ido construyendo poco a poco. D. L. manera en L. que el empezó L. construcción fue con un crédito que le otorgo FVP y actualmente en que esta muy agradecido y satisfecho.
Este será su tercer crédito del señor Domingo y todo esto lo hace por que se preocupa mucho por el patrimonio D. su familia es por ello que esta realizando este proyecto.
texts.en:
Sr. Domingo currently lives in his mother’s house with his wife and their 2 children. His father bought for him a piece of land on which to build a house, but the construction has been moving slowly. A loan from FVP was used to start the construction, and he is very grateful and satisfied.

Sr. Domingo is requesting his third loan. He cares very deeply about leaving an inheritance for his children, which is why he wants to complete this project.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish construction of his house

loans.name: Maida

texts.en:
Maida A.'s main source of income comes from selling a variety of snacks and viands in her community. Maida is married and has four school-age children. They are from the village of Bonbon, Catarman, Camiguin. Maida has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 pesos a month.

In 2009, Maida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Maida is requesting a loan of 4,000 pesos which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Karyma Sameira Group

texts.en:
Karyma is the group lender of Karyma Sameira group. There are five members in this group. Each of them wants to take a loan for expanding her business and they want to request a total loan of 50,000 Afghani.
Karyma and Sameira want to take a loan for their business of bakery. And Mahraw Gull also wants to take a loan for her son’s business of book store. 
Habiba wants take a loan for her business of embroidery. And Razya also wants to take a loan for the business of beading.
They are very thankful to AFS and to Kiva lenders who are able to support all the people in an around Afghanistan.

loans.use: they make larger their business

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 31 years old and married to Pedrito.  They are blessed with a son, who is now four years old and studying in a day care center. They are presently residing at the village of Sillawit, Cauayan City, a rural area.
 
She manages a fish vending business in their village and she earns a weekly net income is PHP800.00.  She wanted to increase her  income for the schooling of their son. She desires to request a loan amount of PHP5,000.00 for her additional working capital and wants to build a productive business. She hopes that KIVA will grant her loan as soon as possible.

loans.use: Additional capital in her fish vending business

loans.name: Madeleide

texts.es: Madeleide es una mujer dinámica y perseverante, vive en el distrito de Yarinacocha región de Ucayali, tiene 41 años, madre de dos hijos de los cuales uno es mayor de edad y apoya en lo que está a su alcance a su mamá, ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes al por menor, tiene su bodega en su casa y también se dedica junto a su esposo a la pesca. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Nuevo Edén” desde hace dos años, donde siempre ha demostrado ser una socia puntual. El primer crédito que recibió fue para invertir en artículos para su bodega, en la actualidad Madeleide necesita un crédito de 2000 soles que será utilizado, una parte para comprar productos para su bodega y otra parte será para  comprar artículos de pesca. La meta de Madeleide es ampliar su bodega y continuar trabajando.
texts.en:
Madeleide is a dynamic and determined woman. She lives in the Yarinacocha district in the Ucayali region. She is 41 years old and the mother of two children, one of them is already an adult and helps her as much as he is able to. She sells groceries from a store setup inside her home. She also works with her husband fishing.
She has been a member of the communal bank “Nuevo Edén” for two years. She has always been on time with her payments. Her first loan was used to buy merchandise for the grocery store.
Madeleide is now requesting a loan for 2000 soles that will be used to buy more merchandise for her grocery store and to buy fishing accessories. Madeleide’s goal is to expand her store and to continue to work hard.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her grocery store and fishing accessories.

loans.name: Namataba Development Group Of Mukono

texts.en:
Agnes M. is 38 years old and the leader of her group in Mukono. She is a widow and cares for her six children with ages ranging from 6 years to 17 years. Additionally, she supports three orphans.  

For five years,  Agnes has participated in the businesses of brick laying and fish selling. Being involved in both industries has allowed her to diversify her interests. She would like to use the loan amount of 300,000 USH to purchase more supplies and tools for brick making. One day, Agnes hopes that she will be able to sponsor all of her children’s educations to the university level.

loans.use: More supplies and tools for brickmaking

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en: D. Hilda is 30 years of age. She has an HM supermarket. She has been in the business for over two years. She is using the loan to purchase a variety of supermarket items such as soap, sugar, sprays, toilet tissue, essentials, and so forth. Her business is located in Kijura central. Her future plan is to expand and open a second branch of her supermarket along Masindi-Hoima road so as to increase sales and profits.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of supermarket items

loans.name: Chhoem

texts.en: Mrs. Chhoem S., 42, is a widow and has four children. One of her children is married and the others are single. One of her daughters works in a garment factory. To earn a living, Chhoem S. plants a rice crop on land in the village. One of Chhoem S.’s daughters needs to get married but she doesn’t money to create a wedding party. Therefore, Chhoem S. looks for a loan in order to pay anything costs of creating a wedding party.

loans.use: To pay anything costs of creating a wedding party

loans.name: Pardaboy

texts.en:
B. Pardaboy is a very loving father who is devoted to the needs of his grandchildren, whom he adores. Pardaboy is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his children, who today are working adults thanks to his example. 

He works raising livestock and every morning leaves home to take his animals to pasture in the surrounding area. His desire is to improve the quality of his animals but in order to do this he must purchase livestock of better breeds, and these animals are very costly. He needs working capital of $800 USD, and at the moment he does not have that much money and he is requesting this loan. Pardaboy hopes that you trust in his hard work and honesty.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing the cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Gwenotwom A Ayugi Margaret Group

texts.en: Margaret A. is 47 years old and a hardworking businesswoman who is representing the group. She is married with seven children all attending school. She deals in produce and is using the loan to purchase produce such as tomatoes, onions, sim-sim (sesame), mukene (silver fish), etc. to sell. She is hoping for changes in her life and business. She is a promising businesswoman whose future hope is to build a good house and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase produce such as tomatoes, onions, sim-sim (sesame), mukene (silver fish), etc. to sell

loans.name: Yeredon Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Yeredon, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 32 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Zagnenabougou, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et  professionnels, elles font le commerce des condiments alimentaires (tomates fraîches, aubergine, gombo séché etc.) et des céréales.                                                                                      
Les femmes du groupe Yeredon  sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, des paquets de condiments et des sacs de céréales.                                                                          
Elles s’approvisionnent en produits sur place et dans les environnants. Elles effectuent leurs ventes sur place et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 22 500F CFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Yeredon group are all married, have an average age of 32 years old, an average of three children and all live in extended traditional families in Zagnenabougou, the sub-prefecture of Fana in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They got to know each other through relatives and through their business, and they trade in condiments (fresh tomatoes, aubergine, dried "gombo" or okra etc..) and cereals. The women of the Yeredon group are on their fourth group loan which will be used to buy packets of condiments and bags of cereals. They get their supplies locally and in the surrounding areas. They sell locally and at surrounding fairs, for cash on a retail basis and on credit, to a customer base made up of women and men. They expect to make an average monthly profit of 22,500 FCFA each, which will be used to cover expenses relating to health, food and school fees; the rest will be reinvested in their business.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cereals and condiments

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Danaya comprend quatre femmes toutes mariées dans des ménages monogames. Elles vivent majoritairement dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec en moyenne 40ans, 5 enfants et habitent le quartier Bougoufiè de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali).
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels les habits, les articles ménagers, la  restauration, la fabrication des jus de boissons etc.
Après quatre prêt tous correctement remboursés, elles sont à leur 5ème  prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 21 pièces de pagne wax et fancy,  un rouleau de bazins riche et moins riche, 2 douzaines de draps brodés, un colis de 200 balais, 200kg de tamarin, 300kg d’oseille de Guinée, 4 sacs de riz et des condiments alimentaires. 
Elles s’approvisionnent du Burkina Faso et au marché de Ségou. La revente des marchandises se fait à domicile, en ambulant dans les quartiers et au marché Château de Ségou à une clientèle mixte. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 36 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour l’achat de la nourriture et des frais de santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The Danaya group is made up of four married women, all of whom live in monogamous families. For the most part they live in large traditional households, are 40 years old, have 5 children and live in the Bougoufiè district of Ségou (the fourth largest administrative region of Mali). This group of women sell various products for a living, such as clothes, household appliances, food products, juices etc. Having already received and successfully repaid four loans, they are seeking their fifth in order to buy 21 pagne wax units (bright West-African cloth), a roll of damask bazin (for tie-dyeing fabric), 2 dozen embroidered sheets, a parcel containing 200 brooms, 200kg of tamarind, 300kg of hibiscus, 4 bags of rice and some condiments. They source their goods from Burkina Faso and from the Ségou market, and sell them from home, through mobile sales around the city's districts, and at the Château de Ségou market. Their customer base is both male and female. They aim to generate an average monthly profit of 36,000 FCFA which will be used to buy food and to pay for their children's healthcare.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing various products

loans.name: Itya

texts.en:
Itya C. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes, onions and cooking oil, and is requesting a loan to stock dried fish to sell. Itya is 42 years old and is married to a teacher. She has 5 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a pharmacy.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Damas Bibosi Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Damas Bibosi” esta representado por el señora Loreto y conformado por 10 miembros en las cuales 9 son mujeres y 1 son varones, todos los socios van cumpliendo un ciclo demostrando un excelente desempeño ya que son socios muy unidos, responsables y solidarios; algunas decidieron descansar otras en cambio desean continuar y para esto invitaron a nuevas integrantes. La señora Loreto se dedica a la venta de comida en una pensión en su domicilio ayudado por su esposo quien se dedica a servir los platos que ella cocina, la pensión mantiene a la pareja y a sus dos hijos, el destino del financiamiento es la compra de mesas y sillas, insumos para incrementar las ventas y mejorar mas las ganancias del negocio. El resto del grupo se dedica a la venta de pollos, asados, pan, comida rápida, cosméticos y ala atención en peluquerías y veterinarias. Dentro del ámbito en el que se desenvuelven existe mucha competencia pero gracias a su experiencia y a la calidad de sus productos los socios saben salir adelante ya que de ello depende el sustento de sus familias. El destino será utilizado pora la compa de mercadería, insumos, materiales y herramientas de trabajo para agilizar más su labor y ofertar un producto mas atractivo para el mercado competitivo. La socias van cumpliendo un ciclo mas dentro de la institución por lo que cuentan con una experiencia en créditos solidarios amplia y útil para demostrar confianza en este grupo.
texts.en:
Loreto represents the Damas Bibosi Communal Bank. It is comprised of ten members. There are nine women and one man. All of the members are completing a cycle in which they are demonstrating excellent performance. They are very united, responsible, and supportive members. Some of them decided to rest, and others want to continue. To do this they invited new members. Loreto sells food in a boarding house in her home. Her husband helps her serve the dishes that she cooks. The boarding house supports the pair and their two children. The loan is to buy tables, chairs, and supplies to increase their sales and improve the income from the business. The rest of the group sells chickens, grilled food, bread, fast food, or cosmetics. Some work in hair salons or provide veterinary services. There is a lot of competition within the areas that they work. But, thanks to their experience and the quality of their products, the members know how to get ahead. Supporting their families depends upon it. The loan is to buy merchandise, supplies, materials, and work tools to speed up their work and offer a more attractive product in the competitive market. The members are completing one more cycle with the institution. They have wide and useful experience with communal loans. This shows that the group is trustworthy.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James has been planting wheat for commercial purposes in Naivasha town for the past 10 years. Wheat is profitable as there is a ready market. The government buys directly from farmers. He is 27 years old, married to Susan L., and they have 2 children.

James was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the cash to buy pesticide for his current crop in the field and also to plant more wheat.  

He plans to buy a tractor in the future, which he will not only use in his farm but he will also hire it out to receive additional income.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and to plant more wheat.

loans.name: Faida Group

texts.fr:
Kavugho B. est conseillère du groupe de crédit  Faida, à l’ extrême, elle lève sa main sur la photo, âgée de 42 ans, mariée, mère de 7 enfants qui étudient. Son mari est portier de la résidence d’un Pasteur de l’église baptiste au Centre d’Afrique (CBCA). Kavugho B. est entrepreneur,vendeuse de friperie au marché central de Virunga. Pour accroitre ses revenus, Madame Kavugho B.  confectionne également les nappes, elle vend des services culinaires. Il ya 8 ans qu’elle vend les friperies. Elle a commence son activité avec son fonds propre, reçu de son beau frère, et une autre partie de bénéfice des petites commissions de vente objets de son voisin. Son capital initial était de 10$. 
Avec  le crédit  de  l’IMF Hekima, elle compte acheter 1 ballon de friperie de chemises, 1/2 ballon des pentalons.
Le grand défi de Kavugho B. est que parfois, dans un ballon de friperie, elle retrouve des habits complètement usés et parfois déchirés. Dans un ballon de friperie, il y a parfois de futilité qu’on n’achète pas. C’est qui constitue une perte pour elle. Madame Kavugho B. souhaite atteindre un conteneur des ballons de friperie et devenir une grossiste de la ville. Cela serait faisable avec un capital de 5000$ qu’elle ambitionne dans les jours à venir. Pour sa famille, elle compte faire grandir ses enfants et le voir terminer tous les études dans les meilleures conditions.
Madame Kavugho B. remercie l’IMF Hekima pour  les crédits permanents qu’elle reçoit sans aucune garantie matérielle car grâce à ces crédits, elle parvient à  se prendre en charge et subvenir aux enfants. 
Ce groupe Faida est  composé de 22 membres femmes.
texts.en:
Kavugho B. is the president of the borrowing group Faida. She is standing on the far left and raising her hand in the photo. She is 42, married and the mother of seven children who are presently attending school. Her husband is the doorman at the residence of a Baptist church pastor at the Africa Center (CBCA). Kavugho B. sells used clothing at the central market of Virunga. To increase her income, Mrs. Kavugho B. also makes tablecloths and sells cooking sets. She has been selling used clothing for 8 years. She began her business with her own funds, which she had received from her brother-in-law, and also with money earned selling small items for her neighbor. Her initial working capital amounted to US$ 10. With the MFI Hekima loan, she is intending to buy one bale of used shirts and 1/2 bale of used pants. Her greatest challenge is that sometimes in a bale of used clothing, she finds items that are completely worn out and sometimes torn. In a bale of used clothing, there are sometimes useless items that no one will buy. This constitutes a loss for her. Mrs. Kavugho B. hopes to manage to get a container of bales of used clothing and become a wholesaler in her town. This would be possible with a loan of US$ 5000 which she hopes to obtain one of these days. As for her family, she intends to raise her children so as to see them finish their studies under the best possible conditions. Mrs. Kavugho B. thanks Hekima for the continued loans that she receives without any collateral, for it is due to these loans that she is able to support herself and her children. This Faida group consists of 22 members.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 1 bale of used shirts and 1/2 bale of used pants, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase the seeds of potatoes and onions

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas R. is from the village of Kiwalan, Iligan City. She is 46 years old. Felicitas is married. To make a living, Felicitas owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling bananas in the local community. Felicitas has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Felicitas joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felicitas has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Felicitas is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Felicitas from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia, de 39 años, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de su pareja Jeremías (36) y su último hijo de  3 que tiene, pues los dos mayores son de su primer compromiso y laboran de manera independiente, mientras el último hijo es de su pareja actual.Desde hace 3 años, dedica la mayor parte del día a sus labores agrícolas en sus terrenos propios, junto a su esposo, y todo su sacrificio se ve recompensado cuando comercializa los productos oriundos de la zona (café, frutas cítricas y plátanos). En temporadas de cosecha, recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, a quienes le paga 20 soles por día, y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es retirar las malezas de sus tierras, para que cada fruto se desarrolle libremente, sin embargo, le incomoda trasladar sus cosechas hacía su localidad para encajonarlas y embarcarlas a los mercados de la ciudad. Como su oficio es rentable, quiere adquirir más terrenos productivos y plantar mayor  cantidad de frutos, asimismo, desea instalar un negocio de venta de comestibles, en un espacio de su vivienda, por lo que tiene planeado terminar de construirla en corto tiempo.Es  la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y como ya conoce la metodología de trabajo de su banco comunal, está feliz de continuar perteneciendo a este grupo, pues los integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios.Delia tiene planeado invertir una parte del dinero solicitado en la compra de  3 bolsas de abono y con el resto quiere comprar decenas de ladrillos que le permitirán terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Delia is 39 years old and lives in her own house, along with her partner, Jeremías (36), and the youngest of her three children. Her two older children are from her first relationship and they now live independently. Her youngest son is from her current relationship. For three years, she has dedicated the greater part of her day to agricultural work, which she and her partner perform on the lands she owns. All of her sacrifices are rewarded when she sells her products, which are all native to the zone (coffee, citrus fruits, and bananas). During harvest time, she gets help from her sons, who she pays 20 soles per day. Delia's favorite part of her job is weeding her lands so that each fruit can develop freely. However, it is uncomfortable for her to transport the crops to her house to box them and to ship them to the markets in the city. As her work is profitable, she would like to acquire more land and to plant more fruits. She would also like to set up a small grocery store in her house. She plans to finish building this soon. This is the second time that she has taken out a loan through Microfinanzas Prisma. Since she is familiar with how her communal bank works, she is happy to continue working with this group, whose members are very responsible and united. Delia plans to invest part of the money she's requesting to buy three bags of fertilizer, and with the rest, she will buy tens of bricks that will allow her to finish constructing her house.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her crops and bricks to finish constructing her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more used clothing to sell

loans.name: Gulzat's Group

texts.en: Gulzat A. is the leader of the group. She is 32 and married. She has two daughters and two sons. The older son and the older daughter are at school, but the other children are not yet. Gulzat's husband is the driver of an excavating machine and he earns 12000 soms per month. Three years ago with that money, Gulzat purchased livestock and then resold the livestock at a higher price. She made 15000 soms and since that moment, she has been breeding livestock. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase sheep for breeding. Gulzat is pregnant and in the near future they will have another child, so they are planning to start building a new house. Eliza T., 24, is married. She has two children, both of them are preschool age (under 7). Two years ago, with the initial investment of 30000 soms, Eliza and her husband started to breed livestock. Selling some livestock after fattening, they make 5000 soms per month. That profit made it possible for them to improve their living conditions and purchase a new fridge. With money received from the loan, Eliza wants to purchase sheep in order to increase the number of livestock they have. In the future, she is planning to start repairing her house. Ularkan J. is the treasurer of the group. She is 55 and a widow. She has raised nine children; two of them are at school and live with Ularkan. Two years ago, with the initial investment of 10000 soms, Ularkan started to purchase fruits and vegetables in the village and then resell them at the market at a higher price. In this way, she makes 10000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase a variety of fruits and vegetables in order to increase the turnover of her business. Gulmira T., 35, is married. She has two daughters and two sons. The older daughter and the older son are at school and the other children are not yet. Gulmira is engaged in cattle breeding; she resells cattle after fattening at a higher price. In this way, she makes 10000 soms per month. Her husband works as a driver, and when he is free, he helps his wife with her activity. Gulmira applied for the loan because she needs money to finish building her house. In the future, she wants to build a shop and start selling convenience goods. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase sheep for breeding

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
Matilda O. is married and has a child. Her husband is a driver. She has not received any form of education.

Matilda sells secondhand clothes and slippers at Takoradi and uses her income to pay school fees and utility bills as a way of supporting her husband. She will use the loan to purchase more slippers for sale.

Matilda plans to plow back the new profits from her expanded business.

loans.use: To purchase more slippers to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: María De Los Ángeles

texts.es: María de Los Ángeles R. C. de 53 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Jiquilisco, en el departamento de Usulután. Ella es soltera, la cual nunca tuvo hijos, por lo que vive sola en su casa propia. María posee un chalet en el cual comercializa desayunos y almuerzos, así mismo golosinas, jugos, bebidas calientes, comidas típicas como pupusas y tamales y otros productos más. La ubicación del negocio es muy buena ya que se encuentra rodeada de varios negocios y empresas gubernamentales, por lo que a diario hay una gran cantidad de personas que llegan a su chalet a comer, situación la cual María desea aprovechar al máximo, es por esto que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima para la elaboración de los alimentos y así mismo comprar más bebidas y golosinas, de tal forma que atienda a más personas y así mismo que perciba mayores ganancias.
texts.en: María de Los Ángeles R. C. is 53 years old and resides in the town of Jiquilisco in the Department of Usulután. She is single and never had children, so she lives in her own home by herself. María has an open-air café where she sells breakfast and lunch. She also offers sweets, juices, hot beverages, traditional foods such as pupusas and tamales, and other dishes. Her business is situated in a good location since it is surrounded by different businesses and government offices. A large number of people come to her café every day to eat, a situation of which Maria wants to take full advantage. Therefore, she is requesting a loan so that she can buy a large quantity of ingredients for preparing her dishes as well as acquire more beverages and sweets. This will allow her to serve more people and generate better earnings as a result.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for preparing her dishes, beverages, and sweets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase milk products and jewelry.

loans.name: 5 De Febrero Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama “ 5 DE FEBRERO”, se encuentra ubicado en el Estado de México, está integrado por 13 clientas, en él se encuentra la señora YADIRA H.  M. de 30 de años de edad, nos platica que estudio una carrera comercial como técnico auxiliar contable, su esposo se llama German de Jesus es Albañil desde hace 5 años aproximadamente, ingreso que les ayudaba a mantener a sus pequeños hijos de 8 y 3 años de edad, hasta que la señora decidió empezar a trabajar, actualmente tiene un negocio de alfarería, con el crédito quiere comprar materia prima para invertir en su negocio de venta de alfarería, negocio que por tradición ha sido el sustento de muchos de sus familiares, su intención es obtener una mayor ganancia, la clienta nos comenta que antes realizaba diferentes actividades como lo es la venta de juguetes y bisutería. La ilusión que siempre ha tenido la señora Yadira es que sus pequeños hijos puedan tener acceso a la educación universitaria, así mismo ella desea continuar estudiando y ser una mejor mujer día con día.
texts.en:
The February 5th Group is located in the State of México and consists of thirteen members. One of them is Sra. Yadira H. M., age 30. She indicates that she studied for a business degree in order to become an assistant accountant. Her husband, German de Jesus, has worked as a mason for approximately five years. His income helped support their young children, ages 8 and 3, until she decided to start working.

Yadira currently has a pottery business and will use her loan to buy materials so that she can continue selling her wares. This type of business is a family tradition among many of her relatives as a means of supporting themselves. She intends to generate more income. Yadira says that prior this business, she engaged in different activities such as selling toys and trinkets. Her vision has always been to provide her young children with the opportunity to access a university education. She also wants to continue her studies and become a better woman with each passing day.

loans.use: Operating capital to acquire materials for a pottery business

loans.name: Máximo Rafael

texts.es: Máximo Rafael tiene 44 años, su actividad es la carpintería. Hace más de 20 años que tiene este negocio. Inicio este negocio cuando tenía 17 años, el aprendió porque anteriormente se iba a un taller a aprender de este medio de vida, a la edad de 19 años empezó a realizar sus primeros muebles con ayuda de ciertos ayudantes que tenia. Después de un tiempo decidió que su profesión iba a ser la carpintería. En la actualidad trabaja todos los días y algunas veces que tiene pedidos por sus clientes no tiene horario fijo. Hace puertas, sillas, juegos de salas, comedor escritorio, mesas.  Para seguir con su negocio él quiere comprar con el préstamo pintura, laca, diluyentes para pinta muebles que tiene hechos. En el futuro quiere seguir trabajando y obtener más clientes.
texts.en:
Máximo Rafael is 44 years old and has been a carpenter for more than 20 years. He started working at a carpentry workshop when he was 17 years old. There he learned the trade that would become his livelihood. At the age of 19, Máximo began making his first pieces of furniture with the help of a few assistants. Over time, he decided that carpentry would be his full-time profession.

He currently works every day. Sometimes he will receive orders from his customers, but he does not work on a fixed schedule. Máximo makes doors, chairs, game tables, dining sets, desks, and tables. He wants to use the loan to buy paint, lacquer, and thinners to use on the pieces that he makes so that he can continue his business. In the future, he wants to continue working and attract more customers.

loans.use: Purchase paint, lacquer, and thinners

loans.name: Betty Del Carmen

texts.es: Betty M. es una mujer que vive en Galapa, municipio a 15 minutos de Barranquilla,  tiene 37 años y un hijo menor , con el que sueña verlo crecer en bienestar y con un futuro exitoso. Ella  tiene en su casa una miscelánea y se dedica a la venta de mercancía variada,  es decir: todo lo relacionado con vestidos, calzado, variedades en lencería  y  ropa intima, negocio que inició hace 5 años  vendiendo camisetas y jeans,  pero gradualmente fue agregando muchos artículos de acuerdo a las necesidades de sus clientes,  y hoy lo ha convertido en una pequeña miscelánea,  pues  tiene una vitrina donde exhibe su mercancía,  especialmente en lo relacionado con la lencería.  Como en  el mes de Diciembre se aumentan  las solicitudes de mercancías por parte de sus clientes,  especialmente con lo que tiene que ver con detalles  y lencería navideña, está solicitando su segundo financiamiento a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  ese es justamente el motivo de su Credikiva, porque quiere surtir su negocio con detalles para regalos,  que ella misma empaca para impactar a sus clientes, como  cosméticos, lencería, adornos y también  comprará papelería, especialmente navideña. Con el financiamiento anterior logró aumentar su capital de trabajo ligeramente y surtir mas apropiadamente su negocio; como Betty planea un crecimiento gradual,  reinvertirá  sus utilidades e inyectara  cada crédito que consiga con la Fundación  a su capital de trabajo,  ella sabe que así sus utilidades se incrementarán , y  en un futuro logrará  su  sueño de tener un gran almacén,  con nuevas vitrinas,  donde sus clientes encuentren lo que necesiten y ella pueda rotar su mercancia rápidamente, para conseguir mayores utilidades.
texts.en:
Betty M. lives in Galapa, a town 15 minutes away from Barranquilla.  She is 37 years old and has a young son who she hopes will grow up in a healthy environment and have a successful future.  

She has a gift shop in her house and sells a variety of goods including dresses, footwear, lingerie and underwear.  She began her business five years ago selling t-shirts and jeans, but gradually added more articles depending on her customers' needs. She now has a small gift shop and a showcase where she exhibits her goods, especially everything related to lingerie. 

Since December is the month when there is more customer demand for her goods, especially those related to Christmas items and lingerie, she is requesting her second loan from the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo.  She wants to use her Credikiva to supply her business with gifts that she wraps to attract customers, such as cosmetics, lingerie, ornaments.  And she plans to purchase gift wrap, especially Christmas paper.

With her previous loan she was able to increase her working capital slightly and stock her business somewhat better.  Betty plans to grow gradually, reinvesting her profits and injecting each loan from the Fundacion into her working capital.  She knows this is the way to increase profits and be able to achieve her dream of owning in the future a large department store, with new showcases where her customers can find all they need and she can rotate inventory to increase sales and profits.

loans.use: To supply her business with gift items that she wraps to attract customers, i.e. cosmetics, lingerie, ornaments; and also purchase wrapping paper, especially for Christmas.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.fr: Pauline N. est commerçante.  Elle a 43 ans, elle est veuve, et elle a 8 enfants entre 8 ans et 23 ans.  Elle a une éducation primaire, et tous ses enfants vont à l’école.  Elle était née à Congo (DRC), mais maintenant elle habite à Nyabugogo à Rwanda.  Elle va utiliser son prêt pour acheter 50 sacs de pommes de terre.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’épargner, et prendre beaucoup de prêts pour être indépendante chez elle.  Elle voudrait avoir un dépôt de pommes de terre, et aussi ajouter les bananes dans son commerce.  Pour sa famille, elle voudrait acheter une maison d’habitation.
texts.en: Pauline N. is a merchant. She is 43 years old, a widow, and the mother of eight, ranging from 8 to 23 years of age.. She has finished primary school, and all her children study. She was born in Congo (Democratic Republic of Congo), but now she lives in Nyabugogo in Rwanda. She is going to use her loan to purchase 50 bags of potatoes. Her strategy for growing her business is to save money and to keep taking out loans in order to be self-sufficient. She would like to have a warehouse for potatoes, and also to add bananas to her inventory  For her family, she would like to buy a house to live in.

loans.use: Purchasing 50 bags of potatoes

loans.name: Bayarsaihan

texts.en:
Bayarsaihan S. is 44 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a house and fenced yard in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His two children both attend a local secondary school. 

Bayarsaihan operates a women's clothing and lingerie retail business from a rented stall at a local clothing market. He sells a variety of different clothing items and underwear. His wide product selection attracts many customers. He started his women's clothing business in 2004 and has since built a stable and successful operation. He makes his purchases of clothing twice in a month in Erlian, a border city in China. Bayarsaihan says, "All I want is to pay off my house-leasing loan and I plan to start saving money for the future education of my children." 

Bayarsaihan is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to import more clothing items from China to sell at his stall in the market.

loans.use: To import women's clothing items from China.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose  solicito 400 $us, se dedica  al transporte de pasajeros a nivel ciudad como chofer asalariado. Jose vive en la zona de Achachicala de la ciudad de La Paz. Está casado.
El crédito lo destinara en la adquisición de repuestos para su movilidad para su mejor desempeño en su trabajo. Es  el segundo crédito en impro y el primero vía Kiva.
texts.en: Jose is requesting a loan for $400 USD.  He provides passenger transport services in his city as a salaried driver.  He is married and lives in the Achachicala district of the city of La Paz.  He will use his loan to buy spare parts for his vehicle so that he can better carry out his work.  This is José's second loan with Impro and his first loan through Kiva.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his passenger transport vehicle

loans.name: Aris Setya Wiguna Group

texts.en:
I Putu R. as the leader of Aris Setya Wiguna, and he successfully leads the group very well. He was assigned to find a job carving wood for members of the group, divide the work and provide salaries appropriate to the work undertaken by its members. For this loan, members plan to buy the raw materials of wood, sand and cement.
The financial advantage gained from every job Putu gets is used for their children's school fees. For everyday needs, Putu is assisted by his wife who has a stall business. Every month I Putu R. spends on electricity costs for Rp.70.000 and meal costs amounted to Rp. 300,000.

loans.use: purchasing wood, sand and cement for purposes of business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 34-year-old married man living with his wife and two children who are attending school. He is from Lebanon. He has owned an agricultural tools and equipment shop since 2000. With his business income, he is able to cover his family expenses. He obtained his first Kiva loan and he was a very good client with punctual payments. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to improve his business by increasing his inventory. He is confident that his work will continue to be successful in the coming year.

loans.use: to improve his business

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Ny S. is 27 years old.  She currently resides in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She is married to 26-year-old Chhear Kimchoeurn, who is a sewing worker. The couple is blessed with a young child, who is not yet enrolled in school. 

To earn a living, Ny S. sells grilled beef to passersby in the village.  She will be using this loan as capital for a new business -- raising fish in the pond in front of her house. From this, she will be able to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase fish to raise

loans.name: Dorithy

texts.en:
For the past five years, Dorithy A. has been selling general provisions, cooked food, and drinks at Nkroful near Takoradi.  She is married and has two children. Her husband is a spare parts dealer.  She is responsible for the payment of household expenses. 

Her loan will be used to buy additional provisions, drinks and other items to serve her increasing numbers of customers.  She plans to save up any extra profits she earns.

loans.use: to buy additional provisions and drinks

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar M. is from the village of Bolinao. He is 61 years old. Oscar is married and has three adult children. Oscar owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Oscar has been engaged in his business for over 13 years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2008, Oscar joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to do business. Oscar has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand his product offerings. Oscar is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Oscar from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisher-folk and small entrepreneurs. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Work For Yourself Group

texts.en:
Henry B. T. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Henry was born in Masingbi village in northern Sierra Leone. He is married and has 4 children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Henry sells used clothes and has been doing this business for many years.

With the help of this loan, Henry and his group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. Henry will use his share of the loan (SLL 1,000,000) to buy bales of used clothes to add to his business.

loans.use: Buys used clothing to resell

loans.name: Houy

texts.en:
Houy S., 51, resides in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia, an area known as one of the largest rice-producing regions in Cambodia. S. is a housewife, while her husband is a construction worker who earns an income of USD 4 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 20 on food and USD 50 on the other necessary expenses.

S. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a new motorbike for her children to commute to school and work. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for the children to commute to work and study.

loans.name: Merilyn

texts.en:
Merilyn V. is from the village of Tinaclaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old. Merilyn is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Merilyn owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Merilyn has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Merilyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merilyn is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional grocery items for sale. This will be the first loan taken out by Merilyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase  additional grocery items for sale.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: Ricardo, de 36 años, es un hombre muy amable y sencillo, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Arminda de 27 años y sus 2 queridas hijas Briyit de 7 y Yunzú de 4 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo al que Ricardo se dedica es la panadería, su labor comienza muy temprano, aproximadamente a las 4 y 30 de la mañana, listo para amasar la masa y hacer los panes que disfrutan los moradores del centro de la ciudad de Lima. Él es un panadero muy hábil y es que desde muy pequeño aprendió este oficio de su padre. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es hacer pan y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 6 años en este trabajo y considera que lo más difícil es tener que levantarse todos los días temprano, ya que para él no existen fines de semana, ni feriados. En adelante, anhela poner una tienda donde pueda vender el mismo el pan que hornea. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP y no quiere dejar de pagar por falta de dinero, así que esta dispuesto a ahorrar día a día para poder pagarlo, él es muy responsable y respetuoso. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará nuevas latas y estantes para los panes, además de llevar a arreglar su horno.
texts.en:
Ricardo, age 36, is a friendly and modest man. He lives in his own home with his wife Arminda, age 27, and their two beloved daughters, Briyit and Yunzú (ages 7 and 4 respectively), for whom he wants to provide a better quality of life. Ricardo has a bakery and begins his work very early at approximately 4:30am. His duties include kneading the dough and preparing the bread that is enjoyed by the residents of central Lima. Ricardo is a talented baker and learned his trade as a young man from his father. What he enjoys most about his work is making the bread and preparing it with great care. He has been in this business for six years and considers the most difficult part to be waking up early every day since he also works on weekends and holidays. In the future, he hopes to open a store where he can sell his baked goods.

This is his third loan with MFP. Ricardo does not want to miss any of his payments, so he is willing save each day so that he can meet his obligations. He is very responsible and respectful. The loan of 1500 PEN that he requested will be used to buy new baking pans and shelves for displaying the bread. He also needs to repair his oven.

loans.use: to purchase baking pans and shelving for displaying bread and to pay for repairs to his oven.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 53 years old and has nine children. She is married and has one child who is still in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Thelma requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Thelma has been raising pigs for seven years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Thelma would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mumen

texts.en:
Mumen is getting married this summer and in order to have his wedding on time he needs to finish house preparations.  Mumen is an employee in a development NGO though his moderate salary didn't help him cover all expenses in a timely manner.

Mumen, who is photographed in FATEN's branch office, took out a loan from FATEN to pay for wash bowls and sink installation. Mumen is known for his good reputation and hard work.

loans.use: to finish the new apartment (installing wash bowls, sinks, etc.) before his wedding date.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.pt:
Natural de Maputo, Provincia de Maputo ao sul de Mocambique viuva mãe 4 filhos,de idades entre 12 anos a 27 anos de idade. Fez 7a classe e parou por falta de condiçoes financeiras. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta as irmas que vivem com ela.   
Nunca saiu de Maputo , e comerciante ha mais de 25 anos onde consegue um rendimento de 10.000.00mt  por mes que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca fez emprestimos noutros bancos.
