Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de amigas que tambem são   clientes desta instituiçao e este e o seu primeiro emprestimo no valor de 12.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar mercadoria (refrescos, cigarros, cervejas, sumo e outros) para aumentar a mercadoria no seu estabelecimento.
Esta confiante que vai pagar sem dificuldades e um dos seus sonhos e ampliar o seu negocio, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos.
texts.en:
Originally from the city of Maputo, in the southern Mozambican province of Maputo, Elisa is a widowed mother of 4 children, aged between 12 and 27 years old. She attended school up to the 7th Grade then stopped going owing to her financial situation. She lives in her own home with her children and also supports her sisters, who live with her.
She has never left Maputo. She has been running a business for 25 years from which she earns 10,000MZN each month. She uses this money for household expenses and puts some away as savings in her bank account.
She has never borrowed money from other banks. She heard about Hluvuku through some friends, who are also Hluvuku clients. This is her first loan for 12,000MZN and she intends to use this to buy goods, such as refreshments, cigarettes, beers, juices and other items, in order to increase her business stock.
She is confident of easily meeting the repayments and one of her dreams is to expand her business. She intends to apply for further loans to achieve this aim.

loans.use: to buy stock (refreshments, cigarettes, beers, juices and other items).

loans.name: Leslie

texts.en:
Leslie is married and has not been blessed with an offspring.  She is 27 years old and lives in Western Poblacion, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental: Philippines.

Leslie has a retail business to earn a living.  She sells cosmetics and beauty products in the local community.  She sells, perfume, cologne, make-up and other body make overs.  She has run her business for over five years now.  She earns PHP 3,000.00 a month from this work. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000.00 to purchase cosmetics and beauty products to sell.  Leslie has been member of GDMPC for one year.  In the future, Lislie hopes to gain more income and have her own cosmetics boutique in the town.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Las Flores De San Antonio Group

texts.es:
Dominga es participante activa de la Alcancía Comunal “LAS FLORES DE SAN ANTONIO” la cual tiene el cargo de tesorera y está conformada por 10 socios. 
Dominga tiene 59 años de edad es casada  tiene 03 hijos independientes, ella se dedica a la venta de frituras de salchipapas, alita de pollo, hamburguesas y chaufa la cual la elabora con la ayuda de unas de sus hijas, también nos cuenta que tiene un negocio de cabinas de internet en su vivienda actualmente cuenta con 4 computadoras,  a su edad Dominga se siente con todas las fuerzas de seguir trabajando, gracias a su arduo esfuerzo a podido educar a sus hijos y ayudado a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. El deseo de Dominga es de terminar de construir su vivienda, y poner su restaurante donde pueda vender diversos platos de comida. Con el préstamo solicitado Domingo va implementar su negocio de cabinas de internet comprando una computadora más. La Alcancía Comunal “LAS FLORES DE SAN ANTONIO” están muy contentos  y agradecen a los prestamistas KIVA.La señora Ana no pudo estar presente el día del desembolso por motivo de trabajo.
texts.en:
Dominga is an active member of the “Las Flores de San Antonio” communal bank.  It has ten members and she’s the bank Treasurer.

Dominga is 59 years old, married and has three independent children.  She sells “salchipapas” (fried potatoes with fried sausages), chicken wings, hamburgers and “chaufa” (a Chinese-style fried rice with meat and vegetables) that she makes with help from one of her daughters.  She also tells us that she has an Internet access business at home that currently has four computers.

At her age, Dominga still feels perfectly strong to continue working.  Thanks to her hard work she’s been able to provide education for her children and help her husband cover household expenses.  Dominga hopes to finish building her house and set up her restaurant where she can sell a variety of dishes.

Dominga will use the requested loan to equip her Internet access business buying an additional computer.

The “Flores de San Antonio” communal bank’s members are very happy and thank Kiva lenders.

Because of work commitments, Ana was unable to be present on disbursement day.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer is a 35-year-old man. He is married and has four sons and four daughters. He lives in Ya'bad village near Jenin city in Palestine. Amer is a Palestinian National Authority employee who gets a decent salary. Amer and his wife work in the project they have, which is farming in greenhouses, but this project is suffering from the lack of supplies that are necessary. Amer wants to take a loan of $2,000 from FATEN, because the decent salary he gets isn't enough to pay in cash.

When Amer gets FATEN's loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will purchase all necessary supplies and use them to improve his project and increase the productivity of his greenhouse agriculture. Amer is photographed inside the greenhouse.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for his grreenhouses

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon, commonly called "Cora" in her village, is 48 years old. She chose to be single because she wants to take care of her parents who are now old and incapable. Due to financial difficulty, Cora didn't continue her secondary education.

Cora manages a general store in her village to earn income and satisfy the family's needs. She has been in this business for almost 18 years, earning a net profit of only PHP 7,000 a month. Cora aims to improve her general store in order to increase her income to satisfy the family's daily basic needs and save for future emergencies. Due to inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy additional stock of mineral water, soft drinks, breads, detergents, junk food, candies, canned goods and beverages to sell in the village. She hopes that the loan will help a lot to make her business grow.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her store

loans.name: Ma- Kula

texts.en:
Ma-Kula  lives in Bardnersville. She’s married and has five children between 14 and 37 years old. Two live at home and attend school, while three live on their own. Her husband is a businessman.

For the past twenty years she has been selling oil, rice, peppers, charcoal and onions, but during the rainy season her sales are very low. She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, onions, peppers, rice,  and charcoal for her business. She plans  to build her children's house and build her shop  in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, onions, peppers, and rice.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last five years.  She is 57 years old, married to Isaac, and they have five children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her third loan.  She repaid both her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Miriam hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is 27 years old and a single lady. She supports her nephew who is nine years old.

She has a boutique that she has been running for the past 10 years. Carolyne has applied for a loan that she intends to use to buy more clothing to add to her stock.

She hopes to buy a piece of land in the future and to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 46-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and four children, two of whom are still attending school. In 1991, he invested in a small piece of land and transformed it into a parking lot. Today, he is requesting to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to perform needed maintenance on the parking lot and to install water canals to avoid facing water flooding during the winter season. This will be his third Kiva loan.

loans.use: to perform needed maintenance on the parking lot and install water canals.

loans.name: Volodya

texts.ru:
С помощью кредита от КИВА Володя в прошлом году смог построить несколько небольших теплиц, его прибыль составила 100 000 гривен (до этого было 80 000 гривен). Володе очень помог кредит от КИВА, поэтому он обратился за финансовой помощью сюда вновь. В этот раз Володя берет кредит на постройку арочной теплицы, так как те, которые у него есть на данный момент - из дуг и они не очень надежные.    
За это время второй сын пришел из армии, устроился на работу, помогает семье. У Володи большая семья, шестеро детей и финансовая стабильность для них крайне важна.
texts.en: With the help of a loan from KIVA last year, Volodia built several medium-size greenhouses. His profit was 100,000 UAH (previously, it was 80,000 UAH). The loan helped Volodya significantly, and so he is once again turning to KIVA for financial help. This time, Volodya is applying for a loan to construct arched greenhouses, because his current greenhouses are not very stable. Since his first loan, his second son has returned from the army, has found a job, and is helping the family. Volodya has a large family - six children - and financial stability is very important for them.

loans.use: to build arched greenhouses

loans.name: Emiliza

texts.en: Emiliza is a married woman with four children. Emiliza is 33 years old, and resides in Taguitic, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte, Philippines. Emiliza owns and operates a business venture, selling seafood products including crabs and shrimp in the local community to earn a living. She's been in this business for six years. Each month, she earns PHP 6,000.00 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000.00 to have addtional capital for crab fattening. Emiliza is been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Emiliza wants to build house, and to finish the education of her children.

loans.use: to have addtional capital for crab fattening.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Maria Del Carmen tiene el negocio de decoraciones y colocación de uñas de acrílico. Solicita un préstamo para la compra de material e invertir en compra de ropa de invierno nueva para vender.
Tiene cuatro años dedicándose a esta actividad, y con las ganancias que obtiene planea pagar el crédito, ya que su esposo se encarga de los gastos familiares. 
El negocio esta ubicado en su propio domicilio y el cual renta y desean mas adelante obtener su propio patrimonio.
texts.en: María Del Carmen has a decorations and acrylic nails business.  She requests a loan to buy supplies and to buy new winter clothes to sell.  She’s been in this business four years and plans to use profits to repay the loan since her husband will see to family expenses.  The business is located in her home which she rents and later on they’d like to buy their own asset.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her acrylic nail business.

loans.name: Emma

texts.es:
La Sra. Emma pertenece al Banco Comunal “Consuelo”,  del Distrito de San Pablo, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Tiene 47 años, es conviviente y tiene 03 hijos, los dos mayores son independientes y el menor de 15 años está a su cargo.

A partir de los 16 años empezó a trabajar y de esa manera buscó apoyar económicamente en casa, esto le permitió contar con independencia económica, a los pocos años se fue a vivir con su pareja, en ese entonces se dedicaban a la agricultura. Años después se mudaron a una casa alquilada, luego de algunos años la compraron, el dueño de dicha casa tenía una bodega que también les traspasó, su esposo le ayudó a establecerla y mejorarla.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,700.00 comprará productos para implementar su negocio como: como golosinas, bebidas gaseosas, sacos de arroz y azúcar, cajas de leche, aceites en litros, carnes, verduras, frutas, menestras, casilleros de huevos, pan, conservas  y otros.
La Sra. Emma  es una mujer creativa y emprendedora,  su sueño es contar con un negocio mucho más grande, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindar la oportunidad de participar en las sesiones educativas, pues a través de ellas aprende como administrar su dinero.
texts.en: Emma is a member of the communal lender Consuelo,  in San Pablo, Bellavista, San Martín. She is 47, lives with a partner and has three children; tow live independently and she cares for the youngest, who is 15.  Emma has worked since age 16 to support her household, and this has given her economic independence, and she also lived with her partner so they could grow crops.  Later, they moved to a rented house, which they bought some time afterwards.  This house had a small store built-in, and her husband and her began to run and improve it.  With this loan of S/. 1,700.00 she will buy items for the store such as: candy, soft drinks, rice, sugar, boxes of milk, cooking oil, meat, vegetables, fruit, egg cartons, bread, jelly and others.  Emma  is a creative and resourceful woman.  Her dream is to have a much larger business.  She is grateful for the assistance of the group Movimiento Manuela Ramos for their training on financial management.

loans.use: to buy candy, soft drinks, rice, sugar, boxes of milk, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Makale Farmers Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Makale Farmers Group in Western Kenya! Loice is the facilitator of the Makale Farmers group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Loice takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Loice had a good maize yield harvesting four bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Loice was only able to harvest one bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Loice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Loice will educate her children and save for the future.

In 2012, the members of Makale Farmers group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Loice with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Tuamke - Mbangamao Group

texts.en:
Amos is a 45-year-old father of six children, with three of his children attending secondary education. He is doing well in farming activities, producing coffee, maize and beans for over five years. He is facing a lack of fertilizers, as well as crop diseases for his growing crops. 

Amos is seeking financial support to pay for fertilizers and insecticides. Also he is working hard to increase his scale of production from 11 to 23 acres in five years.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Juan Cancio

texts.es:
Juan Cancio tiene 42 años edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos, él nació en el distrito de Maras de la provincia de Urubamba y vive en el poblado de Cotowincho de la provincia de Urubamba, él es carpintero metálico y tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio donde fabrica sillas de metal, mesas de metal y otro cosas. En esta oportunidad Juan Cancio requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como por ejemplo fierro, soldadura, pintura, lijar y otras cosas más. 

Juan Cancio es integrante del banco comunal “Nueva Vision de Rumichaca”. Este  grupo está conformado con 19 socios que viven  en la provincia de Urubamba. La provincia de Urubamba está ubicada al norte de la ciudad del Cusco, a orillas del río Vilcanota, en una zona que se conoce como el “Valle Sagrado” debido a su clima templado, tierra  fértil y abundantes riachuelos, que hacen de este valle uno de los más bellos del planeta.
texts.en:
Juan Cancio is a member of the Nueva Vision de Rumichaca communal bank, a group of 19 members who live in Urubamba Province, located north of the city of Cusco on the banks of the Vilcanota River. The area is known as the Sacred Valley for its mild climate, fertile soil, and abundant streams that make this valley one of the most beautiful on the planet.  

Juan Cancio is 42 years old and has three children with his partner. He was born in the Maras district of Urubamba Province and lives in the town of Cotowincho in Urubamba. He's a metal carpenter and has a small workshop in his home where he makes metal chairs, doors, and other items. 
At the moment, Juan Cancio needs this loan to buy materials such as steel, welding material, paint, sandpaper, and other materials.

loans.use: to buy materials such as steel, welding material, paint, sandpaper, and other materials.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La socia Maribel pertenece al banco comunal "MAMACHA ASUNTA DE CALCA"; El banco se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Calca perteneciente al departamento de Cusco, a una hora de la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 34 años de edad y es conviviente, la socia tiene 2 hijos de 14, 3 años de edad; la socia se dedica a la atencion de su cafetin la socia tiene su negocio escolar en el colegio y en esta ocasión desea implementar el cafetin en el colegio porque comenzaran la vacaciones utiles y ella brindara el servicio de cafetin, la socia desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de gaseosas, de snack, de galletas, queso, huevos para los sandwich y otros productos.
 

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Maribel belongs to the “Mamacha Asunta de Calca” communal bank located in Calca Province belonging to Cusco Department an hour away from the city of Cusco.  She is 34 years old, has a spouse and two children who are 14 and 3 years old.

She has a snack bar at a school and on this occasion wants to stock the school café because vacation is about to start and she will provide snack bar services.  She wants to use the loan to buy soft-drinks, snacks, cookies, cheese, eggs for sandwiches and other products.  She is grateful for the loan and commits to make her installment payments on time.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, snacks, cookies, cheese, eggs and other products.

loans.name: Rustamjon

texts.en: Rustamjon is hardworking man. He is kind man. Rustamjon lives with his family in the north part of Tajikistan. He is married and has a son who is 10 years old. Rustamjon is only feed keeper of his family because his wife is housewife. Rustamjon one year ago began his business deal with selling house products as bucket, broom, kettle, cauldron and etc. He runs business well. Rustamjon is going to increase business and maximize profit. From profit he is going to repair his house as his house has bad condition. He is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy house products for increasing working capital. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy house products for increasing working capital

loans.name: Miora Francia

texts.fr:
Miora Francia est une femme dynamique et travailleuse de 26 ans. Elle est mariée. Le conjoint de 28 ans travaille comme maçon. Le  couple a deux enfants de 8 et 5 ans, scolarisés dans des écoles privées. 
Elle a 15 années d’expérience dans la vente de légumes et fruits.  La  rentabilité de l’activité dépend de la quantité, qualité et la gamme des produits vendus car le marché est sûr. Le point de vente se situe dans l’un des marchés de la capitale. Le prêt sert à acheter des fruits et légumes : carotte, pomme de terre, oignon, tomate, bananes, concombre.
Le ménage vit dans leur propre maison construite sur un terrain loué.  Leur rêve est de pouvoir acheter une maison .

loans.use: acheter des différentes sortes de légumes frais

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 33 years old and married with 4 children. All of her children are in primary school. She is an active member of the Catholic Church and a Sunday school teacher in the same church. She specializes in farming. She grows vegetables like tomatoes, kales, spinach godgets and cereals. She sells them in her local market where she earns USD110 monthly.

She has been fetching water from the river to apply and irrigate on her farm and it’s a long distance. Water has been a challenge in her farming so that she has been dreaming of having her own tank or source one day, but due to insufficient income she has never been able to get a tank.

The area has a shortage of water and she believes after getting a tank she will manage to irrigate her garden in dry seasons leading to regular and consistent supply of the vegetables throughout the year. Her income will be sustained thus stabilizing her life.

loans.use: Mercy wants to buy a water tank

loans.name: Namig

texts.en: Namig Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Lachin. He settled with his family in Sumgait city. He married, has 2 children. This 28-year-old  man began his business 4 years ago. Having borrowed the loan $700 he has bought the 130 pairs of shoes. He has rented the shoe shop. Namig needs a loan of $1200 to open his own shoe shop and to increase range of shoes.

loans.use: To open his own shoe shop and to increase range of shoes

loans.name: Elisa Maria

texts.en:
Elisa Maria Cuna M. is a 38 year old born and raised in Moamba, Maputo province. She was raised by her parents and attended school until the 4th grade. In 1984 she married and had 4 children. In 2002, Elisa and her children were abandoned by her husband. Since 1985 she has been working on her own business of raising chickens. In the end of 2006, she was introduced to HLUVUKU-ADSEMA by her sister and learned about the possibility of access to credit. She supports her family and the schooling of her 3 children through this business. With the loan of 10.500,00 MT Elisa wants to expand her business to respond to the increasing demand for chickens, and to raise her income. Elisa’s activities have a positive impact in her community because not only it provides employment for Elisa and sustenance for her family, but it also provides chicken meat at competitive prices to the local market

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização : Bairro 2 - Boane Cliente: Elisa Maria cuna M. Sector de Actividade: Avicultura Valor de Empréstimo: 10.500,00MT (420.00 US$) Aplicação do Montante: Compra de pintos para engorde. Inicio: 10/04/2007 Fim: 31/03/2008 Elisa Maria Cuna M., de 38 anos de idade, natural de Moamba, Província de Maputo, cresceu sob responsabilidade dos seus Pais. Estudou até 4ª classe. Em 1984 contraiu matrimónio tradicional com o seu marido com o qual tiveram quatro filhos. Em 2002 foi abandonada pelo marido tendo deixado os 4 filhos sob responsabilidade dela. Desde 1985 vem assumindo na integra a gestão do negocio de engorde de pintos. Nos finais do ano de 2006 por indicação da sua irmã teve conhecimento da existência da HLUVUKU-ADSEMA, tendo se informado das condições de acesso ao credito. Com os rendimentos do negocio suporta os encargos da família, incluindo as despesas escolares dos seus três filhos. Com o empréstimo de 10.500,00MT pretende aumentar o volume do seu negocio para dar resposta a maior procura do frango que tem se verificado nos últimos tempos e aumentar a sua renda. A sua actividade tem um impacto maior na comunidade porque para alem de providenciar emprego a ela própria, coloca o frango mais perto dos clientes a um preço altamente competitivo.

loans.use: To produce chickens

loans.name: Mohammed Alie

texts.en: Mohammed J. is 25 years of age. He is married with three children. At 18 he decided to start a small business of selling second hand clothing in the Magburaka town of Sierra Leone.  Mohammed started the business first as a hawker.  Later with his first loan of $100, he was able to expand his business to a market stall.   He is requesting a second larger loan of $200 from SMT to purchase four bales of second hand clothing for the same purpose.

loans.use: Purchase 4 bales of used clothing

loans.name: Estelvina

texts.es:
Estelvina is a seamstress. She is 47. Her husband, Ubaldo Agüero, is 51. She lives in a humble house in Villa Maravilla, a neighborhood bordering the banks of the Paraguay River.

She has two daughters. One is grown and has a family of her own. The younger daughter is nine years old and is the fifth grade. Estelvina manufactures and sells clothes, such as skirts, slacks, shirts, dresses. She says that her best sellers in this winter season are sporty cotton ensembles consisting of slacks and jackets.

She learned this trade when she was very young, working in sewing factories. She goes each morning to the city's Municipal Market, where she sells her clothes from a booth. She returns to her house each evening to be with her family. She also sews in the evenings in her small home shop on her own sewing machine, which she managed to buy after much hard work.

She would use the laon to buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, and so on, and in this way increase her production and sales.

She belongs to the Women in Action Committee of the Program Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya. The 16 women who belong to this committee represent a unfied working group.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio and Sarah Padial, Kiva Volunteers

Estelvina es una costurera de 47 años, está casada con Ubaldo Agüero, navegante de 51 años. Viven en una humilde casa en el Asentamiento Villa Maravilla un barrio que queda a orillas del Río Paraguay. Tienen 2 hijas, una es mayor de edad y ya tiene una familia establecida, la más pequeña tiene 9 años y cursa el 5to grado de la escuela primaria. Ella se encarga de confeccionar y vender ropas como: faldas, pantalones, camisas, vestidos, etc. Ella nos comenta que su prenda con mayor venta en esta temporada de invierno, son los conjuntos deportivos de algodón que consta del pantalón con la campera; este oficio lo aprendió desde muy pequeña trabajando como empleada en talleres de confección. Todas las mañanas va al Mercado Municipal de la ciudad, donde tiene un puesto de ventas de las ropas que confecciona y por las tardes regresa a su casa para compartir con su familia y seguir trabajando confeccionando mas prendas en su pequeño taller con su máquina de coser, propia, que con mucho esfuerzo logro comprar. Estelvina desea utilizar el crédito para comprar materiales para la confección como telas, hilos, botones, cierres, etc. y de ese modo aumentar su producción y ventas. La señora pertenece al Comité “Mujeres en Acción” del Programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras del a Fundación Paraguaya y que consta de 16 mujeres que conformar un grupo solidario de trabajo.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Lemafoe

texts.en: Lemafoe is 39 years old married with 7 children. She is the Centre Chief for Levili Tuvao. Her husband works for one building company in town and his salary is not sufficient to look after the family. Lemafoe is very hard working and she has never relied on her husband for support. She started off with a pancake business and now she is running a flea market. Lemafoe has sacrificed for many years and she believes that hard work is the key to success. She is requesting a loan to buy supplies for her flea market. She is very happy and very delighted by the opportunity offered by SPBD. She hopes to help her family and improve her business.

loans.use: To buy supplies and stock for her flea market business

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en:
Firuza A. is a very energetic and creative person. She has been selling clothes for over 5 years. From her profits, she has been able to add a room to her house for a food shop. She has 4 children and they are old enough for help her at the food shop.

She got her first loan from Microinvest in 2006, which she used to increase the variety of clothes to sell. Her sales were successful and with the profits, she purchased groceries to sell in her food shop. Her clothing stall is well known, and she sells her clothes quickly.

Firuza requests a loan from Kiva so she can buy two tables and eight chairs for her food shop and cafe, where her children can offer hot coffee and some baked goods.

loans.use: Furnish cafe

loans.name: Mohira

texts.ru:
Mohira Aminjanovna S. has been selling women's clothing for seven years. She has two children. Her husband was a construction worker who was killed on the job. After she was widowed, Mohira's brothers helped her support her children, but before long she had to find a source of income to feed her family. In 2000, Mohira began to trade at the market in Istravshan. She used some of her profits to enroll her daughter in a sewing course. Now her business is stable. She buys goods wholesale from Bishkek, Kyrgyzstan and sells them at her local market. She needs a loan in order to increase turnover and inventory.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Собирова Мохира Аминчановна в течение 7 лет торгует женской одеждой. Имеет 2 детей. Муж умер на производстве . Он работал строителем. После смерти мужа чтобы прокормит детей ей помогали ее братья но со временем потребность стал больше и она была вынуждена искать источник дохода чтобы прокормит детей. Начиная с 2000 года она стала торговать на вещевом рынке города Истаравшан. На полученный доход она обучила дочь на курсы шитья . В данный момент у нее есть стабильный бизнес. Она привозит товар оптом из Бишкека (Киргизстан) и продает на рынке. Она нуждается в финансировании чтобы увеличить товарооборот и асортимент товаров.

loans.use: Expansion of assortment of goods.

loans.name: Flor Del Café Paquip Group

texts.es:
Flor D. Café Paquip is maD. up of a group of micro-entrepreneurs with a lot of charisma. This group is remarkable because of their dynamics. Even though this is their first loan, these excellent weavers from Santa Clara la laguna, have known each other for years because they are from the same town.

Many of these weavers have specialized in doing embroidery of traditional blouses. They embroider flowers and birds onto crochet blouses in colors lilac, baby blue, pink, and white. There are also weavers so create the beautiful cloth that is used to make, mostly, huipiles (the blouse of the traditional dress of Guatemala), table runners, and individual table mats. In the group there are also two women who raise animals.

These clients will use their loan to buy thread and cloth to embroider and create traditional clothing. The other two women will invest in buying pigs; two pigs each, and food to fatten them for 3 months and then resell them at the market at almost twice the initial price.

These women dream of buying land to expand or build their houses for their sons and daughters. They would also like to have successful businesses to ensure that their children can go to school, and why not, maybe college. These women stopped thinking about their needs a along time ago. They started their families at a very young age and they are devoted to the wellbeing and future of their children, which is a very special quality. However, on their own they will not be able to make it out of poverty. They need your support so that they can make their dreams come true.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

Flor del Café Paquip está conformado por un grupo D. microempresarias con mucho carisma. Este grupo destaca por la dinámica que tiene. A pesar D. ser su primer crédito, estas excelentes tejedoras D. Santa Clara la laguna se conocen D. años atrás por ser del mismo pueblo.

Muchas D. estas tejedoras se han especializado en el bordado D. blusas tradicionales. Ellas bordan flores y aves en blusas D. crochet D. color lila, celeste, rosado y blanco. También, encontramos tejedoras que elaboran preciosos lienzos D. telas que son utilizados para hacer, en su mayoría, huipiles (la blusa del traje tradicional D. Guatemala), caminos D. mesa e individuales. Asimismo, en el grupo hay dos criadoras D. animales.

Estas clientas van a utilizar su préstamo para comprar hilos y tela para bordar y elaborar tejidos tradicionales. Las otras dos señoras van a invertir en comprar cerdos, dos cerdos respectivamente, y comprar comida para engordarlos durante 3 meses y luego revenderlos en el mercado casi al doble del precio.

Estas señoras sueñan con comprarse un terreno para poder ampliar su casa o para construir una casa para sus hijos e hijas. También a ellas les gustaría tener un negocio exitoso para asegurar que sus hijos puedan ir al colegio, y porque no a la universidad. Estas mujeres dejaron D. pensar en sus necesidades hace mucho tiempo. Ellas desD. que empezaron con su familia a muy temprana edad, están avocadas al bienestar y el futuro D. sus hijos, esta es una cualidad realmente especial. Sin embargo, solas no van a poder salir D. la pobreza, ellas necesitan tu apoyo para que puedan realizar sus sueños.

loans.use: Buying thread and cloth to embroider and create regional woven items. Buying and raising pigs (Estas clientas van a utilizar su préstamo para comprar hilos y tela para bordar y elaborar tejidos tradicionales.Comprar y criar cerdos)

loans.name: Prek Ta Chor I Group

texts.en: The Prek Ta Chor I Village Bank in Kandal Province consists of 21 members. Mrs. Soklin L., 28, is the Village Bank president and a farmer. Her husband works in construction and earns roughly $2.50 per day. Mrs. L. has three children, who are still too young to attend school. She plans to use the loan she receives to hire a person to plow her rice field.

loans.use: To hire labour to plow a rice field

loans.name: Pao

texts.en: Mrs. Pao R., age 26, is a mother of one child and works making small flat baskets (made from bamboo). On average, she earns less than $1 of profit per day. Her husband Mr. Phat Phal, 28, works as a construction worker. Normally he makes about $4 a day.To reduce expenses, this couple needs a loan from Kiva to purchase a motorbike to commute to work.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute to work.

loans.name: Carmen Isabel

texts.es:
For eight years, Carmen L. has had a beauty business, with her own beauty salon, where she works looking after her loyal customers every day, offering them the highest quality service. She has become very experienced in this field, and as a result she has secured a good client base.

It must be pointed out that Carmen is a single mother of one, and she uses the income from her business to support and raise her daughter. This is why she has turned to CEPRODEL for a loan, which will enable her to purchase the necessary products for her business and furthermore, will enable her to expand her premises so that she can offer the best service to her loyal customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Carmen L. desde hace ocho años se dedica al negocio de belleza teniendo su propio salón de belleza en el que atiende a sus fieles clientes todos los días para brindar un excelente servicio con alta calidad. SE ha destacado por ser una persona muy experimentada en el ramo de la belleza y gracias a esto ha logrado acaparar clientes para el negocio.

Es necesario destacar que la señora Carmen es soltera y con una pequeña hija que mantener por lo que para brindarle las condiciones de vida necesarias debe de hacer uso de la inversión en el negocio. Para esto ha buscado el apoyo en CEPRODEL para recibir créditos que le den la oportunidad de adquirir los productos necesarios para el negocio y además para iniciar a ampliar su área física con el fin de brindar un excelente servicio a sus fieles clientes.

loans.use: T purchase materials and improve her premises

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.fr:
Born around 1954 in PORTO NOVO (in OUEME County) in the southeast of BENIN, Ms. Elisabeth T. currently lives in COTONOU, where she sells corn wholesale and retail and also various kinds of fruit, especially oranges. The mother of two children, Mireille and Prudence, she is often aided by Mireille, who goes from district to district to sell corn by the kilogram. She is requesting this loan to give her business a new direction.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Née vers les années 1954 à PORTO NOVO dans le département de l’OUEME au sud-est du BENIN, dame T. Elisabeth vit actuellement à COTONOU où elle vend du maïs en gros et en détail et divers fruits surtout des oranges. Mère de 2 enfants Mireille et Prudence, elle est souvent aidée par Mireille qui passe de quartier en quartier pour vendre au kilogramme le maïs. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour donner de nouvelles orientations à ses activités.

loans.use: To buy 6 bags of corn

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz M. R. is an enthusiastic member of the communal bank “El Triunfo” who sells cosmetics such as Oriflame, Unique, Eskia, and Avon. She got started in this business thanks to a friend who saw that she was a friendly woman and suggested that she put this to good use to earn an income and help with the household expenses and education of her children. Little by little she has increased her number of customers, initially going door to door. These days she has set clients from whom she takes orders.

With this loan of 2000 Nuevo Sol ($700 USD), which she will repay in six months, Beatriz will increase her stock of beauty supplies, as they sell well and are not perishable. Also she will be able to take advantage of sales with each supplier to stock up on cologne, creams, shampoo, powders and other beauty supplies. Beatriz is a happy woman who is simple and enthusiastic; she dreams of living a long life surrounded by her children.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Ann Kenney Molloy

La señora Beatriz M. R., es una entusiasta socia del Banco. Comunal “El Triunfo” vive en la región de San Martín provincia de Picota y distrito de San Hilarión, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos como ORIFLAME, UNIQUE, ESIKA, AVON. La Señora Beatriz se inicia gracias a la idea de una amiga quien viendo que es una mujer amigable, le propuso este negocio, para generar sus ingresos y apoyar en los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos es así poco poco fue ganando su clientela, al comienzo empezó ofreciendo casa por casa, actualmente ya tiene cliente fijos y conocidos trabaja con pedidos. Con el crédito de S/. 2 000.00 que será pagado en 6 meses, implementará su stok en artículos de belleza, porque son productos tienen buena salida y no son perecibles, aprovechando sobre todo las ofertas de las empresas con quienes trabaja, para comprar colonias, cremas, champus, talcos y otros productos de belleza. Beatriz es una mujer alegre, sencilla y entusiasta, sueña con tener una vejez tranquila rodeada de sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of Beauty Supplies

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr:
Komi N. is 52 years old, married and the father of 4 children. Mr. N. and his family have lived for a number of years in Assahoun, a village located approximately 50 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this third loan, he wishes to purchase a new motor in order to limit the expenditure created by his old one. By doing this he will be able to save more money and better provide for the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer.

Komi N. est âgé de 52 ans, marié et Père de 4 enfants. M. Komi et sa famille vivent depuis des années à Assahoun, un village situé à environ 50 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Avec ce troisième crédit, il désire acheter un nouveau moteur pour limiter les dépenses engendrées par ce dernier afin de mieux épargner pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: The purchase of a new motor

loans.name: Elizabeth Alphonce's Tupendane A Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth A., age 22, is the single mother of an 8-year-old boy. She has two businesses that she started in 2003, one selling clothes and the other selling powdered soap to her customers door-to-door. She works from 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. daily and earns a monthly profit of about $41 from selling powdered soap and $51 from selling clothes.

The loan she hopes to receive now will be her fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She has paid back the first three successfully and used them to build a two-room house and increase her inventory of items for sale. She will use half of the funds from this new loan to build a bathroom and the other half to import more supplies from Zanzibar to Dar es Salaam (including bags) to sell. She will share this loan with her group, which totals 15 members. These members hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

In the picture, Elizabeth is in the front center wearing a blue and white striped shirt.

loans.use: to increase the number of items she has for sale and to repair the bathroom in her home

loans.name: Mrs. Chok Savorn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chok S. is the group leader of five who all live in Kor Village in Kandal Province. She is a garment factory worker who can earn $75 per month while her husband, Mr. Long Saroeun, owns a lumber mill in the local village. They have a child who is yet too young to attend school.

Even though Chok and her husband have different businesses, they cannot afford to build a much-needed new house for their family. Thus, she is requesting a loan to add to her savings for its construction in order to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to add to her saving in order to build it for her household.

loans.name: Marita Luz

texts.en:
Marita Luz E. S. is an unmarried mother of 2, aged 7 and 1 years old. She lives in Ayacucho, Perú and is a member of the community bank, Juanito, in Ayacucho, Perú. Marta spends her time cooking common Peruvian dishes including caldo de gallina, a soup made with chicken and broth and salchipapa, which is a dish made with sausage and potatoes.

She will invest her loan of 1000 soles into her restaurant by purchasing rice, potatoes, sausage, spices, oil, and chicken. Currently, her cousin lives in Italy, Marta’s goal is to move with her children to Italy. She dreams of being able to provide her children with a better education and to open a restaurant with her cousin.

loans.use: She will invest her loan of 1000 soles into her restaurant by purchasing rice, potatoes, sausage, spices, oil, and chicken.

loans.name: Rani Abdul Majeed Group

texts.en:
Rani baji is the wife of A. M., and they reside in the city of Borewala in Pakistan. Rani baji is 43 years old, and she is the mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. Her elder son is a driver (he drives a rented auto-rickshaw, which is a three-wheeled motor vehicle), and her younger son has a food business. As for her daughters, her elder daughter is 8 years old, her younger daughter is 4 years old, and both of them stay at home where they do household work. Rani baji’s husband is also a driver, and he too drives an auto-rickshaw. Further, he has been in this profession for the past 2 years.

Rani baji is a seamstres: she sews the clothes of her neighbors. Notably, she has already successfully repaid two prior loans from Asasah, a microfinance institution in Pakistan. Now she is applying for another loan to repair and redesign the body of her husband’s auto-rickshaw.

She is joined in her loan group by three other members: Sajida baji seeks a loan to buy more wood for her wood-selling business; Gulshan baji requests a loan to buy more clothes to resell; and another Gulshan baji would like a loan to buy animals (goats and sheep) to resell. This is a group loan; as such, the loan proceeds will be distributed amongst the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. Importantly, the group members mutually guarantee one another's loans; as a result, if one group member does not repay her portion of the loan, then the other members are responsible for curing the arrears.

loans.use: To improve her husband's business by repairing and redesigning the body of his auto-rickshaw

loans.name: Bitris M.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Bitris B. from Kyela. She is married with three children between the ages of one and 13. Bitris has been running a used clothing business since 2005. Second-hand clothes journey across the oceans from America and Europe, and are then washed, ironed and sold in bulk by wholesalers in Dar es Salaam to retailers who then re-wash and re-iron them for sale on the streets of Dar es Salaam and the surrounding towns and villages.

These clothes are becoming increasingly popular, especially among the younger generation, because they are so cheap and because of the general appeal of anything western or modern. Many people argue that the popularity of the West’s cast-offs is damaging the local cloth and garment industry. Although there are many people who still appreciate the beauty of traditional Tanzanian dress, the growing market in used clothing and its importance to many micro-entrepreneurs cannot be denied.

Bitris works at her business for 9 to 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by her husband. Bitris currently earns about 220 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 325 USD in order to purchase more used clothes and cocoa in bulk. In the future, she plans to expand her business by adding more clothes for reselling. Bitris thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes and cocoa in bulk

loans.name: Wendy Berenice

texts.es:
Wendy Berenice C. Domínguez desea colocar protecciones en las ventanas de su casa por la razón de que donde vive es una colonia nueva y aun no conoce a sus vecinos. Ella  teme que en el momento de irse a trabajar alguna persona con malas intenciones pueda hacer daños a sus hijos. Solicita la cantidad de $6,000 pesos.
Wendy y su esposo trabajan en maquiladora y con estos ingresos pagaran el préstamo
otorgado.
texts.en:
Wendy C. Berenice D. wants to place window guards on her new home’s windows because she lives in a new neighborhood and she does not know her neighbors. She fears that when she goes to work someone with bad intentions will harm her children. She requests the amount of $6,000 pesos. Wendy and her husband work in an assembly plant and this revenue they will help repay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase window guards

loans.name: Pheang

texts.en:
Mrs. Pheang S. lives in Stoeung Penh village in Kampong Cham province. She is a Khmer cake maker who earns a little income to support her household. She has decided to ask for a loan for two purposes. Her husband, Mr. Nut Yim, is a construction worker. With money from the loan she will buy timber for her husband to start a new enterprise as a furniture builder, making beds. She would use the rest of the money to make more cakes and thus expand her own business. She hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions.

Mrs. Pheang S. is 34 years old and the mother of two children who are too young to work or study. Her husband is presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy timbers to make beds and she would use the rest of money to make more cakes for her business.

loans.name: Mombasa Two Group

texts.en:
Mwatima has been a potato seller in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for 2 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 90. Every day she works at her business for 7 hours. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more potatoes for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Mwatima is 30 years old, married, and has three children: ages 15, 9, and 5. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Maryam S., Mwanahamis and Maryam K..Each woman has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes for her business

loans.name: Hassane

texts.en:
Hassane is a 32-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh in southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Hassane has been working as a furniture painter for several years. He requested a loan of $1100 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase paint and tools for his business. This is his second loan cycle and he has always paid on time. 

His previous loan helped him expand his business. Hassane is successful because he completes the work on time and does it well. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When Hassane first started his business, he didn’t have the start up capital. He decided to open his business because of his experience, and he wanted to work independently. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: Purchase paint and tools

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe Sabali ont en moyenne  de 36 ans et 1 enfant. Toutes mariées, elles vivent dans des  familles traditionnelles à Sanoubougou un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Elles font essentiellement le commerce  de  condiments alimentaires, de fruits et de vêtements pour  enfants.. 
Afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, elles ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur premier prêt de groupe.
Avec ce prêt, elles comptent acheter, 4 paquets de condiments alimentaires,  10 chargements de charrette en fruits et 20 douzaines d’habits pour enfant.
Elles   s’approvisionnent à Sikasso ville et ses localités environnantes. 
Les marchandises sont vendues au marché et dans les quartiers à une clientèle composée généralement de femmes et la plupart au comptant.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice de 15.000FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et  investir  dans les activités.
Les femmes du groupe sabali ambitionnent de pérenniser leur relation avec l’institution Soro Yiriwaso afin de pouvoir obtenir des montants importants.
texts.en:
The women of the Sabali group have an average age of 36 and on average, one child. They are all married and live in traditional families in Sanoubougou, one of the neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They essentially sell condiments, fruit, and clothing for children. So as to satisfy the needs of their clientele, they decided to join the credit program of Soro Yiriwaso, with whom they are on their first group loan.

With this loan, they expect to buy 4 packets of condiments, 10 wagonloads of fruit, and 20 dozen outfits for children. They do their buying in the town of Sikasso and surrounding locations. The merchandise is sold at the market and in the neighborhoods, to a clientele composed generally of women, and most sales are for cash.

They each expect to make a profit of 15,000 F CFA per month which will be used for the needs of the family and partially invested back into their businesses. The women of the Sabali group hope to continue their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso so as to take out loans for greater sums in future.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for re-sale

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is 26 years old and she is single without children. She sells noodles, eggs and bread. She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more noodles, eggs and bread to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more noodles, eggs and bread.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
El señor Jesús vive en la calle Rigoberto Paredes de la zona de san Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz; vive en casa de sus padres y estudia en la escuela Hotelera la carrera de Chef Internacional. Jesús  trabaja en una panadería elaborando pasteles; el crédito que solicita es para pagar las pensiones y matricula y seguir estudiando hasta terminar la carrera.

No es cliente de Impro pero por el carácter social puede acceder a un crédito. El análisis de su lujo de caja permite apreciar que no tendrá problemas en pagar las cuotas mensuales del préstamo.
texts.en:
Mr. Jesús lives on Rigoberto Paredes Street in the neighborhood of San Pedro in La Paz. He lives at home with his parents and studies in the Hotelera School to be an International Chef. Jesús works at a bakery making cakes. The loan he's requesting is to pay tuition and pension and to continue studying to finish his degree. He is not a client of Impro but with his social character he can access a loan. The analysis of his cashflow indicates that he will have no problems in paying the monthly payments on his loan.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Schmid, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cost of tuition and pension at the Hotelera School to finish his studies to become an International Chef

loans.name: Margaret Namujju‘S Group

texts.en:
Margaret, age 40, is the leader of a group of five members. She is the single mother of four children between the ages of 14 and 20. All her children go to school. She rents a one-roomed house where she lives with her children. There is electricity and piped water at her home and she ensures that the family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala.

Margaret sells secondhand clothes door to door. She sells to an average of 20 people a day, and she works seven days a week. Margaret buys these clothes from Owino market, one of the busiest markets in the city of Kampala. Her major monthly expenses include rent, electricity, and medication. She also incurs extra transportation costs to and from the market. She has been in this business for the last 20 years and sells to all categories of people. Her main challenges are the increasing prices of clothes and seasonal ups and downs in sales. Prior to this business, Margaret was selling charcoal.

She has been with MCDT for over six years. She and her fellow group mates have received and repaid 11 loans before this one.

Margaret wants to use this loan to buy a bale of clothes. She aspires tocontinue to improve her business and dreams of owning a permanent business premise.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for sale

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.en:
Aquilina is a member of Banco Comunal Sumaqcha which means Beautiful in Quechua. She is married, is 53 years old, and has three children.

Aquilina has Internet cubicles in her home, a business that is run by her and her children in their free time. She also sells candy. She also sells topical ointments in her home where she works every day. She is a trained nurse technician.

Aquilina needs a loan of 1,000 soles which she will use to buy more candy and to repair some of her equipment. Her dreams are to have her own jewelry store and that her children will finish their studies.

loans.use: To buy more candy and to repair some of her equipment

loans.name: Sabali  (La Sagesse) Group

texts.fr:
Les huit femmes du groupe Sabali sont toutes mariées, elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et 4 enfants, vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier Darsalam 1 de la ville de Koutiala (région de Sikasso, république du Mali). Elles se sont  connues   à travers des liens   de voisinage et souvent pour la pratique de la  même activité.
Elles exercent comme activité principale la  vente  d’habits  et comme secondaire la vente de condiments alimentaires. Elles sont très sollicitées dans ces activités. 
Afin  de satisfaire  le besoin de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, le groupe Sabali a décidé d’intégrer à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son troisième  prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
 Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, des pagnes wax, des brodés,  des prêts à porter  et une quantité importante de condiments alimentaires  à Bamako (la capitale de la république du Mali). Les habits  sont vendus en détail, au comptant et à crédit au marché de Koutiala, quant  aux condiments ils sont vendus à la maison et au marché. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen  de 110 000 FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités. Elles ont pour ambition de diversifier leur commerce en embrassant d’autres activités génératrices de revenus.
texts.en:
The eight women of this “Sabali” (wisdom) group are all married. They have an average age of 35 and on average, 4 children. They live in big traditional extended families in the Darsalam 1 neighborhood of the town of Koutiala (Sikasso region, Republic of Mali). They met through being neighbors and, in many cases, by having the same business.

Their principal business is selling clothing and secondarily, selling condiments. They are much in demand in these areas.

So as to satisfy the needs of their growing clientele, the Sabali group decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with whom they are on their 3rd solidarity loan (group loan). All the preceding loans were correctly reimbursed.

They intend to use this loan to buy “Wax”-brand “pagnes” (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth) , embroidered fabrics, ready-to-wear, and a considerable amount of condiments in Bamako (the capital of the Republic of Mali). The clothing is sold retail, for cash or credit, in the market of Koutiala. The condiments are sold out of their homes and at the market.

They each hope to make an average profit of 110,000 F CFA during this loan cycle, which will be used to pay the interest on the loan and to cover the needs of their extended families, investing any remainder back into their businesses.

Their ambition is to diversify their businesses by taking up other money-earning activities.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of clothing and condiments for resale

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline S. is from the village of Panta-on, Ozamiz city. She is 59 years old, married and has four children. To make a living, Evangeline owns and operates a business venture raising crops in the agriculture sector. While not serving as the sole means for generating revenue, Evangeline's main source of income comes primarily from planting and harvesting corn and cassava. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Evangeline joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP of which she plans to use to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Evangeline from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business and for family basic needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure, to sell for agricultural uses

loans.name: Madjiar

texts.en:
Madjiar P. is from the village of Panduma Sr., Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 20 years old. Madjiar is married and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Madjiar owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating in a food market. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of products like vegetables, spices, etc., in the local community. Madjiar has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Madjiar joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Madjiar has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to  purchase new items to expand product offering. Madjiar is requesting a new loan which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Madjiar from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Safa

texts.en:
Safa owns a small grocery shop at Al-Nusairat Refugee camp. Her husband is an employee and she has four children, two of whom are teenagers who help her to sell at the store during summer vacation.

Safa is the main person who is responsible for selling and managing the business. She sells juice, rice, toilet paper, diapers, and food like oil, rice and canned food. She also sells cleaning materials.

Safa needs 1,000 USD to buy new products for her store. She appears in the photo at her store with two of her children.

loans.use: To buy new products for her store

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza who is from the village of Rizal East San Isidro, Isabela manages a humble hog raising business. She is already 42 years old and only finished elementary level of education. Through her patience in raising her hogs she is able to supply the needed basic needs of her family. Riza is also gambling for the success of her business. She is praying that her hogs will not suffer from any illnesses.


Riza wanted to apply for KIVA loans to sustain the needed feeds supply of her raised animals. She is proposing to borrow the amount of PHP5, 000 from the lenders. Raising pigs is very beneficial to her family because compared to other business, hog raising gives her double income if it is maintained well said Riza thus she is patiently maintaining the business.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Mrs. Eim Hin Village Bank Loan Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan which consists of twelve people and they all live in Klaong Tvear village in Takeo province. Mrs. Eim H. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. She is also a chicken breeder. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more chickens, chicken foods, and she would use the rest of money to buy piglets for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Douk Soeun, owns a horse to use with a cart to transport the goods and passengers. Mrs. Eim H. is 32 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study. 

Five members in this group loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the veR. end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more chickens, chicken foods, and she would use the rest of money to buy piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Anania

texts.en:
Anania P. is 54 years old and she is engage in business retailing of goods in her general store at their village of San Rafael, Aurora, Isabela. She is a widowed mother 27 years ago, almost half of her life. They are blessed with five children with her late husband. Her two children have their own families and three of them are also working in Manila. Being alone is not the hindrance for being hopeless. In her situation, she doesn’t need to look for source of income because she already has her children giving her money for her food.

Anania still looks for source of income aside from farming for her future. She does not want look forward to her children remittances. She wants to work for her own because she understands that her children have their own families to support. She wishes to continue operate her business and improve for her source of income. She is asking from the KIVA lenders to help her improve her business by borrowing the amount of Php 22,000 for additional capital of her business.

loans.use: additional capital for her store business

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is 54 years old and married to Crisanto, 52 years old and a  farmer. They blessed with one child named Christia, a high school student. Crisanto is busy in their farm; while Lita is engaged in retailing business of goods in their village of Matusalem, Aurora, Isabela. She started her business since the time her daughter started going to school. Her business, since then has helped her in providing funds for her child in school.

Lita lives happily and peacefully with her family. She is dreaming that someday her child will finish her schooling. She wants to borrow the amount of PHP8,000 for additional capital of her business. She wanted to improve her business for her family’s future, especially for her child.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.es: La señora Gulnara, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Alisson II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 49 años y es madre de 02 hijos, ya independientes.Anteriormente Gulnara, se dedicaba a la venta de frutas, en el Mercado Central y por motivos de salud dejo de ejercer este tipo de actividad, hoy en día lleva 05 años, dedicándose al servicio de movilidad urbana en su motokar. Para trabajarlo, su esposo se encarga de trasladarse por diferentes lugares de la Ciudad. Se inicio con el primer prestamo de Manuela Ramos y poco a poco fue ahorrando y con ese dinero fue comprando repuestos, para mejorar el servicio a los moradores de la comunidad. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará repuestos y aceites como: lubricantes, bocamasas, bujías; para así brindar un mejor servicio y atender mucho mejor al cliente.Hoy en día es una mujer independiente, y es ella y su esposo quienes toman las decisiones y administran su negocio.Gulnara, nos cuenta: Que el pertenecer a un grupo de mujeres le ha ayudado a conocer mejor sus derechos y juntas  hacer que estas sean respetadas. Y agradece bastante al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciarse en el campo empresarial.
texts.en:
Gulnara belongs to the Alisson II Communal Bank in the Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is 49, in a common law marriage, and has two children. The children are now independent. She previously worked selling fruit in the Central Market. But, for health reasons she had to stop doing this type of work. She has now been working in this type of activity for five years. She offers urban transportation services in her “motocarro” (three wheeled motorized vehicle). Her husband drives it through different parts of the city. She started with her first loan from Manuela Ramos. Little by little, she was saving. With this money she was buying replacement parts to improve the service to the inhabitants of the community. With this loan for 2,000 PEN she will buy replacement parts and oils such as lubricants, circuit boxes, and spark plugs. This way she will offer better service and take much better care of the customers. Today she is an independent woman. She and her husband are the ones who make the decisions and administer her business. Gulnara tells us that belonging to a group of women has helped her to better know her rights. Together they make sure these are respected. She is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her start in the field of business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy replacement parts to improve her service

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 35 years old, married with 2 children. Her husband sells clothes. She has a grinding machine that she uses to grind tomatoes, peppers, and beans. Her stall is located at the front of her house. The demand for her services is high. She has been in this business for 5 years. She hopes for a loan amount of 30,000 NGN to purchase a grinding machine to enable her to serve her customers better. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase one grinding machine

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret B. is thirty-six years old and married with two children. She is a business woman supplying timbers to the markets. She is using the loan to improve upon her business by stocking a variety of timber for more profits. Her future plan is to be able to obtain transport means to supply the timber to Kampala and Juba in Sudan so as to increase her profits.

loans.use: To buy a variety of timber to sell.

loans.name: Evgeniy

texts.en:
Evgeniy is married. He and his wife Anzhella have two children. Evgeniy sells sport shoes at one of the markets in Melitopol town. He started this business 12 years ago. Today he owns two business locations and offers a large assortment of sport shoes to his clients. Evgeniy loves wearing sport shoes himself and enjoys his work. 
Evgeniy would like to borrow 15,000 UAH to purchase winter inventories. He hopes to increase his sales and save enough money to pay for his children's education.

loans.use: To purchase sport shoes to sell.

loans.name: Amani

texts.en: Amani is a 20-year-old woman who lives in Tyre, Southern Lebanon. Amani has been working as a hair dresser for over a year. She also does makeup and hair removal, and sells beauty products as well. When Amani first started her work, she didn’t face difficulties. She decided on her business because she likes her work and does it well, since she gained experience while working in a salon. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her salon, including makeup, a new drier, and beauty products. This is the first time that Amani has requested a loan. In the future, she plans on improving her work.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her salon

loans.name: Sagrada Familia Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “SAGRADA FAMILIA”, está conformada por 10 socios entusiastas y luchadores, quienes tienen por afinidad dedicarse al comercio minorista, trabajan con EDAPROSPO – prosperidad desD. hace 2 años.
Hilda es una socia del grupo comunal y a su vez asume el cargo D. presidenta, tiene 50 años, es casada, tiene 2 hijos, se dedica a la confección D. ropa desD. hace 4 años, se inicio en este negocio porque inicialmente trabajo en un taller, en el cual logro aprender y decidió independizarse, con el esfuerzo D. su labor diaria ha logrado la construcción D. su vivienda D. material noble y la compra D. maquinarias (1 remalladora y 4 rectas).
Uno D. los grandes sueños D. Hilda es ampliar más su negocio y solo administrarlo.
El reciente préstamo otorgado será invertido en la compra D. mercadería, todos nuestros socios agradecen el apoyo brindado y se comprometen a cumplir con los pagos respectivos.
texts.en:
The communal bank 'Sagrada Familia' is maD. up of 10 enthusiastic and hard-working members, who all work in the retail traD. and work with Edaprospo - prosperity for 2 years. Hilda is one member of the group and she assumes the role of President. She is 50 years old, married with 2 children, and has worked making clothes for 4 years. She began this business because she initially worked in a workshop, in which she managed to learn and decided to become independent. With the force of her daily labour she has achieved the construction of her house with fine material and the purchase of machinery (1 overlocker and 4 sewing machines). One of HIlda's biggest dreams is to increase her business more and administer it by herself. The loan, when it is granted, will be invested in the purchase of merchandise. All of our associates are thankful for the support given to them and promise to comply with their respective repayments terms.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Criselda V. is from the village of Gata Diot Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old. Criselda is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Criselda raises pigs for sale. Criselda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Criselda joined GDMPC to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Criselda successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from GDMPC. Criselda is requesting her fourth loan from GDMPC, for 15000 PHP, which she will invest in her business. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in her pig raising business.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 41 years old and married to Jane Muthoni. They have two school-going children.  He operates a retail shop in Naivasha town and this he has done for the last five years.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to add to his stocks of dry foodstuffs, e.g., sugar, maize flour and rice for his shop.

His future plan is to grow his business to a wholesale outlet.

loans.use: Buy dry foodstuffs for sale, e.g., maize flour, rice, etc.

loans.name: María Haydee

texts.es:
La Sra. María Haydee G. es comerciante ambulante vende ropa usada en el municipio de san Rafael, es el segundo crédito con nosotros, el dinero lo solicita para capital de trabajo compra de una paca de ropa variada, es madre de 3 hijas todas ya casada ella vive sola con su esposo, su esposo es jubilado.
Dice que los crédito con ceprodel le han ayudado ya que ella antes pasaba en su casa todo el día sin hacer nada y ahora tiene este pequeño negocio lo cual se siente muy bien estar trabajando y que ceprodel le este financiando para poder vender su ropa y mantener a su clientela.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Haydee Gutierrez is a traveling merchant who sells used clothing in the town of San Rafael. This is her second credit with us, and she will use it to purchase a package of assorted clothing. She is the mother of 3 children, all of whom are already married, and she lives alone with her husband, who is retired. She says that the loans with Ceprodel have helped her, since she used to spend all day in her house without anything to do, and now she has this small business. She feels very well to be working and is grateful to Ceprodel for financing her, which enables her to sell her clothing and maintain her clientele.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase assorted used clothing, sheets, capri pants, among other things, to offer to her clients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fish to sell

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.es:
Eulogia es socia del Banco Comunal Señor D. los Milagros.
Eulogia es casada, tiene 50 años y 8 hijos, Eulogia viaja a las ferias D. la región en donD. venD. verduras y D. las ferias compra cereales que luego procesa en un molino alquilado, productos que venD. en la selva ayacuchana. Además Eulogia venD. ropa D. segunda.
Eulogia necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. trigo, cebada y verduras.
Los sueños D. Eulogia son educar a sus hijos y comprar un terreno para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Eulogia is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor D. los Milagros” (Lord of the Miracles). She is 50 years old, married, and has eight children. Eulogia travels to different fairs in the region where she sells vegetables. At the fairs, she also buys grain that she will process later using a rented mill. These products are then sold in the Ayacuchan jungle. Eulogia also sells secondhand clothing.

She needs a loan of 2000 PEN to invest in the purchase of wheat, barley, and vegetables. Eulogia dreams of providing her children with an education and acquiring land for them.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wheat, barley, and vegetables

loans.name: Emilie

texts.fr:
Madame Emilie S., âgée de 31 ans, est une infirmière de métier depuis presque 10 ans. Marièe et mère d'un enfant de 6 mois, Madame Emilie sollicite un prêt au niveau de sa caisse U-IMCEC Thiès pour se conformer aux coutumes. En fait son jeune frère doit entrer à la case des hommes et que les coutumes veulent que son frère ou soeur ainé(e) se charge de la cotisation financière. Cette cérémonie est appelée leul ou circoncision communautaire qui a pour objectif de ressusciter un pan important des cultures.
