Le leul est considéré pour certains  comme une école de la vie. Il initie les candidats aux rites de la vie. Ainsi, ces candidats participent au leul pour être forgés et non pour se faire plaisir ou faire état de leurs différences sociales. 
Selon les organisateurs, les premiers jours, la plupart des enfants ont du mal à se départir de leurs habitudes, mais à force de recevoir les enseignements de l'encadrement, ils finissent par se ranger.

La plus populaire de ces cérémonies est organisée par intervalle d'années précise au sud du Sénégal en Casamance par les diolas. Cette année, elle va se féter au mois de Juillet prochain. 
Avec ce prêt Madame Emilie S., une diola originaire de Casamance,  compte cotiser pour son jeune frère et respecter une tradition.
texts.en:
Ms. Emilie S., aged 31, has been a nurse by profession for almost ten years.  Married and the mother of a 6-month-old child, she is requesting a loan at the U-IMCEC Thiès branch office to conform to a custom.  That is, her younger brother must enter la case des hommes (the men's hut).  Customs dictate that a boy's older brother or sister is responsible for paying the costs.  This ceremony is called leul, or communal circumcision, and has the purpose of reviving an important aspect of culture.  For some people, leul is considered to be schooling in life.  It initiates the candidates in the rites of life.  Thus, the candidates participate in leul to be recast and molded, not to have fun or to justify their societal differences.   According to the organizers, in the first few days, most of the children have trouble divesting themselves of their ways.  But by dint of the supervised learning, they end up falling in line. In southern Senegal, in Casamance, the most widespread of these ceremonies is organized by the Diola ethnic group for a precise time in the year.  This year, the ceremony is going to be celebrated this July.  With this loan, Ms. Emilie S., a Diola with roots in Casamance, plans on making the payments for her younger brother and respecting a tradition.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Traditional need

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower from Lebanon is a 60-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and five children and has been working as a taxi driver since 2005. He owns a “service” or shared taxi, which is one of the most popular and cost-effective means of transport in Lebanon. Three of his children are also working to support the household.

He is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., to improve his taxi. He specifically wants to update the paint and repair some of the metal of the car’s body. This will be his second loan from Ameen.

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loan from Kiva to offer lower interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling US$115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit: http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To update the paint and repair some of his taxi's bodywork

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia A., 54, is from the village of Awallan, Baggao, Cagayan. She is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Herminia owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Herminia has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns around 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2005, Herminia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Herminia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from ASKI. Herminia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Herminia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa B. is from the village of Kauswagan, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 39 and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Celsa raises rice like "masipag," "b10," and head rice for sale and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Celsa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Celsa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from GDMPC which was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Celsa is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Celsa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Agababa

texts.en: Agababa A. is a 46 year old man who sells different kinds of women's clothing in the central bazaar of Agsu city. He has been selling women's clothes since 2008 and already has a lot of clients. He has very good taste and he knows his demand, which helps him in choosing season collections. His monthly profit is 300 AZN.  He applied for 1000 AZN to increase his income. He wants to build his own shop one day.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Silole  Ene

texts.en:
Silole Ene S. is 41years old and she supports six members of her family. She has been wheat farming for the last three years successfully; this has been due to good climatic conditions and a ready market for the produce in her area.
 
This being her first loan, she is planning to spend 20,000 shillings on harrowing, 15,000 to buy wheat seeds, fertilizer and chemicals, and the remaining 15,000 on planting.

Her plan for the anticipated profits is that she will expand her wheat farm to large-scale farming. Her hopes and dreams are that she will become a large-scale farmer and be able to educate her kids to higher levels of education.

She is a hardworking woman and determined to achieve her set target.

loans.use: To harrow; buy wheat seeds, fertilizer and chemicals; and plant wheat

loans.name: Ermercinda

texts.es: Emercinda, de 47 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Roberto de 48 años y sus 2 menores hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Trabajando arduamente junto a su esposo, Emercinda ha logrado hacer de sus cultivos de papa, arveja y maíz, los más solicitados de su poblado, todas las mañanas sin importar las condiciones del clima, salen a trabajar sus chacras, ya que saben que de ello dependen los ingresos que obtendrán por la venta de sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, lleva 26 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado de la ciudad de Tarma. Con el tiempo, desea comprar más tierras, para incrementar su producción. Este es segundo crédito con MFP y espera ser muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, en su grupo comunal es una socia muy respetada, debido a la responsabilidad que demuestra. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para hacer más fértiles sus tierras.
texts.en:
Emercinda, 47 years old, is a very happy and hard working mother, she lives in her own home with her 48 year old husband Roberto and their two young children, and they want to provide a better quality of life for them. Working arduously with her husband, Emercinda has managed to grow her crops of potato, peas and corn, the most needed crops in her village. Every morning no matter what the weather conditions are, they go out to work their farm, as they know that they depend on the income that they earn from selling their products. What she likes the most about her work is to farm her land, which she has been doing for 26 years and she thinks that the most difficult thing is to transport her products to the market in the city of Tarma. In time, she wants to buy more land, to increase production. This is the second loan with MFP and she hopes to be very punctual in the payment of the installments. In her communal group she is a very respected member, on account of the responsibility that she shows. With the two thousand nuevos soles that she is asking for, she will buy more fertilizer to make her land more fertile.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to keep her land fertile.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua A. sells salt at Elmina. Efua has received junior high education.  She is a widow taking care of four children. She has been in this business for eight years. She responsibly ensures that her family is well taken care of. Her loan will be used to buy extra bags of salt to sell to her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy extra bags of salt to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Cherry Lyn's Group

texts.en: Cherry Lyn P. is from the village of Bunawan Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old and is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Blueberry. Cherry Lyn is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Cherry Lyn owns and operates a handicraft business selling specialty handicrafts like souvenirs, wallets, hats, place mats and handkerchiefs to tourists and local community members. Cherry Lyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,800 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010, Cherry Lyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cherry Lyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Cherry Lyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make additional specialty handicrafts

loans.name: Nyiikira Okole Women's Group 2-Kampala

texts.en:
"Rise up to the occasion" She truly has been a testament to that. This is the simple business story of 37-year-old Rose L., an enterprising retail businesswoman operating along Entebbe road in Kampala. 

She is happily married with four children. As proof of the fact that she has what it takes to take care of all of them, she says he has seen her first and second born children through school. It’s a flourishing 12-year-old business that has helped her make significant ends meet on weekly profits of about $66. 

In spite of the achievements she has registered, she is still behind schedule in many of her other set objectives, like her poultry business. It’s for this reason that she wants this loan. She figures she will be able to purchase more retail items in bulk, such as beans, ground nuts, rice, plastics, etc. that she will eventually resell. She also intends to improve her poultry business. Rose belongs to the Nyiikira Okole Women's group 2-Kampala.

loans.use: The purchase of more retail items such as beans, rice and plastics for resale.

loans.name: Folivi

texts.fr: folivi est un homme très dynamique, il est marié et père de 2 enfants. il vit avec sa  famille dans le quartier d'anfamé qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé. pour subvenir à ses propres besoins et à ceux de sa famille, il a ouvert sa propre boutique dans laquelle il fait des photocopies. beaucoup d'écoliers et d'enseignent des écoles de son quartier sont ses clients, même le personnel de certaines petites entreprises à proximité de son lieu d'activité. la demande de sa clientèle est de plus en plus élevée. il sollicite donc de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat d'une nouvelle photocopie.
texts.en:
Folivi is a very dynamic man, married with two children. He lives with his family in the neighborhood of Anfamé, a suburb of the city of Lomé. 

In order to support himself and provide for his family, he opened a shop offering photocopy services. His client base includes lots of students and teachers from the local schools as well as staff members from small businesses near his shop. 

With customer demand increasing steadily, he is seeking a loan from WAGES to buy a new copier.

loans.use: To buy a new copy machine

loans.name: Luís Jacinto

texts.es:
Luís Jacinto M. T. tiene 32 anos. Es soltero  vive con los padres, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijo que se llama Luís de 11 años.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. Dole 2 se dedican a labores agrícolas en la hacienda bananera DOLE, ubicada en la cabecera cantonal, todos los miembros viven en el Cantón Ventanas, la mayoría de los socios trabajan mas de un año en la mencionada hacienda, y sus actividades son relacionadas a la bananera. Son aproximadamente 13 socios.

Luís trabaja en la bananera como regador encargado de los riego en la hacienda, trabaja desde hace un año, las comprar las realiza en el comisariato  1 en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para ponerse un negocio en la casa y adecuar el local y comprar productos para su negocio. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueno es mejorar la vivienda y cumplir la meta del negocio.
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Luis Jacinton M. T. is 32 years old. He is single and lives with his parents in the town of Ventanas in the province of Los Rios. He has a son called Luis who is 11 years old.

The members of V.R.C. Dole 2 are farm workers in DOLE's banana's farm, which is located in the main town, all the members live in Ventanas town, most of the members have been working more than a year on this farm, and their activities are related to the farm. They are approximately 13 members.

Luis works on irrigation at the farm for more than a year now, he does grocery shopping at the supermarket 1 in Ventanas.

He is requesting a loan to start a business at his home and set up his store and buy products for his business. With the loan's help he would be able to fulfill his needs. He dreams on improving his house and start his business.
He likes practice sports.

loans.use: to start a business at his home and set up his store and buy products for his business

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LLANKACHINAPAC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Mariza; ella tiene 32 años de edad, conviviente  y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de internet el cual lleva por nombre DIEGOS  y se encuentra ubicado en su misma casa la socia es una mujer emprendedora y de esta forma saca a su familia adelante.   

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar más computadoras y para el mantenimiento de algunas.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Mariza is a member of the “Llankachinapac” community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Mariza is 32 years old.  She lives with her partner and has 2 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business which is an Internet café called Diegos which is located in her home.  She is an enterprising woman who is getting her family ahead in life.

Mariza is requesting this loan to buy more computers and to service others.

She is grateful to those who will take part in her dream by funding her loan and she pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy computers and to have some others serviced

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to build up her business

loans.name: Gereldorj

texts.en:
Gereldorj A. is 44 years old.  He lives with his wife and four daughters in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent and fence. His oldest daughter is a university student and his younger three daughters all attend a local school. 

To support his family, Gereldorj operates two businesses: a machinery parts trading and car repair center, and a transportation service in his town. He owns a small car repair business located next to the main road. At first, he rented a container at the local market from where he sold a variety of machinery parts, but after a year of successful business operation, he managed to buy a plot of land inside a property fence.  From his new property, he now sells a variety of machinery parts and provides car repair service to his customers.  He was able to buy a car with his earnings, and started his transportation business in 2010 to supplement his income. 

Gereldorj hopes to expand his businesses and establish his own machinery part trading center in the future. He is requesting an 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more machinery parts from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, to sell through his workshop.

loans.use: To purchase machinery parts to sell

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es: Reyna, D.  44 años, vive en su casa que es propia con sus dos hijos y su esposo; juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante.DesD. hace 10 años, atienD.  su granja D. animales donD. cría cuyes y gallinas, D. buena raza. Comercializa sus animales D. acuerdo a lo que sus clientes le solicitan,  generalmente los coloca en los mercados y también los comercializa para abastecer los banquetes D. su barrio, además  sus hijos L. apoyan a transportar sus animales cuando están disponibles. El desarrollo del negocio le ha permitido mejorar L. economía D. su hogar y se ha dado cuenta que es tranquilo y rentable, además tiene planeado aumentar L. cantidad D. animales que comercializa para mejorar sus rentas.Es el 13avo crédito que tiene con MFP, y esta muy contenta D. contar con este apoyo financiero que le permitirá continuar trabajando; además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Esta muy agradecida con las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo, pues tiene el capital para seguir adelante.Reyna tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en L. compra D. animales D. raza que necesita para mejorar su producción en el negocio; además adquirirá algunos materiales D. construcción que necesita para mejorar su granja.
texts.en:
Reyna is 44 years old.  She lives in her own home with her husband and two children.  Together they work hard every day to get ahead.

For 10 years, Reyna has been working on her farm where she raises good breeds of guinea pigs and chickens.  She sells her animals in accordance with her customers' requests.  She generally sells them in markets and also to people who are hosting celebrations in her neighborhood.  Her children support her in transporting the animals when they are available.

The development of Reyna's business has allowed her to improve her household finances and she has come to realize that her business is both peaceful and profitable.  She is planning to increase the quantity of animals that she sells in order to improve her income.

This is Reyna's 13th loan with MFP and she is very happy to have this financial support which allows her to continue working.  She enjoys being a member of her community bank because all the members are responsible people who are very supportive of each other.  She is very grateful to the people who will make this loan possible since it will give her the capital she needs to get ahead.  Reyna plans to invest her money in buying the good breeds of animals she needs to improve her production.  She will also buy some building supplies that she needs to improve her farm.

loans.use: To buy animals for her business

loans.name: Ven

texts.en: Ven S., 57, is a widow with two children living at home in Takeo province. She works in a grocery store, typically making US$5 each day and one of her children works in a local hotel, making an income of US$5 per day. To earn more money, Ven S. is asking for a loan of US$500 to raise cows for sale.

loans.use: To raise cows.

loans.name: Meiponyo

texts.en:
Meiponyo O. K.  is 36 years old. He married and supports nine people. Meiponyo is a farmer.  He has been farming on his own piece of land for the last ten years, earning good income.

Meiponyo learned about KADET LTD from credit officers doing their marketing. This will be his first loan, which he plans to spend to purchase farming  supplies. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.

Meiponyo's dream is do large scale farming and attain financial independence. He is a hard working man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Celyn

texts.en:
Celyn C. is from the village of Paitan, Dalipuga, Iligan City. She is 27 years old. Celyn is single. To make a living, Celyn owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling snacks & other delicacies like sweet potato and banana cue, sandwiches & fruit juices in the local community. Celyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Celyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Celyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Celyn is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Celyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

location.town: Paitan, Dalipuga, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Chinchero, provincia D. Urubamba, Departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Guadalupe; La socia tiene 54 años D. edad, la socia es casada; la socia tiene 3 hijos D. los cuales uno D. ellos es independiente y los otros dos tiene (17,1 año); la socia  es docente D. profesión y también tiene una pequeña tienda D. abarrotes, ella está deseando implementar su tienda con útiles escolares,  la socia desea invertir en la compra D. útiles escolares tales como lapiceros, borradores, tajadores, reglas, tijeras, cuadernos, vinifan, cinta maskin, entre otros más. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. útiles escolares.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is a member of the "Nueva Victoria - Chinchero" community bank which is located in Chinchero district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Guadalupe is 54 years old, married, and has 3 children.  One of her children lives independently and the other two are 17 years old and 1 year old.  Guadalupe is a teacher by profession and also owns a small grocery store.  She would like to stock her store with school supplies.  She would like to invest in buying school supplies such as pens, erasers, pencil sharpeners, rulers, scissors, exercise books, Vinifan products, masking tape, etc.  She is requesting this loan to invest in buying school supplies.

Guadalupe is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy school supplies

loans.name: Erisa

texts.en: Erisa is a hardworking married man with four children, living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has been trading in coffee for five years now. The business is promising as he has been able to buy land from coffee savings. He has the hardship of the crop being seasonal, and his dream is to set up a coffee store. Erisa intends to use this loan to buy coffee sell.

loans.use: To buy coffee to sell.

loans.name: Roderick

texts.en:
Roderick N. A. is 46, married and has five children in school. He is able to raise his children with the income he gets from his workshop where he makes metal doors and windows. He employs three people to help him in his tasks. He also rents out houses for extra income to meet his family’s needs.

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has managed to expand his business, thus increasing his number of customers. He has requested 80,000 KES to buy iron sheets. He aspires to operate a big company in the future.

loans.use: To buy iron sheets

loans.name: Amma

texts.en:
Amma is 26 years old and lives in the area of Congo Town. She’s single and also a high school graduate. With little income coming in from her partner who sells gasoline at a mini service station, she was determined to make their lives better by starting up a small provisions shop. Amma has been in this business for a year now, and she enjoys the flow of her customers.

Amma is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, etc., so as to enable her mini provisions store to become a bigger one. Her dream is to become an accountant in the nearest future.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, etc.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza D. is from the city of Gala Ozamiz City. She is 40 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. Liza has a banana plantation. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2008, Liza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Liza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Liza is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to finance banana farms maintenance and to purchase fertilizer like manure. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Liza from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC: 

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of banana farms and to purchase fertilizer like manure

loans.name: Claridad Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CLARIDAD” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Santiago II, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Carola. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de DVD, auxiliar de secretaría, tienda, costura, venta de dulces, venta de comida, tienda, comercio, tejido, librería, costura.

La señora Carola,  indica que este es el segundo año que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su mamá. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta costura de deportivos, que inicio hace 2 años atrás y que aprendió de su hermana.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de tela), que compraran por mayor de la ceja y los venderán día por medio por las mañanas y por las tardes con la ayuda de su hermana. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación
texts.en:
The "Claridad", or "Clarity" Communal Bank is about to begin it's first loan cycle with [field partner] Pro Mujer. It is part of the Centro Santiago II Group, composed of 11 mmbers and headed by a board of directors lead by Señora Carola. The group members are building a variety of bussinesses, and among them we have: DVD sales, secretarial support, a shop, selling sweets, selling food, dressmaking, weaving, sales, and a bookstore.

Señora Carola says that this is her second year of working with Pro Mujer, having come in at the invitation of her mother, At present she has a business making and selling sportswear, which she started 2 years back and which she learned from her sister.
 
The loan she is seeking is to increase her working capital by buying cloth, which she buys wholesale in La Ceja and sells at retail each morning and afternoon, with the help of her sister. This type of work enables her to generate income to support her family as much as possible, as she is married adn has 4 children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she states that she likes the training they give.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Mairamkul's Group

texts.en:
Mairamkul, 43, is the leader of this group. She was married 23 years ago and brought up a big family of five children. She resides in the village of Tup, which is hidden in the picturesque scenery of the Kyrgyz mountains. Families that live in this remote area follow the basic Kyrgyz nomadic lifestyle. Livestock is a big asset for the local farmers.

Mairamkul was gifted by her parents with a horse, which has been very helpful to her husband in the fields, and a cow to start a dairy business. Ten years of intensive work has led to 3,000 KGS monthly, and it has allowed Mairamkul to start construction on a house and shed for livestock.

Mairamkul hopes her group will be granted a loan, with her portion to be spent on purchasing five lambs for breeding. She looks forward to spending her profits on her house and a warehouse to store crops. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase five lambs for breeding.

loans.name: Fikret

texts.en:
Fikret is a 39-year-old man who runs his own business. Fikret works with plastic and makes doors and windows.  He started his business in 2001 and during this period of time he has gained respect among his clients and now his is overloaded with orders and working all day till late in the night. Love for his child is a motivating strength, pushing Fikret to work even harder and increase his income. 

Fikret has been an active and strongly motivated client of AqroInvest CU since 2008 and has been successful. Now he has applied for a 1500 AZN loan in order to purchase more materials and hire a new assistant to help him with orders.

loans.use: to purchase more materials and hire a new assistant.

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buying & selling of crabs business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 22,000, through NWTF, to buy more stock of crabs to sell for her buying & selling of crabs business.

Lenie has been in this business for 6 years. She earns more income from fishing. Lenie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of crabs to sell.

loans.name: Richard K

texts.en:
Richard is 28 years old, has four children, and lives in Kanungu District. He is a market trader selling produce and cereals. His business is located in a daily market of Kihihi. He proudly says he has a great number of customers that includes nearby schools and the town council population. Richard, who has spent seven years in his business, attributes his success to the freshness of his produce, trust that his customers have invested in him, and the availability of produce. Richard is able to meet the daily demands of his customers due to the constant supplies he gets. He also ventured in alcohol sales that has been very critical in increasing his profits. 

In the future, Richard plans to expand his businesses and educate his children to higher levels. This is Richard's first loan from Pearl and Kiva and he hopes for the best outcome although his first capital was from a loan through a local Savings and Credit Organization (SACCO). With the Kiva loan, Richard intends to use his hard-working spirit to expand his business by purchasing more cereals for resale.

loans.use: To buy more cereals for increased stock and resale.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 39 años, es una mujer amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Para María el negocio de venta de ropa ha sido una actividad que le ha ayudado a obtener los ingresos necesarios para poder ayudar en la economía de su hogar, ella lleva ya casi cuatro años en este negocio que lo realiza entre sus amigos y familiares. Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y considera que lo más difícil es tener que caminar a la casa de sus clientes para poder ofrecer sus productos, pero sabe que así es el trabajo y que tiene que cumplirlo. Espera con el tiempo tener un puesto de ropa en el mercado mayorista que esta en construcción, ya que una de sus metas es poder comprar un stand en dicho mercado. Este es el sexto crédito con MFP y espera poder seguir trabajando de la manera que lo ha estado haciendo ya que hasta ahora no tiene problemas con el grupo y espera seguir así. Con los 2000 soles que solicitó, traerá más ropa y comprará productos de catalogo para tener en stock.
texts.en:
María, 39, is a kind, hard working woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband and three children that she wants to provide a better quality of life for.  For María, selling clothes has been an activity that has helped her earn the necessary income to help her household’s economy.  She’s been in business for almost four years, a business she carries out among her friends and family members.  What she most enjoys about it is being able chat with her customers and considers the most difficult part having to walk from house to house to sell her products but she knows that that’s how this work is and she has to do it.  In time, she hopes to have a stand in the wholesale market that’s under construction to sell her clothes and one of her goals is to be able to purchase one of the stands in said market.

This is her 6th loan with MFP and she hopes to continue to work the way she’s been doing since, to date, she’s had no problems with her communal bank and expects to continue that way.  She will use the requested 2000 new soles to bring more clothes and to buy catalogue items to have in stock.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Budumbuli Women's Group

texts.en:
Aisha is 32 years old and a happily married mother of four. She participated in apprentice tailoring training before she conceived the idea of starting her own tailoring enterprise. She sews and sells most of the clothes she makes and plies her business in Jinja. She was previously engaged in small-scale farming.

Aisha has had her business for 6 years now, and her weekly sales revenue is to the tune of 120,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX). She intends to use her Kiva loan to purchase an electric sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase an electric sewing machine
